loans.name: Sandra

texts.es: Sandra es madre de 3 hijos y su principal prioridad es que culminen sus estudios, ella es docente de primaria, también cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo. Sandra ha venido haciéndole mejoras a su vivienda con muchos esfuerzos, requiere de este crédito para comprar materiales de construcción para realizar embaldosado del piso del porche que no ha podido culminar por falta de recursos económicos disponibles.
texts.en: Sandra is mother to three children and her main priority is that they finish their education. She is a primary school teacher. She also has the economic support of her husband. Sandra has been making improvements to her house, with a lot of effort. She needs this loan to buy construction materials in order to complete the tiling of the porch floor which she has not been able to finish due to lack of available financial resources.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand and stone tiles.

loans.name: Madhabi

texts.en:
Madhabi, a young, energetic lady of 22 years, is from the small town of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri. She lives with her husband. She has completed her education until XII (grade 12). 

Madhabi rears cows and sells their dairy products to the market. Her husband is associated with agricultural work. Though they both are the earning members of the family, their earning is insufficient for them. 

Madhabi decided to grow her business by purchasing one more cow and selling more dairy products to the market for making more profit for her family. This business is profitable for her because there is a lot of demand for dairy products in her area.  Due to lack of money she couldn’t buy more cows and was unable to grow her business so she decided to take loan. With this loan amount she will buy one dairy cow.

With the profit from this business, she wants to build a cattle farm and make her family financially strong. She has been running this business for the last few years so she is experienced in this field and that will help her to earn profit easily. She is very happy for becoming a member of BJS and also she is very much thankful to Kiva for funding her loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to sell dairy products in the market.

loans.name: Javier

texts.es:
Javier, vive en alquiler en la ciudad de La Paz, solo ya que sus hijos son mayores de edad, percibe una renta de jubilacion con la cual se mantiene pero a la vez, realiza trabajos de encuadernacion con lo cual aumenta sus ingresos.

El credito que solicita es para la compra de papel, tela y otros y poder continuar con su negocio de encuadernacion y no perder clientes ya que el trabajo que hace es manual y es muy cotizado. sueño de Javier es poder tener su casita propia.
texts.en:
Javier lives in rented accomodation in the city of La Paz, only since his children are adults. He receives retirement income with which he supports himself but, at the same time, he performs bookbinding work with which he augments his income.

The loan he is requesting is to buy paper, fabric and other items and to be able to continue with his bookbinding business and not lose customers since the work he does is manual and is much in demand. Javier's dream is to be able to have his own little house.

loans.use: to buy paper, fabric and other items for his bookbinding business.

loans.name: Arati

texts.en:
Arati is a 36-year-old housewife who lives with her husband in a small town of Dhupguri. Her husband is a daily van puller. Both of them are illiterate and just know how to sign their names. They have one son and two daughters who are in grade 9, grade 6 and grade 3 respectively.  Arati's husband’s earnings are very small and it is difficult to maintain the family.  

Then Arati came to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and has taken out a loan to purchase a cycle van of her own for carrying people and goods in their locality. A cycle van is a type of carriage using a bicycle. Now her husband is pulling their cycle van and earns more than previously.  Their future dream is to buy more cycle vans which will be used on a hire basis. Her full thanks go to BJS as well as Kiva for giving the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a cycle van for carrying people and goods.

loans.name: Swapna

texts.en:
Swapna is a courageous woman who is 46 years old and comes from Dhupguri, Jalpaiguri District. She has a husband and two children in her family. One of them is a student in grade 11 and the other one has passed higher secondary. Swapna dreams that her children will get a proper education and become responsible and good citizens. 

She has been involved in animal husbandry for many years, selling different animals in the market. Her husband is involved in selling firewood in their locality, with an inconsistent income. Swapna heard about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and took out a loan to purchase a cow for her business. She wants to build  up a large husbandry business with many animals.  In the future she wishes to become a good entrepreneur and wants to purchase a bus. She is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva because in her bad days, BJS came forward to help her and she has seen the light of prosperity.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase plastic slippers to sell

loans.name: Saturnina Zoila

texts.es: Zoila se dedica a la venta de chompas para niños, bebes, damas y caballeros a pedido del cliente y también vende los domingos en una feria sabatina. Ya son varios años que tiene el negocio y le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar materiales como por ejemplo hilos, telas, lana y otras cosas más que se necesitan.
texts.en: Zoila is dedicated to selling sweaters for children, babies, women and men ordered by customers and also she sells on Sundays in a "Saturday market." She has already had her business for many years and it is going well. At this time, she needs the loan to buy materials like, for example, thread, fabric, wool, and other items she needs.

loans.use: to buy materials like, for example, thread, fabric, wool and other items that she needs.

loans.name: Jorge Israel

texts.es: Jorge es un empresario de éxito tiene 33 años de edad, casado, padre de un hijo menor, su negocio es una pulpería en su domicilio desde hace 4 años consecutivos, de ser cliente de la institución tiene 1 año. Su negocio lo inicio vendiendo gaseosas en su domicilio. Este crédito lo invertirá en la compra de productos como arroz. Frijoles, azúcar, aceite en bidón, jabón de baño, jabón de lavar ropa, medicamentos populares, carne de cerdo, carne de res, carne de pollo, carne molida, productos lácteos, papel higiénico, sal, leña, sopas maggi etc.
texts.en: Jorge is a successful entrepreneur who is 33 years old, married and father to a young child. His business is a grocery store in his house which he's had for four consecutive years. He has been a client of the institution for one year. He began his business selling sodas from his house. This loan will be invested in the purchase of products like rice, beans, sugar, oil in a can, bathing soap, clothes washing soap, popular medicines, pork, beef, chicken, ground meat, dairy products, toilet paper, salt, wood, Maggi soups, etc.

loans.use: to buy products like rice, beans, sugar, oil in a can, bathing soap, clothes washing soap, popular medicines, pork, beef, chicken, ground meat, dairy products, toilet paper, salt, wood, Maggi soups, etc.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a married man with one child. For the past two years, he has operated a motorcycle transport business. Daniel describes himself to be stable and his biggest business challenge is the lack of funds. 

Daniel is requesting a 27,000 KES loan to a buy a water storage facility to enable his family to store clean water for domestic use. He will also buy spare parts for his motorcycle. Daniel hopes that he will be successful in the future.

loans.use: buy a water storage facility for his family and to buy spare parts for his motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Natividad

texts.es: Maria Natividad se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de anticuchos. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. Ella solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar los anticuchos como carne, aceite y papas.
texts.en: María Natividad continues with her business, a food stall that sells 'anticuchos', a popular dish consisting of grilled, skewered meat served with potatoes. She has been in business for several years and everything is going very well. She asks for a loan in order to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare the food she sells, namely meat, cooking oil, and potatoes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to prepare food to sell.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be passionate. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She also owns a farm where she grows crops. She describes her family challenge to be the inaccessibility of water. 

She will use the 38,250 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy a water pump. This will enable her to pump water to her farm to enable her to do farming. This will also benefit four family members. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. 

This is her 12th loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans worth 100,000  KES were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water pump for her farm and family

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en:
Duncan is a 25-year-old single man. He describes himself to be motivated. He operates a retail business where he sells household items. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

He will use the14,500 KES (Kenyan shillings) loan to buy a gas cooker. This will enable his family to cook efficiently. He hopes that in the future, he will have a happy family. This is his third loan with SMEP DTM. A previous loan of 20,000 KES was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco de 27 años de edad,  estudio hasta cuarto grado,  está acompañado y es padre de dos hijos menores de edad, aun no estudian su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos,  él trabaja como jornalero en el ingenio por temporadas; desde hace 8 años trabaja la agricultura y necesita el dinero para pagar el alquiler de la tierra, comprar abono y pagar máquina para arar la tierra. 

Él va  a sembrar frijol y maíz ya que en muchas ocasiones lo ha hecho y a mejorado su calidad de vida y piensa que será mejor cada año,  sueña con que sus hijos aprendan a trabajar y estudien para que tengan un mejor futuro y piensa lograrlo con el apoyo de los créditos que se le otorguen.
texts.en:
Francisco is 27 years old. He finished fourth grade. He is married and is father to two young children who are not yet in school. His wife is dedicated to house work. He works as a seasonal laborer at the mill. For eight years he has worked in farming and needs the money to pay to rent land, to buy fertilizer and to pay for a machine to plow the land.

He is going to plant beans and maize since, on many occasions, he has made it and it has improved his quality of life and he thinks it'll be better each year. He dreams that his children learn to work and study so they can have a better future and he thinks he can achieve this with the support of the loans granted to him.

loans.use: to pay for the rent of the land, to buy fertilizer and to pay for a machine to plow the land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks, and soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and general stock for resale.

loans.name: Anamika

texts.en:
Anamika, age 44, and her husband, Heramva, age 50, are from a small town of Dhupguri in Jalpaiguri. They have two children, and both of them are studying in school. She has her own animal husbandry and her husband is associated with agricultural work. Her husband’s business is not so much profitable for them to run their family. 

Anamika decided to help her husband by earning money for her family. She decided to purchase a dairy cow for herself and sell milk in the market to start earning for her family. She chooses this business because in her area, demand for the milk is very high, so it’s a profitable business for her.

Her future dream is to build her cattle business on her own, where they can sell the milk on a large scale. 

Anamika is a hardworking woman. She is very much grateful to BJS and Kiva for funding her loan and helping her to start her new business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to sell milk in the market.

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
Gladys is in her mid-40s. She is married and she has children. For the last three years, she has made her living by selling rice and beans, cooked together and called '"waakye." This food is very tasteful and it is enjoyed by everybody in the community. She opens her business from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily, and is able to make a respectable profit each month. 

This will be her second loan request, which she will use to buy rice and beans to cook and sell to her customers. With the previous loan, which was paid back successfully, she invested the money into the same trade.

She managed her business well and earned a good profit. She used the profit to take care of her household expenses and saved some with the microfinancer. She dreams that one day, she will be able to build a big house. 

She will share this loan with her group member, Olivia, who sells "banku" and stew, another local food. They will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: To buy rice and beans to cook and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en: Lydiah is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be intelligent. She operates a retail business where she sells household items. She describes her family challenge to be poor drainage. Lydiah will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy a water tank and add stock of items she sells. The water tank will enable her family to store clean water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future she will buy a piece of land. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy a water tank and add stock of items

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima is 27 years old and her husband is 29 years old. Both of them earn by cultivating different crops in the field. Both of them have received education up to class VI (grade 6). They have one child who is receiving a primary education. From the very beginning Purnima has had many problems to run a family. Due to lack of capital, it was not possible for them to buy different seeds for cultivation. 

For this reason they have taken out a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) so that they can buy wheat seeds and fertilizers for cultivation. Both of them dream of giving a bright future to their child so that their child can become established in life and when Purnima and her husband become old, their child will look after them. They hope that the loan that they have taken will help them in their business and they will have high profits with which they can build a concrete house for themselves.
 
Purnima thanks BJS and Kiva for the great support.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of wheat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Kunti

texts.en:
Kunti is a 25-year-old married woman and the mother of two children (one son and one daughter).  She, her husband and their children all belong to a small village in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri. She completed her primary education, whereas her husband attended school up to grade 8. One of her children goes to school and the other is too small to go to school. Kunti is a housewife and her husband runs a poultry farm. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all their household expenses.  Their children are deprived of basic needs due to their poverty.  Kunti assists her husband in the poultry farm.

At present, the poultry farm business is not in good condition, as they lack capital to expand the farm.  Kunti heard about Kiva's partner BJS and that the organization helps rural women, and she applied for a loan.

With the loan money she will buy more chicks, chicken feed and medicine for her poultry farm, so that she can earn more profit from this business.  She is much interested to expand this business because after the growth of their chicks, they can sell them to their neighbors and to meat shops in the local market and earn a profit easily. As her husband is more experienced in this field, it will help her to run the business smoothly.

At present, she is living in a kachha house (made of straw, bamboo and mud), but she hopes that she will be able to build a concrete house for her family, with the profit from their business.

She thanks Kiva and BJS for funding the loan.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chicken feed for their existing poultry farm.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a  Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be polite. He operates a retail business where he sells bread, sugar, soap and other household items. He describes his family challenge to be getting access to clean water. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water tank and add to his stock of foodstuffs. The water tank will enable his family to store clean water for domestic use. He hopes that in the future he will add more stock to sell. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and add to his stock of foodstuffs

loans.name: Sahida

texts.en:
Sahida is 55 years old and is a widow.  She lives with her only son in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is illiterate and can only sign her name. She has to work hard to give financial assistance to her family. Sahida works as a daily labourer, with an inconsistent income.  Her only son got involved in farming seasonable vegetables on their own farmland after his father's death.  He sells the vegetables in the local market, but he is unable to earn sufficient income for his family.

Day by day their financial condition is going down although they are striving to meet the family's basic needs.

Sahida wishes to grow potatoes to generate more income. They have their own land and her son has experience in the agricultural field.  This is the main reason for choosing this business. She knows that this is a profitable business and they will be able to generate more profit.

Sahida has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS to buy potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes. She hopes they can upgrade their living condition by the profit generated from this business.

She aspires to purchase a cycle van in future with the profit from her business and rent it out as another means of income.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for standing beside her to fight against poverty.

loans.use: To purchase potato seeds and fertilizers for growing potatoes.

loans.name: Nurnehar

texts.en:
Nurnehar is 48 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two sons in the small village of Baroghoria in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She studied up to grade 6.  Her husband, Kacchiruddin, aged 50, is illiterate and a farmer by profession. Their two sons go to college.

As a main source of income for the family, Nurnehar's husband works hard in their agribusiness. He gives his hard labour from dawn to dusk to grow good-quality vegetables and sells them in the local market. Yet, he can't give sufficient financial sustenance to the family. 

As an additional source of income, Nurnehar is engaged in an animal husbandry business. Thanks to her hard work, she now has one dairy cow and two sheep. She sells the cow’s milk in her locality, and thus helps her husband to run the family.

With the aim of further developing her homestead, she has taken a loan from BJS to purchase one more dairy cow. More cows mean more milk. She plans to start a milk products business (milk, butter, paneer, curd, etc.) with the milk, which she hopes will help her to generate more income.

Nurnehar plans to invest her income in her sons' higher education and further propagation of the quantity of the domestic animals.

Her full thanks go to her lenders (BJS and Kiva) for standing by her side.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow for expanding her existing business.

loans.name: Petronilla

texts.en: Petronilla is a  Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be a serious business lady. She operates a retail business where she sells bread, soap, spinach and other items. She describes her family challenge to be her expensive source of cooking. She will use the Kes 24,000 loan to buy a gas cooker. This will enable her family of four to cook efficiently. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a gas cooker

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and a variety of food containers to expand her business.

loans.name: Alisa

texts.en:
Alisa is a teacher, living in Gyumri town with her daughter. Alisa teaches at two schools which are located not far from Gyumri town. She teaches English and works hard to satisfy her students' needs. 

Alisa also provides personal lessons from her house and, because of her good knowledge and kind attitude, she has a good number of students. 

Now, this hard-working teacher asks for financial support, to be able to purchase teaching supplies (e.g., books, notebooks), a computer, and a printer. These will be a huge support for Alisa and her work will become more effective.

Alisa has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for teaching supplies (e.g., books, notebooks), a computer, and a printer for teaching children.

loans.name: Agar

texts.es:
Agar, vive en anticretico en la ciudad de La Paz, trabaja como bibliotecaria por las tardes todos los dias y algunos por la noche y percibe un sueldo que le permite mantener a su familia.

El credito que solicita es para continuar con su tratamiento medico bucal, ya que ella se cayo hace poco y se destrozo todos los dientes por lo tanto no puede comer ningun alimento ya que le produce dolor de estomago ya que no mastica bien.
 
El sueño de Agar es que sus hijos sean profesinales.
texts.en:
Agar lives in the city of La Paz in an antichresis rental arrangement.  She works as a librarian every afternoon and some evenings, and receives a salary that allows her to support her family.

Agar's requesting the loan to continue with her dental treatment.  She fell recently and damaged her teeth.  She can't eat because she's unable to chew well, so she gets a stomach ache.

Agar's dream is that her children will be professionals.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment

loans.name: Aliyar

texts.en:
Aliyar is 58 years old, married, and has three children. He lives in Alixanli village of Fuzuli region. Aliyar is an Internally Displaced Person from Fuzuli City. He has been in the animal breeding business for many years. He buys young calves, raises them and sells to a butcher at local bazaar. 

Aliyar requested a loan from Komak for 1,900 Azerbaijan New Manat, which he will use to buy young calves to increase his business.

loans.use: to purchase young calves

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos is 52 years old and comes from the town of Corella, Bohol. He is married with two children ages 17 and 28. For 22 years now, Carlos has been a coconut farmer and also collects coconut wine to sell for a profit. He is asking for a loan to buy more coconut wine to sell in the community. His income has been instrumental in sending his child to school. 

In the future, he hopes to be successful in giving his child a good education.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine

loans.name: Arusyak

texts.en:
Arusyak lives in Gyumri town with her husband and two children. Her husband is a migrant worker in a neighboring country and works there to support his family financially. Arusyak takes care of her two school-aged children and provides manicure service to locals. In the house where she lives with her children, Arusyak separated off a work room for herself. She receives her clients there and provides them with different types of manicure services. 

The income that she earns is very important for her family's living, as her husband does not send financial support regularly. So to improve her working conditions and provide better quality service to her clients, she has applied for this loan. Arusyak has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of the work room and purchase supplies for providing manicure service

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Badeya Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BADEYA sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  29 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités. Elles sont à leur premier prêt. 
Mme MAMINE (2eme sur la photo de la gauche à la droite) compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 3 colis de condiments.Elle s’approvisionne à KOLONDIEBA.
Mme MAMINE à une clientèle composée de femmes.Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant et parfois à crédit.Sa vente se fait à KOLONDIEBA 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group BADEYA are married women, who average 29 years of age and four children each, all living in polygamous families in KOLONDIEBA, a prefecture in the 3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali. The women are collaborating with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to carry out their work. They are on their first loan.

Ms. MAMINE (second from the left in the photo) intends to use her loan to purchase 3 packets of condiments. She gets her supplies from KOLONDIEBA and makes her sales to a customer base composed of women paying with cash and sometimes credit, in KOLONDIEBA. She plans on making a monthly profit of 20,000 francs CFA that will enable her to pay back the loan and also to help out her husband in covering day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy kale and potatoes

loans.name: Serieux Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Serieux  est majoritairement composé de monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le  commerce de pâtes d’arachides, vêtements et  produits cosmétiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Oumou (femme debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande renommée dans la vente des pâtes d’arachides de qualité dans tout quartier. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 sacs de grains  d’arachides à  Médine Bamako. Pour faire la pâte d’arachide, on trie les meilleurs grains, les grille, les épluches et les Broie au moulin. La pâte ainsi obtenue est prête à la vente en détail à une  clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Oumou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité.
texts.en:
The group Serieux is composed mostly of monogamous women, who average 35 years of age and four children each, all living in Kanadjiguila. The women know one another through community ties and do commerce in peanut butter, clothing, and cosmetic products. With the goal of increasing their business capital, the group members decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Oumou, (the woman standing at the far right in the photo) is famous for selling quality peanut butter in any neighborhood. She intends to use her loan to purchase 4 sacks of peanuts in Médine Bamako. To make peanut butter, the best peanuts are sorted, roasted, shelled, and crushed in a mill. The paste is thus obtained and is ready for retail sale to a customer base composed mostly of women. With this loan, Ms. Oumou hopes to make a monthly profit of 50,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business.

loans.use: to purchase peanuts

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les six membres du groupe Benkadi ont en moyenne 37 ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kanadjiguila et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu au marché de Kanadjiguila. Les membres du groupe font le commerce de condiments (tomates, choux, aubergines, etc) et d’habits. Dans le but de pérenniser leur petit commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Kadia (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments.  Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 4 corbeilles de tomates, 4 sacs de choux à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Kanadjiguila à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Kadia compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 60 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married for the most part in monogamous households, the six members of the group Benkadi average 37 years of age and six children each, all living in Kanadjiguila. The women know one another through ties of community and their revenue-generating businesses at the Kanadjiguila market. The group members do commerce in condiments (tomatoes, cabbages, eggplant, etc.) and clothing. With the goal of making their small-scale businesses sustainable, they decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their third solidarity loan cycle.

Ms. Kadia, (the woman sitting at the far right in the photo) is a major vendor of condiments. She intends to use her loan to purchase 4 baskets of tomatoes and 4 sacks of cabbage in Bamako. Sales are made retail to a customer base composed mostly of women in Kanadjiguila. Ms. Kadia hopes to make a monthly profit of 60,000 francs CFA that will be used for reinvesting in her business and meeting various needs at home.

loans.use: to purchase condiments, such as tomatoes and eggplant, to sell

loans.name: Rosibel

texts.es: Rosibel, tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 5 hijos y vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Ella tiene cuatro años de dedicarse al comercio, vende lociones, cremas, fijadores para cabello, ropa interior para hombres y mujeres, y todo tipo de cosméticos. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y por encargos. El préstamo que solicita es por 5,000 lempiras y los invertirá en la compra de ropa interior para damas y caballeros y lociones, aprovechara unas ofertas para revender y poder ganar más. Su meta es lograr que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y luego arreglar su casa.
texts.en:
Rosibel is 36 years old, married and has 5 children. She lives in the town of Choloma in the department of Cortes. She has been a merchant for four years. She sells lotions, creams, hair gels, underwear for men and women and all kinds of cosmetics. She is a street vendor and also takes orders.

She is requesting a loan for 5,000 HNL and will use it to purchase underwear for ladies and gentlemen and lotions. She will take advantage of some resale offers that will enable her to earn more. Her goal is for her children to finish their studies and then to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase lotions and underwear for ladies and gentlemen to re-sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more onions for resale.

loans.name: Marta Isabel

texts.es: Marta, tiene 40 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Hace 10 años inicio con su propio negocio para generar otros ingresos a su hogar, vende cremas, lociones, ropa como camisas, blusas, faldas, vestidos y otros. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y por pedidos. Lleva tres ciclos de prestamos, actualmente solicita 17,000 lempiras para surtir su negocio de mercadería como ropa para damas, caballeros y niños y cosméticos con el propósito de aumentar las ventas. Su sueño es darles un buen estudio a sus hijos y tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Marta is 40 years old, married and has two children. She lives in the town of Azacualpa in the department of Santa Barbara. She started her own business 10 years ago in order to earn additional household income. She sells creams, lotions and clothing, such as shirts, blouses, skirts, dresses and other items. She is a street vendor and also sells on order. 

She has participated in three loan cycles. Currently she is requesting 17,000 HNL in order to stock her business with merchandise, such as clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children and cosmetics, with the goal of increasing sales. Her dream is to provide a good education for her children and to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to stock her business with merchandise, such as clothing for ladies, gentlemen and children and cosmetics.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 29 years old, from the community of Loay, Bohol. She is married, with one son who is six years old. 

Vilma has owned a sari-sari store for a year now. She sells seasonings, condiments, chips, cookies, canned goods, and noodles. 

She is asking for a loan to buy more stocks of soft drinks and wine, as well as wood for house renovation.

She hopes that, someday, she can manage her business well, so it will turn out to be a success.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of soft drinks and wine, as well as wood for house renovation.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora lives with her husband and two children, who are 18 and 16 years old. Her husband is a taxi driver and Flora provides hairdressing services. She works at local beauty salon and also from her house. She receives clients at home and provides them with high-quality service. Flora is requesting a loan to buy materials and tools that will help her provide better-quality work to clients (chairs, tools, sink). She is requesting this loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International. The program provides business start-up loans with lenient conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to traditional credit products. The loan will be a big boost to Flora, who will be very grateful to lenders for their support.

loans.use: to pay for supplies to provide hairdressing services (chairs, tools, sink)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, toothpaste and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be faithful. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 33,380 loan to buy a water tank. This will enable her family to store clean water for domestic use. 

She hopes that in the future, she will give her family a good life.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more plastic slippers for resale.

loans.name: Marina Asucena

texts.es: Marina, tiene 34 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 4 hijos, vive en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes.  Ella lleva más de dos años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa nueva como blusas, jeans para damas y caballeros, cosméticos de productos AVON como cremas, lociones, desodorantes, tintes, etc. Sus ventas las realiza de manera ambulante. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 5,500 Lempiras para comprar ropa nueva como camisas, pantalones, jean, blusas etc. y cumplir con los pedidos pendientes. Su meta es crecer con su negocio de ropa y piensa vender comidas los fines de semana para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Marina is 34 years old, married and has four children. She lives in the town of Choloma in the department of Cortes. For over two years, she has been selling new clothing, such as tops and jeans for ladies and gentlemen and Avon products, such as ceams, lotions, deodorants and dyes, etc. She is a street vendor.

She has requested a loan of 5,500 HNL in order to buy new clothing, such as shirts, pants, jeans, tops, etc. and to fill pending orders. Her goal is for her clothing business to grow and she also plans to sell meals on weekends in order to help her husband with their children’s educational expenses.

loans.use: to purchase new clothing such as shirts, pants, jeans, blouses, etc. and to fill pending orders.

loans.name: Ekome Feemo-3 Group

texts.en:
These entrepreneurs are members of the group called Ekome Feemo-3 and are on their fifth loan cycles. Elizabeth lives and works in the city of Accra-Teshie. Her main job is hairdressing and also selling perfume, creams, wigs, shampoo and conditioners and she has been doing this job for eight years. She is 49 years old, married and has children. 

Elizabeth (standing in the photograph, first from the right) is a very hard-working and enterprising woman who helps her family to get ahead. She needs the loan in order to purchase perfume, creams, wigs, shampoo and conditioners. The other members have businesses selling candies, metal cooking bowls and brown flour. The members are grateful to those who are part of this dream through the site and they are committed to making their repayments of the total loan request of GHS 3200 on time.

loans.use: to purchase perfume, creams, wigs, shampoo and conditioners.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase palm oil and cooking seasonings for resale.

loans.name: Corazón De Jesús  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Corazón de Jesús está formado por 8 socias y 1 socio, quienes son personas muy amables y alegres, trabajadoras quienes con el esfuerzo del día a día buscan mejorar la economía de sus hogares, viven en la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca donde su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, a la agricultura y mucha de su gente ha migrado a varios lugares del mundo en busca de mejores trabajos.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Alexandra, se encuentra realizando su primer crédito a lado de sus amigas y compañeras del grupo de crédito Corazón de Jesús, ha sido invitada a este hermoso grupo por su suegra y espera que los créditos le ayuden en su negocio para salir adelante.
La Señora Alexandra tiene 25 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 8, 7 años y su ultimo hijo de  10 meses de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en una escuelita de la localidad, su esposo labora en un taller de carpintería, la casa en la que vive es de sus suegros con quienes comparte los gastos del hogar.
Doña Alexandra trabaja de lunes a viernes como empleada domestica ocho horas diarias, en su casa se dedica a la crianza de pollos y ganado, estas actividades le dan la oportunidad de mejorar la economía de su hogar al mismo tiempo que pasa en casa con sus hijos. El dinero de su crédito va a  invertir en la compra de pollos. Su meta es de tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
There are 8 women and one man in the Corazón de Jesús communal bank. They are happy, friendly and hard-working people who work each day to improve their economic situation . They live in the parish of Valle in Cuenca, where people work in animal husbandry and agriculture, and where many have migrated to other places in the world in search of better work.

One of the female members of the group is Alexandra, who is asking for her first loan along with her friends and companions in the Corazón de Jesús group. She was invited to join this marvellous group by her mother-in-law, and she hopes that the loans will help them progress with their businesses.

Alexandra is 25, married, and has three children of 7 years of age, 8 years of age, and an 8-month-old son. Her two older children go to a small school in the neighbourhood. Her husband works in a carpentry workshop. The house where she lives belong to her parents-in-law, with whom she shares the household costs.

Alexandra works eight hours a day from Monday to Friday in domestic service. At home she works at raising chickens and livestock. These jobs give her the opportunity of improving her household finances whilst at the same time spending time at home with her children. She will invest the money from the loan in buying chickens. Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Wycliffe's Group

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a member of this group in Webuye District. He is pictured here in a group of five One Acre Fund farmers, each of whom is a group leader. The group leaders represent a total of 52 individual One Acre Fund farmers, who are not pictured here. Wycliffe has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented by this group are each receiving inputs to grow ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Wycliffe is 32 years old and has been a farmer for 11 years. He works as a farmer to provide for his five children. The community and other farmers know Wycliffe as an experienced and hardworking farmer. Other than farming, he is also involved in community groups such as the men's group and a savings group. Wycliffe described his harvest last year as good, but he hopes he can have an even better one this season, with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.

Wycliffe joined One Acre Fund in 2008, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. He joined One Acre Fund so that he could learn new farming methods. Because he is an active community member, he has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Wycliffe's life, because he received training and was able to feed the family. In the future, he hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to invest in a business.

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seed and fertilizer, when prices are low, and passes the cost savings on to the farmers. Wycliffe and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover the initial cost of purchasing the seed and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season, to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to purchase cost-efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cloth materials

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 49-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be visionary and productive. 

She operates a retail business where she sells foodstuffs and other household items. She also owns a farm where she grows fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her farm is located in a productive and fertile place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

She will use the KES 13,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This will benefit three family members. 

She hopes that in the future, she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Akouavi

texts.fr:
Akouavi est une femme mariée, mère d’un enfant. Elle habite vakpossito, un quartier de Lomé Capital du Togo. Couturière de formation depuis 2006, Akouavi  coud des habits qu’elle vend à la devanture de son domicile. 
Actuellement elle lui manque une machine à surfilage afin qu'elle soit totalement dépendante des autres ateliers de surfilage.
Dans l’optique de renforcer son activité, elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter une machine de surfilage ce qui la permettra non seulement de gagner en temps et de faire des économies mais aussi l’achat de cette machine sera pour elle une seconde activité génératrice de revenu.
texts.en:
Akouavi is a married woman and a mother of one child. She lives in Vakpossito, a district in Lomé, the capital of Togo. A seamstress by training since 2006, she sews clothing which she sells in front of her home. She currently lacks an overcasting sewing machine, such that she is totally dependent on other overcasting shops. 

With the aim of bolstering her business, she is requesting this loan to purchase an overcasting machine. It will not only enable her to earn money over time and to save some of it, but also the purchase of this machine will be a second business for her.

loans.use: to purchase an overcasting sewing machine

loans.name: Bubaisha

texts.ru: Бубайша 53 года, замужем, многодетная мама вместе с супругом воспитывают 6 детей. У Бубайши - среднее образование, по характеру очень пунктуальная, корректна в общении, имеет большой опыт работы в сельском хозяйстве, знает всю технологию животноводства. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бубайша занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 33 года назад, с 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бубайши, на сегодняшний день в ее хозяйстве имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 12 овец, 2,04 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает помидоры, перцы, огурцы, капуста, дыня, арбузы для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации, также имеется парник на дому. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бубайша обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом -на покупку удобрений для обработки земли. Доходы от кредита Бубайша планирует вложить в строительство нового помещения для скота.
texts.en: Bubaisha is 53 years old, married and has a large family - she and her husband are raising 6 children. Bubaisha has a secondary education. She is very punctual, good at communication and has a lot of work experience in agriculture, knowing all of the techniques of animal husbandry.  To provide the primary income for her family, Bubaisha is involved in farming and animal husbandry, having started 33 years ago with a purchase of livestock with 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, today her business contains 3 dairy cows, 12 sheep and 2.04 hectares of land, where she annually grows tomatoes, peppers, cucumbers, cabbage, cantaloupe and watermelons for internal household consumption and sale.  She also has a greenhouse. The monthly income amounts to 12,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Bubaisha requested a loan from the bank "Bai-Tushum" to buy fertilizers for treating the soil. Bubaisha plans to invest the earnings from the loan into building a new space for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for materials for making Armenian bread (lavash) and a heater for the bakery

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 28-year-old single man who has been providing car electrical services for fourteen years. He was only fourteen years old when he started working to support his family. Youssef is the sole breadwinner for the two members of his family. He established his current business in 2012, and he is working hard to develop it as much as he can.

Youssef is acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy a car which he will fix and sell again in order to start up a car sales business which will improve his socioeconomic situation.

He hopes that in the future he can expand his car sales business and open a special used car showroom.

loans.use: to buy a car which he will fix and sell again in order to start a car sales business

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is a 29-year-old single man who works at providing maintenance services in a restaurant where he has been employed for eight years. He is a hard worker, well known in his region with his good reputation and special talents in his domain.

Salah is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to do necessary maintenance to his car which is very important for transporting him to his work since transportation is very hard in his region.

Salah hopes that one day soon he will be able to establish his own restaurant and develop his socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance on his car which is very important for transporting him to his work

loans.name: Angela

texts.es: Doña Angela, tiene 57 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 3 hijos, vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, tiene 11 años de dedicarse a vender mercadería como ser: camisas, pantalones, sandalias, blusas, faldas, pantalones cortos etc. Su forma de vender es ambulante y por encargos. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo que es por 15,000 lempiras para comprar mas productos para vender como ropa (camisas, pantalones, faldas, blusas, etc.) y sandalias. Ella piensa en ampliar su área de mercado a otras comunidades y hacer crecer el negocio para tener mejor nivel de vida.
texts.en: Angela is 57 years old. She is married, has 3 children and lives in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Barbara. She has always been a businesswoman. She has been selling merchandise like shirts, pants, sandals, blouses, skirts, shorts, etc. for 11 years. She sells door-to-door and by order. She is requesting her second loan to purchase more products to sell like clothing (shirts, pants, skirts, blouses, etc.) and sandals. She is thinking of expanding her marketing to other communities to increase her business and have a higher standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more products to sell like clothing (shirts, pants, skirts, blouses, etc.) and sandals.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a 23-year-old single man, who is the sole breadwinner for six members of his beloved family. Alaa has had a convenience store, since he was just fourteen years old. He is a hard worker, who puts so much effort into developing his business, and trying to improve his family's living.

Alaa is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. With the loan, he will increase his business merchandise with specially-released spring and summer beverages. In this way, he hopes to make sure that his income will keep him capable of providing the necessary living needs for the other six members of his beloved family.

Alaa is working hard to keep on developing his store, to turn it into a wide shop filled with every item a customer might ask for.

loans.use: to buy specially-released spring and summer beverages

loans.name: Moudad

texts.en:
Moudad is a 23-year-old single man who has worked as a car mechanic for ten years. He is the sole breadwinner of his family.

Moudad is a hard worker very skilled in his domain, and well known in his region. He is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary car mechanic tools, especially a new released lift that will make his work faster and easier.

He hopes that in the future he will move his business to a better and wider working place to attract more customers and develop his socioeconomic situation.

loans.use: To buy necessary car mechanic tools, especially a new released lift that will make his work faster and easier

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es: Doña Ana, tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera, vive con un hijo en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, hace 10 años que se dedica a la elaboración de manualidades como ser: flores de fommy, muñecas, decoración de bolsas para regalos, retrateras en fommy, tarjetas para toda ocasión y aretes para damas. El negocio lo tiene en su casa. Con el préstamo que solicita de 5,000 lempiras va comprar materia prima como fommy, bolsas, pegamento, y otros para elaborar sus manualidades y vender.  Con la inversión va poder mantener suficiente material para trabajar. Su meta es seguir con el negocio y poder graduar a su hijo.
texts.en:
Doña Ana, 51 years old, is a single mother living with her son in the town of Choloma, Cortes.  She has always worked in sales: for 10 years she has worked to create handicrafts including: flowers of craft foam, dolls, decorations for gift bags, picture frames of craft foam, cards for any occasion and earrings for young women.  

She has the business in her home.  With the loan she is requesting 5,000 lempiras to buy raw materials such as crafting foam, bags, glue, etc. to prepare her handicrafts and sell them.  With the investment she will be able to have enough material to work.  Her goal is to continue with her business and to put her son through school.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like craft foam, bags, glue etc to prepare her handicrafts and sell them.

loans.name: Mwanabibi

texts.en:
Mwanabibi is a 44-year-old woman, married with five children aged 20, 18, 16, 13 and 8 years old, whom she supports. This is her second loan of Ksh. 50,000 and she was introduced to Vision Fund Kenya by the Vision Fund officer. She has a butchery. Her business is located at Gongoni. 

Mwanabibi has been in this business for  seven  years and she earns a monthly income of Ksh10,100. She’s planning to use the loan to purchase more meat to sell to her customers. She will use the profit to expand the business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to sell to her customers

loans.name: Bubikan

texts.ru: Бубукан 56 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Бубукан - среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бубукан занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 29 лет назад, с 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бубукан, на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 дойные коровы, 5 овец, 0,78 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает помидоры, перец, огурцы, капусту, дыню, арбузы для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 11,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бубукан обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом -на покупку удобрений для обработки земли, а также оплату рабочим в обработке и пахоте земли. Доходы от кредита Бубукан планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на обучение младшего сына.
texts.en: Bubikan is 56 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising two children. Bubikan has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Bubikan practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 29 years ago with 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Bubikan's hard work, she currently has 3 milk cows and 5 sheep on her farm, as well as a 0.78 hectare plot of land on which she annually grows tomatoes, peppers, cucumbers, cabbages, melons and watermelons for personal consumption and sale. Her monthly income is 11,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Bubikan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for tilling her land, as well as to pay hired workers to cultivate and till her land. Bubikan plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her youngest son's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay workers to cultivate her land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy toys, handkerchiefs and plastic items

loans.name: Shargiya

texts.en:
Shargiya is 48 years old, married and has four children. Her elder daughter was married last year. Two other children study at university and her youngest child is going to school. Shargiya’s family are IDP-Internally Displaced Persons from occupied territory of Azerbaijan–Fuzuli city. Today they are living at Horadiz village near the war zone. 

Shargiya has been in animal breeding business for eleven years. Previously she took a loan for her business from Kiva and all of it was repaid on time. Today she needs second loan in the amount of 2300 Azerbaijan New Manat. With this loan Shargiya wants to buy hay, chaff, and straw for her cows and vaccinate them. Shargiya is extremely thankful to Kiva and its lenders for the help.

loans.use: to buy hay, chaff, and straw for cows and vaccinate them

loans.name: Tres Barrios De Ccoricancha Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TRES BARRIOS DE CCORICANCHA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Chinchero y departamento de Cusco.

 La socia es la Sra. Valeriana ella es conviviente y tiene 48 años y tiene 6 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de ganados, la socia los hace engordar y crecer a los ganados y luego los vende la socia también se dedica al negocio de agricultura la socia tiene un terreno donde siembra maíz y papa y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias, la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es ampliar su negocio de agricultura. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para su terreno de cultivo.
 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de animales, negocio de venta de artesanía, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “Tres Barrios De Ccoricancha” communal bank which is located in the district of Chinchero, belonging to the Province of Chinchero and the Department of Cusco.

Valeriana is 48 years old, lives in a common-law relationship and has 6 children. She works in her business of raising and selling cattle. She fattens and grows the cows and later sells them. She also farms. She has a plot of land where she grows corn and potatoes which she sells in the various markets. She works from 6 am until 4 pm. Her dream is to expand her farming business.

Valeriana is requesting a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her land. The other members are involved in selling animals, the sale of handicrafts, running a grocery store, and selling meals. Valeriana is grateful to those who form part of this dream through this loan and promises to pay her installments within the required framework.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her land.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 19 years old and is from Akhalkalaki City. She has five family members and her father's income is the important source for the family's welfare. He works as a builder at construction sites and earns 400 GEL a month. 

After finishing high school, Liza started working as a saleswoman in a local store. She is paid insufficiently and works without a rest, but she had great desire and motivation to contribute to her family's financial stability. Liza wants to start her own business and generate more income. Her request was approved with the start up program that enables people to start or re-start businesses. With the requested loan, she will purchase clothing and cosmetics and will start local trading, generating her own income.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Фариде 49 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Фариды - среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Фарида занимается полеводством и животноводством, стартовав 30 лет назад, с 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Фариды, на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная коровы, 1,82 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает помидоры, перец, огурцы, капусту, дыню, арбузы для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации, также на территории дома расположен парник. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Фарида обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом -на покупку удобрений для обработки земли, а также оплату рабочим в обработке и пахоте земли. Доходы от кредита Фарида планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на обучение детей.
texts.en: Farida is 49 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising five children. Farida has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Farida practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 30 years ago with 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Farida's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow on her farm, as well as a 1.82 hectare plot of land on which she annually grows tomatoes, peppers, cucumbers, cabbage, melons and watermelons for personal consumption and sale. She also has a hothouse on the territory surrounding her home. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Farida turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to cultivate her land, as well as to pay hired workers to cultivate and till her land. Farida plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay hired workers to cultivate her land.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different types of biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Eliud's Group

texts.en:
Eliud is a member of this group in Webuye District. He is pictured here in a group of six One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of seventy individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Eliud has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving seeds for one quarter acre of maize and one quarter acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of KES 5,349 for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. 

Eliud is 47 years old and has been a farmer for eleven years. Eliud works as a farmer to provide for his five children. The community and other farmers know Eliud as hardworking and trustworthy. Other than farming, he is also involved in groups in his community, such as the men's group, savings group, and burial committee. Eliud described his harvest last year as excellent, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group. Eliud joined One Acre Fund in 2010, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. Eliud joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices and get new farming methods. Eliud has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative because he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Eliud's life because he has more profits from harvest and was able to feed the family. In the future, Eliud hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school and save for the future. 

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Eliud and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Katy Sanny

texts.es:
Katy Sanny trabaja en una de las municipalidad de la ciudad del cusco en el área administrativa y en sus horas libres se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza. Ya son varios años que se dedica al negocio de venta de cosméticos y le va muy bien, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar perfumes, colonias, pinta labios y otras cosas mas.  
     
Katy Sanny pertenece al banco comunal “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en: Katy Sanny works in the administration of one of the municipalities of the city of Cusco. In her spare time she sells beauty products. She has been selling cosmetics for several years and her business is going well.  At this time Katy needs a loan to buy perfume, cologne, lipstick, etc. Katy Sanny belongs to the “Unión, Fuerza y Amistad”  communal bank of the Asociación Arariwa and is thankful for the opportunity given her through this loan. She promises to pay her installments in the agreed time-frame.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cologne, lipstick, etc.

loans.name: Blanca Carmita

texts.es:
La Señora Blanca forma parte del grupo de crédito María Reina de la Paz, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por tener 4 ríos los mismo que bañan la ciudad, su centro histórico que fue nombrado Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gastronomía y su gente amable y cordial hacen que esta ciudad sea muy bella.
La Señora Blanca tiene 51 años de edad, está divorciada, en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, tres de sus hijos son mayores de edad, trabajan y le ayudan económicamente  y estudian en la universidad, su último hijo tiene 14 años y estudia en un colegio de la ciudad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña Blanca para sacar adelante a sus hijos y mejorar la estabilidad económica de su casa se dedica a la venta ambulante de cosméticos, labora todos los días sin horario ya que aprovecha cada momento que tiene libre, en casa se dedica a la crianza de cuyes y gallinas y también a la agricultura. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de materiales de construcción ya que está construyendo su casa. Su meta es terminar su casa propia.
texts.en:
Ms. Blanca is part of of the credit group María Reina de la Paz [Mary, Queen of Peace].  She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city known for having having four rivers which flow through the city, its historical center which was designated Cultural Heritage for Humanity, its food and its friendly and polite people, making this city very beautiful.

Ms. Blanca is 51 years old, divorced, and has four sons from her marriage.  Three of her sons are above 18, work and help her financially and study in university; her last son is 14 and studies in a school in the city.  She doesn't doesn't have her own home and therefore rents.

To support her children and improve her financial stability of her home she works as a walking cosmetics merchant.  She works each day without a schedule since she takes advantage of every free moment she has; at home she spends her time raising guinea pigs and hens as well as farming.  The money from her loan is to buy construction materials since she is building her house. Her goal is to finish her own home.

loans.use: buy construction materials

loans.name: Orata's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of seven group leader farmers in Webuye District with Orata selected as the Kiva representative. Orata volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right in the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 88 other individual farmers represented by this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings. 

Orata is 55 years old, and he has been a farmer for 27 years. Orata works as a farmer to provide for his seven children. The community and other farmers know Orata as friendly and as an experienced farmer. Other than farming, he is also involved in his community such as in the men's group and the burial committee. Orata described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.

 Orata first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed his family. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member who wants to help more farmers. 

Orata plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and to invest in a business. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Orata’s own life was improved because he has more profits from his harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, and was able to save money. One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. 

Orata and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Stephen's Group

texts.en:
Stephen is a member of this group in the Webuye District. He is pictured here in a group of 7 One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 64 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Stephen has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation. 

Stephen is 70 years old and has been a farmer for 47 years. He works as a farmer to provide for his eight children. The community and other farmers know Stephen to be friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer. Other than farming, he is also involved in his community in the men's group, the savings group, the prayer group and the burial committee. Stephen described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group. Stephen first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2009 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Stephen plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school, repair the home, save for the future and buy a cow. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Stephen’s own life has improved because he has more profits from the harvest, more farm training, more farm group support, and has been able to save money and feed the family. 

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers. Stephen and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover the initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continue to provide training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives. 

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left.

loans.use: To support farmers in purchasing hybrid seeds and fertilizer to increase harvests of maize, millet and sorghum.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is a 65-year-old man with two children aged 20 and 18 years old, whom he supports. 

This is his first loan of KES 30,000. He was introduced to Vision Fund Kenya by the Vision Fund Officer. He has a General Store business which is located at Gongoni. He has been in this business for five years and he earns a monthly income of KES 10,500. He is planning to use the loan to purchase more utensils to sell to his customers, and he will use the profit to expand the business. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to open a wholesale supermarket and to educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase more utensils to sell to his customers

loans.name: Turgunbu

texts.ru: Тургунбу 30 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Тургунбу - среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Тургунбу занимается полеводством, стартовав 10 лет назад, с 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Тургунбу, на сегодняшний день имеется: куры, 2,08 ГА земельной доли, на которой ежегодно выращивает помидоры, перец, огурцы, капусту, дыню, арбузы для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный доход составляет 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Тургунбу обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом -на покупку удобрений для обработки земли, а также оплату рабочим в обработке и пахоте земли. Доходы от кредита Тургунбу планирует вложить в покупку домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на строительство большого дома для своей большой семьи.
texts.en: Turgunbu is 30 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising five children. Turgunbu has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Turgunbu practices livestock breeding and crop farming. She started this business 10 years ago with 1,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Turgunbu's hard work, she currently has chickens on her farm as well as a 2.08 hectare plot of land, on which she annually grows tomatoes, peppers, cucumbers, cabbage, melons, and watermelons for personal consumption and sale. Her monthly income is 14,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Turgunbu turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers to cultivate her land, as well as to pay hired workers to cultivate and till her land. Turgunbu plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to build a big house for her large family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay hired workers to cultivate her land.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
La socia Lilian pertenece al banco comunal YAHUAR MAQUI, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco.
La socia se sigue dedicando a su negocio de carpinteria, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia conjuntamente con su esposo elaboran diferentes tipos de muebles como sillas, camas, armarios entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de madera para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Lilian belongs to the "YAHUAR MAQUI" communal bank which is located in the district and Province of Cusco. She continues to work in her carpenter business. She has been in this business for a long time and things are going well for her thanks to the dedication she brings to her work every day. 
Lilian together with her husband make different types of furniture like chairs, beds, cabinets, etc. She wants to continue working so she can support her family. Lilian is requesting a loan to buy wood for her business. She is grateful for the loan and promises to pay the installments on time.

loans.use: to buy wood for her business.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal YAHUAR MAQUI; él socio continua con su negocio de artesanía como en la elaboración de chompas de alpaca, él socio es una persona responsable, él socio lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de materiales como lana, hilos, agujas entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: The member belongs to the "YAHUAR MAQUI" communal bank. He continues with his handicraft business like the making of Alpaca sweaters. Gregorio is a very responsible person. He has been running his business for years which gives him both personal and financial satisfaction. He wants to continue to work in this manner to support his family. Gregorio is requesting a loan to buy material like wool, thread, needles, etc. He is grateful for the loan and promises to pay the installments on time.

loans.use: to buy material like wool, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгуль 40 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 3 сыновей. У Назгуль - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Назгуль занимается животноводством, стартовав 21 год назад, с покупки скота на 20,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Назгуль и ее сыновей, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 2 теленка, 20 овец и 1 жеребенок. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS).
