В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назгуль обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Назгуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей в высших учебных заведениях.
texts.en: Nazgul is 40 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising three sons. Nazgul has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Nazgul practices livestock breeding. She started this business 21 years ago with an initial purchase of livestock in the amount of 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to the hard work of Nazgul and her sons, she currently has 2 milk cows, 2 calves, 20 sheep and 1 foal on her farm. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Nazgul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy calves to increase the size of her herd. Nazgul plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for the further education of her children at university.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Francis' Group

texts.en:
This group consists of six group leader farmers in Webuye District, with Francis selected as the Kiva representative. Francis has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative, and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 70 other individual farmers represented by this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here, but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings. 

Francis is married and has 16 children. He is 53 years old, and is known as friendly and an experienced farmer. He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group and burial committee. Francis has been a farmer for 32 years. He described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. 

Francis first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2013, and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Francis joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices so that he could earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member, who wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. 

Francis plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school and invest in a business. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Francis’s own life was improved because he had more profits from his harvest, and was able to save money. Francis and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low, and passes the cost savings on to the farmers. 

Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives. The field officer is also included in the photo, and is standing at the left of the photo.

loans.use: to allow other farmers the opportunity to buy cost efficient maize, millet, and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Dickson's Group

texts.en:
This group consists of four group leader farmers in Webuye District with Dickson selected as the Kiva representative. (The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.) Dickson has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right in the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 51 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings. 

Dickson is 59 years old and has been a farmer for 30 years. He works as a farmer to provide for his 10 children. The community and other farmers know Dickson as hardworking, reliable and an experienced farmer. In addition to farming, he is involved in his community's men's group and the burial committee. 

Dickson described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group. Dickson joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. Dickson joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices and send his children to school. Because he is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and wants to spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers, Dickson has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Dickson's life because he has more profits from his harvest and has more farm training. He was able to save money and feed the family. In the future, Dickson hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school and invest in a business. 

One Acre Fund focuses on working with smallholder farmers across Kenya. The organization pre-purchases seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings on to the farmers. Dickson and his group will use the Kiva loan to cover this initial cost of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer package from One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund continues providing training and support throughout the planting and harvesting season to ensure a good harvest and repayment. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth’s group has six group-leader farmers and is located in Webuye District. The group leaders in this group represent a total of 66 individual farmers (not pictured), who are each asking for an average loan of 5,349 shillings to purchase a One Acre Fund package for ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. 

As the Kiva group representative, Elizabeth is pictured on the right of the group with her hand raised. Elizabeth is 32 years old and has three children. She has been a farmer for 11 years. The community and other farmers know Elizabeth as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer. Other than farming, she is also involved in her community groups such as the women's group, savings group, prayer group, and burial committee. Elizabeth described her harvest last year as excellent, but hopes she can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in her group. 

Elizabeth first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed her family and send her children to school. She also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because she likes being a leader, and as an active community member, she wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Elizabeth plans to use the money that she earns from her next harvest to send her children to school, save for the future, buy a cow, and invest in a business. She notes that working with One Acre Fund has lead to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Elizabeth’s own life was improved because she has more profits from the harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, and was able to save money and feed the family. 

Elizabeth and her group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Nehemias

texts.es: Don Nehemías de 40 años de edad, es docente de secundaria, tiene muchos deseos de superación tiene en sus planes futuros el seguir estudiando para prepararse profesionalmente y mejorar sus condiciones económicas, es padre soltero con un hijo de 7 años de edad. Nehemías necesita el crédito para la construcción de dos cuartos pequeños, para garantizar la comodidad en su hogar.
texts.en: Don Nehemías is 40 years old. He is a teacher at a Secondary school. He has a lot of desire to get ahead. He has future plans to continue to study to prepare professionally and improve his economic situation. He is a single father of a 7 year old child. He needs a loan to build two small rooms to improve the comfort in his home.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, re-bar, rafters and zinc sheeting.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 30-year-old woman with four children aged 12, 10, 7 and 4 years old whom she supports. This is her second loan of Ksh.20,000. She was introduced to to Vision Fund Kenya by a Vision Fund officer. She has rental houses. The houses are located at Gongoni. She built these houses 10 years ago and she earns a monthly income of Ksh.7,500. She’s planning to use the loan to renovate the houses. She will use the profit to build more rental houses. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to build more rental houses and educate her children.

loans.use: To renovate her rental houses

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señorita. María vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por tener 4 ríos los mismo que bañan la ciudad, su centro histórico fue nombrado Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gastronomía y su gente amable y cordial hacen que esta ciudad sea muy bella.
La Señorita María tiene 34 años de edad y es soltera, vive en compañía de sus padres con quienes comparte los gastos de su hogar, la casa en la que vive es de sus padres.
Doña María se dedica a la venta de cosméticos, esta actividad  la realiza para tener su independencia económica y así cubrir algunos gastos  de la casa. Ella está repitiendo el crédito para comprar más cosméticos de oferta para vender a mejores precios y así tener más clientes. Su grupo de crédito le gusta por la unión y solidaridad de cada una de las integrantes, son como una familia que siempre están en las buenas y las malas.
texts.en:
The young woman Maria lives in the city of Cuenca, a city that is renowned for its four rivers, its historic center that has been named a World Heritage Site, and its gastronomy. Its warm and friendly people make this city very beautiful.

Maria is 34 years old and is single. She lives with her parents with whom she shares the household expenses. Maria sells cosmetics, an activity she performs to have economic independence and cover some of the household costs. She is requesting another loan to buy more cosmetics to sell at better prices and gain more customers. She likes the credit group unity and solidarity that each of the members have. They are like a family who always endure both the good and the bad together.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Loice

texts.en:
Loice is a 31-year-old female, single, with one child, aged 10 years old, whom she supports. 

This is Loice's third loan, this one in the amount of KES 60,000. She was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by the VisionFund Kenya officer. She sells khangas (colorful garments worn by women and occasionally by men). Her business is located in Timboni. She has been in this business for ten years and she earns a monthly income of KES 10,100. 

Loice is planning to use the loan to purchase more khangas and African bags to sell to her customers. She will use the profit to expand the business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to open a boutique and to educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more khangas and African bags to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mandzaano Group

texts.en:
Emmanuel, who is in his mid 50's, is married with children. He has been selling fishing net and other equipment for seven years. He works at his business from 8 am to 6 pm per working day and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Emmanuel's fifth loan request from ID-Ghana. He used the previous loan to invest in the same business. He repaid his entire loan successfully. Emmanuel is doing good to his business and family. With his new loan request, Emmanuel will buy fishing net to sell to fishermen and fishing agencies. He dreams of building a house for his family.

Emmanuel will share this loan with his loan group which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy fishing net to sell to fishermen and fishing agencies.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.es:
La Señora. Rosaura forma parte del grupo de crédito María Reina de la Paz, este grupo le ha dado la oportunidad de mejorar su estabilidad económica. Vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es reconocida por tener 4 ríos los mismo que bañan la ciudad, su centro histórico fue nombrado Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gastronomía y su gente amable y cordial hacen que esta ciudad sea muy bella.

La Señora. Rosaura tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos, cuatro de ellos ya son casados y viven independientes, uno de sus hijos se dedica a trabajar y le ayudar económicamente, uno estudia en la universidad y sus dos últimos hijos estudian en un colegio de la ciudad. Su esposo labora en el área de la construcción como albañil, la casa en la que viven es propia.
La Señora Rosaura es una mujer luchadora que se dedica a la venta de ambulante de ropa y cosméticos, esta actividad la realiza en todo momento ya que siempre se le presentan oportunidades. El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de ropa y cosméticos, está repitiendo el crédito para comprar cosméticos de oferta para obtener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosaura is part of the María Reina de la Paz credit group. This group has been given an opportunity to improve their economic stability. She lives in the city of Cuenca, a city renowned for its four rivers, its historic center that has been named a World Heritage Site, and its gastronomy. Its warm and friendly people make this city very beautiful. 

Rosaura is 53 years old. She is married and has had 8 children with her husband. Four of the children are married and living independently. One of her sons is working and she helps him economically. One is studying at the university, and her youngest two children are in high school. Her husband works in the construction industry as a bricklayer. They live in their own home. 

Rosaura is a hard worker who earns her living selling clothes and cosmetics as an ambulant vendor. She does this work at all times so that she is present for any opportunities. The money from her previous loan was invested in clothes and cosmetics. She is repeating this loan to buy cosmetics to sell at better profits.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Gulzina

texts.ru: Гулзине 35 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. У Гулзины - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Гулзина занимается животноводством, стартовав 15 лет назад, с покупки скота на 5,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Гулзины, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 14 коз, 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гулзина обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом - на покупку нетелей для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Гулзина планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на дальнейшее обучение детей.
texts.en: Gulzina is 35 years old, married, and together with her husband, is raising five children. Gulzina has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, Gulzina practices livestock breeding. She started this business 15 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulzina's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow, 1 calf, 14 goats and 5 sheep on her farm. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Gulzina turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy heifers to increase the size of her herd. Gulzina plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money for her children's future education.

loans.use: to buy heifers.

loans.name: Blanca Ninosca

texts.es: Blanca es maestra de primaria, madre soltera tiene un hijo con el que busca la manera de salir adelante con su pequeño ingreso, siendo sus planes mejorar su vivienda y preparar a su hijo que estudie una carrera universitaria. Solicita el crédito para comprar materiales de construcción y poder realizar un servicio sanitario, para garantizar la buena salud en su hogar, mejorara así las condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Blanca is an elementary school teacher and a single mother with one son. She searches for ways to move forward with her small income, while planning to improve her home and prepare her son for a university degree. She is applying for a loan to buy construction materials to install a sanitary service in her home. She will then guarantee her household's good health and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, iron, bricks, and a sink.

loans.name: Talantbek

texts.ru: Талантбек 26 лет, холост, проживает совместно с родителями. У Талантбека - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Талантбек занимается животноводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 60,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Талантбека, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 жеребенок, 95 овец. Скот летом отгоняет на пастбище и сдает наемному пастуху, в зимнее время скот содержит дома. Ежемесячный доход составляет 18,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Талантбек обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Талантбек планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на проведение своего свадебного торжества.
texts.en: Talantbek is 26 years old, unmarried, and lives with his parents. Talantbek has a secondary education. As the main source of income for his family, Talantbek practices livestock breeding. He started this business 5 years ago, with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Talantbek's hard work, he currently has 1 foal and 95 sheep on his farm. In the summertime, he brings his livestock out to pasture and hires a shepherd to watch them. In the winter time, he keeps his livestock at home. His monthly income is 18,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing his business, Talantbek turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." He is requesting a loan to buy calves to increase the size of his herd. Talantbek plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. He also intends to save money to carryout his wedding reception.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en:
Moses is a member of this group from the Webuye District. He is pictured here with a group of eight One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 89 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Moses has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of 5,349 shillings for maize, millet, and sorghum cultivation. 

Moses is 49 years old, married, and has nine children. He is known as a friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy, and experienced farmer. He is active in his community in groups such as the men's group, savings group, prayer group, and burial committee. Moses has been a farmer for 16 years. He described his harvest as poor last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. Moses first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. He joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he is an active community member, who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund. Moses plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school, save for the future, buy a cow, and invest in a business. 

Moses notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Moses’s own life was improved because he has more profits from the harvests, has more farm training, has more farm group support, and was able to save money and feed the family. Moses and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings onto the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives. The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds for maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.en: Victoriano is a 44-year-old man from Panglao. He is married and a father of two children. He earns a living by raising hogs and driving his motorcycle to carry passengers to remote places. Victoriano is asking for a loan to buy piglets to raise and feed to keep them healthy. With this loan, he will be able to improve and sustain his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed

loans.name: Paul

texts.en: Paul is happily married to his wife, Rahab, and his children are doing well. His mobile phone repair business continues to succeed, and he is happy that his income is now twenty thousand shillings. This will be Paul's third loan with Vision Fund Kenya, he plans to use the entire loan to purchase mobile phones accessories. In the future he wants to be own a large parcel of land.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  BEKELEMA sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  34 ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités et elles sont à leur premier prêt. 
Mme ASSAN ( 4ème sur la photo de la gauche à la droite)compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter 3 sacs d’atieké.Sa vente à KOLONDIEBA.
Sa vente se fait  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes;elle effectue ses ventes au comptant et parfois à crédit. Elle s’approvisionne à KOLONDIEBA.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 21.000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Belema group are married women averaging 34 years of age, with three children. They all live in polygamous families in Kolondieba, a prefecture in the third administrative region of Mali. They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully manage their business. They are on their first loan. 

Mrs. Assan (the first one from left to right in the photo) plans to use her loan to buy three bags of [cassava couscous]. She sells in Kolondeiba, to a mixed clientele, for cash and sometimes on credit. She stocks up in Kolondieba. She plans to earn an average monthly income of 21,000 West African francs. This revenue will allow her to pay off her loan and also help her husband with everyday expenses.

loans.use: to buy cassava couscous.

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en:
This group consists of 7 group leader farmers in the Webuye district of Kenya, with Moses selected as the Kiva representative. Moses has volunteered to be the Kiva group representative and is on the right of the photo with his hand raised. Farming inputs will be delivered to him and the 76 other individual farmers represented in this group. The credit consists of the necessary materials to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of millet or sorghum. The individual farmers are not pictured here but will be receiving an average loan of 5,349 shillings.

Moses is 55 years old and has been a farmer for 36 years. Moses works as a farmer to provide for his 8 children. The community and other farmers know Moses as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer. Other than farming, he is also involved in his community though groups such as the savings group, prayer group and burial committee.

Moses described his harvest last year as good, but hopes he can have an even better one with the support of One Acre Fund and the other farmers in his group.

Moses joined One Acre Fund in 2013, and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. Moses joined One Acre Fund so that he could get the best seed prices, get new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds and earn enough to feed family. Because he is an active community member, he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Moses has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Moses's life because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, and was able to save money and feed his family. In the future, Moses hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school, repair his home, save for the future, buy a goat and invest in a business.

Moses and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests.

One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives.

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seed and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Michael's Group

texts.en:
Michael is a member of this group in the Webuye District. He is pictured here in a group of eight One Acre Fund group leader farmers. The group leaders represent a total of 89 individual One Acre Fund farmers who are not pictured here. Michael has been selected to act as the Kiva group representative and is standing on the right with his hand raised. He and the other farmers represented in this group are each receiving seed for one quarter acre of maize and seed for one quarter acre of sorghum or millet. Each farmer is receiving an average input loan of KES 5,349 for maize, millet and sorghum cultivation.

Michael is married and has two children. He is 39-years-old and is known as friendly, hardworking, reliable, trustworthy and an experienced farmer. He is active in his community in groups such as the savings group, prayer group and burial committee. Michael has been a farmer for 15 years. Michael described his harvest as excellent last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. Michael first enrolled with One Acre Fund in 2010 and is now preparing to be a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2014 Long Rains season. Michael joined One Acre Fund in order to get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, earn enough to feed his family and send his children to school. He also volunteered to be a group leader and Kiva representative because he likes being a leader. As an active community member, he wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers. Michael plans to use the money that he earns from his next harvest to send his children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow and invest in a business. He notes that working with One Acre Fund has led to many benefits for One Acre Fund farmers. Michael’s own life was improved because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, was able to save money and feed the family. Michael and his group need a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. 

One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits and improved lives. 

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To provide Kenyan farmers with increased access to hybrid seeds and fertilizer for harvesting maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Manasse's Group

texts.en:
Manasse’s Group has seven group farmers and is located in Webuye District. The group leaders in this group represent a total of 68 individual farmers (not pictured) who are each asking for an average loan of KES 5,349 (shillings) to purchase a One Acre Fund package for seeds to plant ¼ acre of maize and ¼ acre of sorghum or millet. 

As the Kiva group representative, Manasse is pictured on the right of the group, with his hand raised. Manasse is married and he has eight children. He is 68-years-old and is known as friendly, hard-working, reliable, trustworthy, and an experienced farmer. He is active in his community, in groups such as the men's group, savings group, prayer group, and burial committee. Manasse has been a farmer for 30 years. He described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have an even better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. Manasse joined One Acre Fund in 2012 and is now enrolling in the Long Rains 2014 season as a group leader. He joined One Acre Fund, so that he could get the best seed prices, learn new farming methods, get fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and earn enough money to feed his family and send his children to school. Because he likes being a leader and is an active community member who wants to help more farmers and spread the story about One Acre Fund farmers, Manasse has gotten more involved with One Acre Fund, as a group leader and Kiva representative. Working with One Acre Fund has improved Manasse's life because he has more profits from harvest, has more farm training, has more farm group support, and was able to save money and feed the family. In the future, Manasse hopes that his profits from 2014 can be used to send his children to school, repair the home, save for the future, buy a cow, buy a goat, and invest in a business. Manasse's Group needs a loan to cover the initial costs of purchasing the seeds and fertilizer through One Acre Fund. One Acre Fund will repay the Kiva loan on behalf of the farmers through the profits from the farmers’ harvests. One Acre Fund pre-purchases the seeds and fertilizer when prices are low and passes the cost savings to the farmers. Throughout the planting and harvesting season, One Acre Fund also provides training and support to the farmers as they make payments back to One Acre Fund. With support from One Acre Fund and your loan, these farmers will have a chance at a successful harvest, increased profits, and improved lives. 

The field officer is also included in the photo and is standing on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, millet, and sorghum.

loans.name: Veronicah Njoki

texts.en:
Veronica is a member of Kiarutara group. She has been a group member for 3 years now and from the group loans she has achieved a lot. She learned about biogas a year ago when VEP officials trained the group members and she decided to take up the project after completing a loan she was repaying.

She has seen a biogas stove from her neighbour and now fully understands the benefits. She has taken a new loan to have a biogas stove constructed for her and by mid March she will be using it instead of charcoal and firewood. With a lifespan of about 30 to 50 years, Veronica and her children may not need to use any other fuel hence saving on money and time spent collecting wood. The family will also enjoy a smoke-free kitchen and soot-free cooking pots, and this will result in good health that is free from respiratory diseases.

Being a farmer, Veronica will also use the slurry to grow food crops and as fodder for the livestock. This will increase the harvest, ensuring food security and some income from the surplus.

loans.use: To pay for biodigester construction

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients in bulk (palm oil, rice, fish, Maggi and groundnuts, oil, etc.) to make her dishes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, Ovaltine, and drinks to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase gizzards and chicken for resale.

loans.name: Yessica Marcela

texts.es:
Ella es yessica marcela, es una chica de 18 años quien toda la vida había luchado por cumplir los sueños, desde pequeña siempre buscó la manera de ayudar a las demás personas, en especial a los más necesitados.
A medida que iba creciendo iba pensando que la mejor forma de ayudar a personas era ejerciendo una profesión como la enfermería, pues así podría ayudar a salvar muchas vidas que posiblemente corrían grande riesgo y a la vez podría hacer feliz a muchas familias.
Cuando se graduó del colegio empezó a estudiar lo que mas le gustaba, en el estudio siempre se ha esforzado mucho día tras día por aprender más y ser la mejor, para que así mismo en la vida laboral pueda hacer siempre las cosas de manera excelente y ayudar a las personas, como siempre ha soñado.
La idea es seguir estudiando mucho y prepararse cada vez más para completar la profesión y seguirse especializando en lo que siempre quiso.
El beneficio de kiva lo puedo obtener el semestre pasado y fue de gran ayuda para ella, en esta ocasión quiere pedir de nuevo el convenio con kiva ya que es una ayuda económica bastante grande para ella, el valor  de las cuotas disminuye y el dinero que se ahorra lo puede utilizar en gastos extras que le genera el estudio.
texts.en:
She is Yessica Marcela, a girl who all her life has fought to fulfill her dreams. From a young age, she always looked for a way to help others, especially those who are neediest. As she was growing up she thought that the best way to help people was practicing a profession like nursing, so she could help to save many lives that possibly were in grave danger and at the same time she could make many families happy. 

When she graduated high school, she began to study what she liked best. In her studies she has always made an effort day after day to learn more and be the best so that in her work life she can always do things in a excellent manner and help people as she has always dreamed. The idea is to continue studying a lot and prepare herself more every day to finish the profession and continue specializing in what she always wanted. The benefit of Kiva she was able to obtain last semester, and it was a great help to her. In this occasion she wants to again request the agreement with Kiva considering that it is rather large economic help for her, her semester fees are less, and the money she saves she can use on extra expenses that studying generates.

loans.use: to pay a semester's tuition

loans.name: Hellen Wambui

texts.en:
Hellen lives with her husband and three children in central Kenya, in Kiambu county. They are farmers, practicing dairy farming and rearing chicken, and they have a small garden for their food crops. 

Income from the sale of milk and eggs has been serving to educate their children, leaving them with barely nothing to save. Hellen learned about biogas through a local radio advert and got interested. She approached VEP for financing and construction, and through her women group, she got the loan.

Hellen now appreciates the graduation from wood to gas. She will now have a better environment while cooking, and her husband can now keep her company while cooking as the children do their homework, since there wont be any smoke. 

With the biogas, she will have sufficient fuel for cooking and lighting, and can save the money previously used to buy Kerosene and the time spent collecting wood.

loans.use: to construct a biodigester.

loans.name: Christo Nti Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Christo Nti and they have created a strong circle of support with each other. In each weekly meeting, they emphasize the confidence, accountability and adherence to training that they have been receiving from ID-Ghana. Their goal is to continue together for many more loan cycles and maintain an excellent credit record. In addition, they are gaining a lot of useful knowledge each week with the ID-Ghana Loan Officer who presents various educational training sessions on relevant and useful themes like financial management, nutrition and health. It is the combination of the loans and education that makes the Micro credit Program of ID-Ghana so useful to Christo Nti group members. 

Godwin has been selling jeans and shirt for 3 years. He is 56 years old, married and has children. He stays in his own house with his wife and children in Teshie. He needs this loan to buy jeans and shirts to sell to his customers. The other members of his group are Elizabeth, who sells dried pepper and dried fish, Abraham, who sells African design bags, and Cecilia, who sells wigs and creams. They will need a total amount of 2300 GHS to better their businesses. Each one is responsible for one another's repayment of the loan (group pressure). They want to share that they are very grateful to Kiva investors for believing in them and funding their loans.

loans.use: to buy jeans and shirts to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Mary Njeri

texts.en:
Mary is married and has seven children; some are in school and others have completed. Over the years, she and her husband have practiced farming, alongside casual employment in tea estates, to feed their family and pay school fees. 

Mary is a member of three women groups, two of them partnering with VEP, and through these she has been borrowing loans for different purposes. Having learned the benefits of biogas, she decided to have one constructed in her home with a loan given by VEP. 

With her four cows, she would have enough gas for cooking and lighting. This will save her a day wasted every week collecting wood and money spent buying Kerosene and candles. It will also ease the back and neck pains she experiences when carrying the load of firewood. Bio-gas will lead to better, simpler, cleaner, and healthier life for her and her family.

loans.use: to construct a biodigester in her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more wax cotton to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy jewels

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cement, paint and iron rods to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase palm oil and coconut oil for resale.

loans.name: Paz Y Amor 4 Group

texts.en:
Santa is the coordinator of her group, Paz y Amor (Peace and Love) 4. Her group is located in Samana; a lush, rugged peninsula, where running water (which isn't potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner.

Santa is excited to be taking out her 11th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to increase her inventory where she sells clothes and shoes. 

With this loan, she will buy these products to resell them in her community and others nearby. She will use the profits to reinvest and supply what they need as a family. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marife is 41 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Marife has a Sinamay weaving business in the Philippines. Marife requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional raw materials for her weaving business.

Marife has been in this business for five years. Marife would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Erejen

texts.en:
Erejen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Erejen requested a PHP 9,500 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.  She has been in this business for two years now.

In the future, Erejen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, toothpaste, drinks and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase mayonnaise and cooking seasonings for resale.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos, con 33 años de edad, es un hombre pujante, activo y trabajador, padre y esposo ejemplar que se preocupa por brindar a su familia bienestar y el sustento diario.
Por falta de experiencia laboral le ha sido difícil encontrar oportunidades laborales estables, a pesar de haber estudiado 3 tecnologías con el apoyo de su familia; esto lo motivó para iniciar su propio negocio, una tienda de abarrotes en la que también adecuó un espacio para alquiler de video juegos, trabaja solo todos los días de 7 am a 9 pm y aprendió el oficio de manera empírica, así ha logrado generar los recursos suficientes para sobrevivir con su familia.
Con el ánimo de mejorar sus ingresos, Carlos desea incursionar con un negocio de café internet, para lo cual está solicitando el apoyo del crédito con el que comprará 4 computadores y realizará la adecuación del local para así, dar comienzo a su nueva actividad, la idea surge por la necesidad que tiene la comunidad donde reside, pues no hay otro negocio cercano que preste este servicio, razón que se convierte en su principal ventaja.
Carlos, con su dinamismo y proyección hacia el logro, desea consolidar bien su negocio, que le genere rentabilidad y, en un futuro le brinde la posibilidad de incursionar con otro negocio de minimercado, para así atender diversos mercados y garantizar una estabilidad económica para su familia, brindándoles un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos, 33, is an active, thriving, hardworking man, as well as an exemplary father and husband. He is concerned about providing his family with well-being and their daily needs.

Due to a lack of work experience, it has been difficult for him to find stable job opportunities, despite having studied three types of technology with the help of his family. This motivated him to start his own business, a grocery store in which he has also installed a space to rent video games. He works alone every day from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m. He learned about this business empirically and has managed to generate the necessary income to survive along with his family.

With the goal of improving his income, Carlos would like to expand his business with an internet cafe. He is applying for a loan to buy four computers and to set up the cafe so that he can start this new business activity. The idea came to him because of the need for this business in the community where he lives. There is no other business in the area which offers this service, which will be his main advantage.

With his dynamic personality and motivation to accomplish his goals, Carlos would like to consolidate his business so that it will generate a profit. In the future, he would like to open another business, a minimarket, so that he can serve different markets and guarantee financial stability for his family, offering them well-being and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy four computers and set up an internet cafe.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 42-years-old and has six children.  She is married and has two children who are still in school.

Arlene is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Arlene requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Arlene has been in the pig fattening business for three years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Arlene would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Faalupega

texts.en:
Faalupega is a 23 years old and single. She has a small plantation and grows taro, banana, yams, taamu, and other crops, which she has been doing for six years. 

Faalupega requested a loan from SBPD, which she will use to buy weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings, and an axe for her business improvement. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Faalupega hopes to continue doing her farming to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings, and an axe.

loans.name: Faxraddin

texts.en: Faxraddin is a driver. He is 36 years old, married and has a child. His child is 11 years old and goes to fifth class of school. They are Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) from Füzuli city and now live in Füzuli – Yuxari Seyidahmadli village. Faxraddin transports fruits and vegetables to bazaar. Today he has applied for a loan in amount of 1,500 AZN for repairs to his car. He has been in this business for 10 years and during those years his car has become outdated. A while ago, his car was damaged and Faxraddin can’t work. So he can support his family, the car needs repair. He believes that if his car is repaired, his situation will be good enough, as before, and Faxraddin will be able to support his family. He is thankful to Kiva for help. In the future, he wants to change his car.

loans.use: to repair his car.

loans.name: Tafili

texts.en: Tafili is a 61-year-old widowed woman with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taamu, bananas, yams and taro to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. Tafili has requested a loan to buy chemicals, bush knives, weed sprayer, etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits,Tafili hopes to save money for unexpected emergencies and to pay for her grandchildren's education as well.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, bush knives, filings, an ax, etc.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet works hard to support her family. Janet is widowed and has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines.

Janet requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers.

Janet has been in this business for 12 years now.

Janet would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more used clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Glenn

texts.en:
Glenn is 34 years old and married with two children. With two children in school, Glenn works very hard to provide for them.

Glenn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

Glenn has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, hair conditioner, coffee, etc. 

In the future, Glenn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a widowed woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Josephine is 45 years old and has three children who are currently in school.

Josephine has a fishing business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials for her fishing business.

Josephine has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her fishing business.

loans.name: Ma. Eva

texts.en:
Ma. Eva is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Eva is 55 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Ma. Eva has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines. Ma. Eva requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her business.

Ma. Eva successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Ma. Eva has been in this business for 1 year. Ma. Eva would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Alfreda

texts.en:
Alfreda works hard to support her family. Alfreda is married and has a buy-and-sell lumber business in the Philippines.

Alfreda requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more lumber to resell.

Alfreda has been in this business for one year now.

In the future, Alfreda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more lumber to resell.

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Amelita is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Amelita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Amelita requested a PHP 9,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fish to resell to her customers.

Amelita has been in this business for two years. In the future, Amelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fish to resell to her customers.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 32 years old and has two children. Ana Marie is married and has two children who are in school.

Ana Marie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ana Marie requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Ana Marie has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Ana Marie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy food items for resale.

loans.name: Lina

texts.en: Lina is a 53-year-old married woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows yams, taamu, taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. Lina has requested a loan to buy chemicals, weed sprayer, bush knives, etc. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. With her profits, Lina hopes to save money to support her family.

loans.use: to buy weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings and an ax.

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en: Veronika is a 30-year-old single woman with four children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than five years.  Veronika has requested a loan to buy bush knives, filings, an axe, chemicals and a wheelbarrow for her business. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. With her profits,Veronika hopes to continue with her business to pay for her children's education and to help support her family as well.

loans.use: to buy bush knives, filings, an ax, chemicals, a wheelbarrow, etc.

loans.name: Camilo X

texts.es:
Camilo es un joven campesino de 19 años de edad, criado y educado por su padre, quien le enseñó desde pequeño todas las labores del campo; gracias a ello, hoy en día se desempeña como guadañador, prestando el servicio a los propietarios de las fincas de la región, esto le permite generar recursos económicos para aportar a la economía del hogar y para sus gastos personales.
Hace poco tiempo compró a crédito una guadaña, que aún está pagando a cuotas, esto disminuye las ganancias que obtiene por la prestación de su servicio, ya que los intereses son bastante altos; es por ello que solicita el apoyo del crédito con el que terminará de pagar el saldo pendiente de la máquina y con el restante le realizará el mantenimiento, esto le ayudará a mejorar la calidad del servicio y además podrá aumentar las utilidades, lo que significa mayores ingresos para la familia.
Camilo sueña con seguir avanzando y cumplir el sueño de adquirir otra guadañadora que podrá subarrendar para así generar ingresos adicionales y estar en la capacidad de dar a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar.
texts.en:
Camilo, a 19-year-old farmer, was raised and educated by his father, who taught him about farm labor from a young age. Thanks to this, he is now working as a brush cutter, offering his services to the farm owners in his region. This allows him to generate the financial income to support his household and cover his personal expenses.

Camilo recently bought a brush cutter on credit, which he is still paying off in installments. This detracts from the income he earns for his services, because the interest rate is quite high. Therefore, he has requested a loan to pay off his remaining credit on the brush cutter. He will use the rest of the loan to maintain the machine. This will help him to improve the quality of his service, as well as improving its utility, which will bring in a greater income for his family.

Camilo's dreams are to continue moving forward and to buy another brush cutter which he can rent out to earn additional income. He will then be able to give his parents a better quality of life and well-being.

loans.use: to pay off a brush cutter and to maintain the machine.

loans.name: .siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Siguidia est composé uniquement de  femmes monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Djicoroni et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le  commerce d’habits (léger, pagne wax, bazins,…) de toutes les qualités et d’eau minérales en sachets. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Djènèba (1 ère debout  de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des habits (pagnes wax, légers,...). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 pièces de pagne  wax, 60 mètres tissus léger en à Bamako. La revente se fait en détail à Djicoroni et en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame Djènèba espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 75 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Siguidia group consists solely of monogamous women. They are on average 34 years old with three children. They all live in Djicoroni and know each other through their neighborhood. The group members sell items of clothing (lightweight damask cloths and pagnes, traditional wax cloth) of all grades, as well as bags of mineral water. To increase their cash supply, the group members decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso, and are on their third group loan cycle.

Djènèba (the first woman standing to the left of the photo) has a great reputation in clothing sales (lightweight pagnes, etc.) She intends to use her loan to buy 20 lengths of pagnes and 60 meteres of lightweight fabric in Bamako. She resells these pieces retail in Djicoroni, traveling to a mixed clientele.

With this loan, Djènèba hope to earn an average monthly profit of 75,000 FCFA, which will be used to reinvest in her business. Through this partnership with Soro Yiriwaso, her goal is to buy a lot for residential use.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nilima

texts.en:
Nilima is a 29-year-old married woman from the small village of Baroghoria in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her family consists of her husband and three children (one son and two daughters).  Both Nilima and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names. Their children are receiving an education. They are in grade 6, 6 and 1.

The main source of income for the family is their agricultural activities.  They have a plot of land where usually rice is grown. She and her husband work hard and always have high quality rice that is sold to the local retailers.  It is the main source of income for the family.  The income from the business is too low to give the family a decent lifestyle. She needs to expand the business but is unable to do so due to a lack of money.

Nilima has heard about BJS and has taken a loan from them.  She will use the loan to purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers to grow paddy in greater quantity.  Since rice is the staple food of the people of their area, she is hopeful to earn much profit from this business.

She hopes her business will ensure that her family members, especially her children, have a better education and a better future.  She dreams of buying a tractor in the future to use in their agricultural activities.

She is thankful to the lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase paddy seeds to start  rice cultivation.

loans.name: Nurana

texts.en: Nurana is 24 years old, married and has a child. Now she lives in Bala Bahmanli village of Füzuli region with her family, but they are internally displaced persons (IDP) from Füzuli city. Her children are getting older and Nurana's husband's salary is not enough to cover their increasing expenses. Previously she took a loan from Kiva and with this loan she successfully developed her business of raising cattle. Today she needs a second loan in the amount of 2,300 AZN to pay for supplies for her business. She wants to buy enough hay for her cattle and pay to vaccinate them. She is thankful to Kiva and lenders for help. In the future, Nurana wants to give a good education to her child.

loans.use: to buy enough hay for her cattle and pay for vaccinating them.

loans.name: Sialei

texts.en:
Sialei is a 36 years old, single, and has three children. She has a small plantation and grows banana, taro, taamu, yams, and breadfruit, which she has been doing for more than four years.

Sialei requested a loan from SBPD, which she will use to buy weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings, and an axe for her business. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Sialei hopes to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings, and an axe.

loans.name: Aduri

texts.en:
Aduri is a 33-year-old housewife.  She lives with her husband and one son in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.  She has a secondary education.  Her husband Nitish, age 33, is associated with a small business and attended school up to grade 8.  Their only son goes to school.

As a main source of income for her family, Adori raises livestock. She started that business 10 years ago when her husband's business was not going well.  Since then, it has been a great financial help to meet all the household expenses of their family.

Now, as the prices of essential commodities are increasing day by day, they want to expand their business in order to generate more income. For that reason, they need to invest money, which they don't have.

Aduri has taken a loan from BJS to purchase a dairy cow so that she can start a dairy products business.  She will start a milk supply and milk products business (paneer, curd, butter, cottage cheese etc.), which is a profitable business in their locality. They hope to earn a good income from this business.
Aduri plans to invest the income from the business to increase the quantity of domestic animals and plans to save money for the further education of her children.

She is thankful to her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply and milk products business.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita, 33 years old, is a rural woman.  She is married to Dinonath, 50, who is associated with the cultivation of jute.  Together, they are raising three sons who are students. Anita attended school up to grade 8 but her husband is illiterate.  They live in their own kachha house (mud, bamboo and straw made) in Altagram in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Anita runs a grocery shop with her husband.  Their income is hardly enough to cover the food and daily expenses.  They decided to take this loan to invest in their existing business by purchasing grocery items like rice, oil, sugar, salt etc. There is a great demand for these grocery items in their locality.  She hopes that the business will be lucrative and with the profit, she will be able to give financial assistance to her family and a good education to her children.  She has a plan to upgrade her house to a concrete made house.

She is thankful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items to start a grocery shop.

loans.name: Rozillin Betty

texts.en:
Rozillin Betty, a 38-year-old married woman, lives in Hoima, Uganda. She has a produce business and earns additional income from a bar and from motorcycle transportation. She started these businesses to improve on her social and economic status despite being challenged by inadequate capital and poor roads that make her service delivery to her customers difficult. She desires to buy a personal car to transport her produce to the city with ease.
Rozillin Betty intends to use the loan to buy produce, mostly maize and beans, to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce, mostly maize and beans, to sell.

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita is 27 years old, married, and has three children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, taamu, bananas, and yams to earn a living, which she has been doing for more than seven years.

Marekita requested a loan from SBPD, which she will use to buy weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings, and an axe for her business. She has been a member of SBPD since 2012. With her profits, Makerita hopes to improve her business to help her family and save for her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase weed sprayer, chemicals, bush knives, filings, and an axe

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano tiene 56 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Playa Azul, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, una comunidad que se caracteriza por un clima caluroso, ubicado en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de arroz desde hace 20 años, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos como plaguicidas que le permitan tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Mariano is 56 and lives with his wife and children in Caserío de Playa Azul, a rural area in the district of Pucará, a community known for its hot climate, located in Jaén Province in the Cajamarca region in the mountains in the north of Perú.  

Mariano earns his living in agriculture.  He has been growing rice for twenty years with help from his wife.  He is seeking a loan of 3000 soles to buy fertilizers like pesticides so he can have a good harvest to offer his clients and generate higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for his rice crop.

loans.name: Al-Dhia Group

texts.en:
The Al-Dhia Group consists of three women from Al-Hodeida, Yemen. They asked for a loan of 150,000 YER to run different types of businesses. 

Eyman is 32 years old and a married woman. She lives with her family in the city of Al-Hodeida. Her family conditions are bad, so she has to help her family in paying for all living expenses. She is a door-to-door seller. She has been selling clothes for eight years. This business is making a good profit, so she decided to expand her business and start selling perfumes and incense. Therefore, she applied for a loan in the amount of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy clothes, perfumes and incense for resale to increase her profit. She hopes to earn large profits so that she can improve her savings in order to obtain a big loan and further expand her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes, perfumes and incense for resale to increase her profit.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Carlos es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive en Santa Cruz de Yojoa, una comunidad al norte de Honduras junto a su esposa. Su actividad es una Pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace más de 10 Años.
Don Carlos brinda sus servicios a todos sus vecinos y personas de comunidades cercanas a su casa, por los años que lleva brindando este servicio a sus vecinos y demás clientes el cuenta con una muy buena clientela siempre trata de mantener lo necesario para darles una buena atención a sus clientes además es una persona muy amable y respetuoso. 
Don Carlos necesita el préstamo para aumentar su inventario de productos comprando azúcar, frijoles, arroz, café, leche, aguas, etc. y poderle brindar una mejor atención a sus clientes. El espera que el préstamo le sirva de mucho ya que contara con los productos necesarios para satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y a su vez obtener más ingresos que vengan a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. 
Don Carlos espera que su negocio siga creciendo en los próximos años.


Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras – Febrero del 2014
texts.en:
Carlos is a very hard-working and responsible person who lives in Santa Cruz de Yojoa, a community in northern Honduras, with this wife.  For over 10 years his job has been in a small bodega located in his house.

Carlos offers his services to all of his neighbors and people from communities near his home; over the years of offering this service to his neighbors as well as to other clients he has a very good clientele, always trying to keep what is necessary to provide his clients with good care.  He is also a very friendly and respectful person. 

Carlos needs the loan to increase his inventory of products, buying sugar, beans, rice, coffee, milk, water, etc. and provide a better service for his clients.  He hopes that the loan aids him as he will depend on the necessary products to satisfy the needs of his clients while also earning more income to improve his family's quality of life.

Carlos hopes that his business continues growing in the coming years.

Santa Cruz de Yojoa, Honduras - February 2014

loans.use: buy sugar, beans, rice, coffee, milk, water, etc for his business.

loans.name: Basanti

texts.en:
Basanti is a rural housewife from Maynaguri. She is 30 years old. She and her husband both are illiterate and can only sign their names.  Her family consists of herself, her husband and two school-going children.  Her husband is a farmer by trade.  Their sons are in grade 9 and grade 8.  They live in their own kachha house (made of bamboo, straw and mud) in Maynaguri.  Both of them are very ambitious and want to give a good life to their children with good education.

Basanti’s husband is engaged in agricultural business.  They have their own land where her husband grows different vegetables and crops in different seasons, and supplies those items in the wholesale market. Now Basanti plans to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to invest in green chilly growing by buying the necessary supplies like seeds, fertilizers etc. Basanti decided to grow chillies because chillies are a year-round crop and are used in most Indian dishes, so she hopes it will be a profitable business. In the future, she dreams of expanding her business and purchasing an auto-rickshaw with the profit generated to utilize it as another means of income.

Basanti is very much grateful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for cultivation of chiilies.

loans.name: Lowrd Group

texts.en: The Lowrd Group consists of five women from Al-Hodeida, Yemen. One member of the group, Mariam, is 40 years old and an illiterate married woman with children. She lives with her family in the city of Al-Hodeida. Her family conditions are bad so she has to help her husband in paying for all living expenses. She has been sewing clothes for over three years. This business has really helped the family to improve their living conditions. She started by offering her sewing services in her house. Little by little she started making clothes that her clientele required. This is how she became financially solvent and able to cover her essential expenses. She will use the received loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy sewing materials like thread, needles, zippers, etc.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials like thread, needles, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan es un campesino humilde y trabajador, a sus 48 años de edad, se dedica a trabajar como productor lechero, pues posee varias vacas y cuya producción es vendida en el mercado del pueblo o a vecinos que poseen tanques de frío, el oficio lo aprendió de su padre mientras le ayudaba con las labores de ordeño; esto le permite generar los recursos suficientes para sobrevivir con su familia.
Con su empuje y tenacidad, busca alternativas que le permitan seguir avanzando en su labor, por ello solicita el apoyo del crédito para invertirlo en la compra de una vaca productora de leche y concentrado al por mayor, así estará en la capacidad de aumentar la producción diaria, mejorando el nivel de ingresos por venta.
Juan expresa que su mayor anhelo es aumentar el número de cabezas de ganado para sí generar mayor rentabilidad y, en un futuro, tener la posibilidad de comprar una finca propia en la que pueda desarrollar plenamente su labor generadora de recursos, para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Juan, 48, is a humble, hardworking farmer. He makes a living producing milk. He owns several cows whose milk is sold at the local market or to neighbors who own cooling tanks. He learned about this profession from his father when he used to help him with the milking duties. This work allows him to earn the income he needs to survive along with his family.

With his spirit and tenacity, Juan is searching for ways to move forward with his work. Therefore, he is applying for a loan to invest in the purchase of a dairy cow and wholesale feed. He will then be able to increase his daily production, improving the income he earns from his sales.

Juan's greatest wish is to increase the number of cattle he owns to earn a better profit. In the future, he would like to be able to buy his own farm where he can fully develop his work, generating an income to improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow and wholesale feed.

loans.name: Askia Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe ASKIA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à SANOUBOUGOU I  un des quartiers populaire de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme  BINTOU fait le commerce  des  boissons dans ce groupe femmes. Elle est  à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  28 casiers de 24 bouteilles de boissons au grand marché. La revente est faite en détail sur place et à SANOUBOUGOU I à une clientèle composée d’ hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne
texts.en:
The four members of the Askia group are married women who, on average, are 39 years old and have four children. They mostly live in traditional families in Sanoubougou I, one of the popular neighborhoods in Sikasso, third administrative region in Mali. The group is on their eighth loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, so that they can better meet the needs of their customers.

Among this group of women, Bintou sells drinks. She is the person second from the right in the photo. 

With her loan, Bintou plans to buy 28 cases of 24 bottled drinks from the Grand Market. Sales will be made at retail in the market and in Sanoubougou I to a mixed group of customers for cash and credit.

Bintou hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA, of which a part will be used to pay back the loan and interest and the other part will be put in savings.

loans.use: to buy drinks

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan tiene 34 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío San Juan de Chorrillos, una zona rural del distrito de Pucará, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica agricultura especialmente al cultivo de caña, que lo utiliza para la destilación de aguardiente una bebida tradicional que se utiliza para días festivos, también es utilizado con fines curativos y antisépticos, Juan ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la ampliación de cultivo de caña y de esta manera destilar mayor cantidad de aguardiente para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Juan is 34 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the village of San Juan de Corillos, a rural area in the Pucará district. Residents here work in agriculture, commerce, and cattle farming. It is located in the Jaén province, with belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Perú.

He makes a living in agriculture by growing sugar cane, which he uses to distill aguardiente, a traditional beverage that is consumed at festivals and is also used for medicinal purposes and as an antiseptic. 

Juan has requested a loan of 3,000 nuevos soles to expand his sugar cane fields so that he can distill more aguardiente for his customers.

loans.use: to plant sugar cane crops.

loans.name: Santiago

texts.es:
Santiago tiene 69 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Buenos Aires, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región de Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente a los cultivos de frutales y granos, junto a su esposa se dedican también a la ganadería, son una familia unida, Santiago ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para pagar la mano de obra de su cultivo de arroz y mantenimiento de su cultivo de plátano y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Santiago is 69 years old. He lives with his wife and children in the Buenos Aires district, whose residents make a living in agriculture, commerce, and ranching. It is located in the Morropon province in the Piura region of Perú's northern coast.

He works in agriculture, growing fruits and grains. He and his wife also raise cattle. They are a united family.

Santiago has requested a loan of 4,000 nuevos soles to pay workers to plant rice and maintain his banana crops. This way, he will have an appropriate production to offer his customers.

loans.use: to pay workers to maintain his rice and banana crops.

loans.name: José Héctor Daniel

texts.es:
José de 48 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, se casó a la edad de los veinte y cinco  años, a procreo cuatro  hijos con su pareja, su esposa es ama de casa, ella es la que se encarga de las labores del hogar, dos hijos viven con él ellos van a la escuela, los demás ya están aparte, nadie más vive con ellos 


Él es agricultor, tiene más de veinte años de realizar la actividad, su padre desde pequeño le enseño que la vida solo se vivía bien, si trabajaba honradamente, cuando alguien lo busca que le ayude a trabajar también lo hace, la distancia que recorre es variable ya que no siempre va al mismo lugar, cuando saca la cosecha una parte la vende y lo demás para el consumo, nadie más se involucra en la actividad, el trabajo lo hace por la mañana de 6:00 am a 12:00 md.


El proyecto que realizara es comprar una ternera, con lo que mejorara sus activos  y podrá ampliar la producción y tendrá más ingresos a su hogar, podrá dar un paso de desarrollo para  él y su familia.
