texts.en: Monalisa is from the village of Consular. She is 22 years old and blessed with one child. To generate income, Monalisa is engaged in a hog-raising business. She has been in this business for one year and usually earns about 2,500 PHP per piglet. To this end, Monalisa wants to borrow additional capital to purchase feed and vaccine to ensure the proper growth of her hogs. Monalisa believes that with the help of this loan, she will be able to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vaccine

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 55-year-old, active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of five children and her husband is a shoemaker, by profession. He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the entire family. 

Robina has also been doing her business of clothes-selling for the past six years and she contributes her income, along with her husband's, to manage the household.

Robina needs to buy different types of clothes for reselling purposes, but due to insufficient financial means, she is not in the position to buy these clothes for her business purpose. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. 

With the help of this loan, Robina can purchase the clothes easily to fulfill her business needs, so that she can earn more profitable income to support her family and business.

Regarding this financial assistance, Robina is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different types of clothes to resell.

loans.name: Conie

texts.en: Hog-raising is the primary source income of Conie.  She is 31 years old and is married to Romeo, a father, who manages their family farmland. Conie has been in the hog-raising business for seven years and usually earns about PHP 4,500 every pig she sells.  As of now, Conie wants to have additional hogs, but she has insufficient capital. In this case she is asking a loan in the amount of PHP 8,000 to buy additional hogs to raise and hog feed to ensure the proper growth of her hogs.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs to raise and hog feed

loans.name: Alipia

texts.es:
La socia Alipia, sigue dedicándose a la confección de chompas de lana, la socia elabora las chompas para bebes y otros, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le trae satisfacciones tanto  económicas como personales, la socia vende su mercadería en una de las ferias que se realizan en la ciudad del Cusco, a la vez la socia realiza diferentes manualidades, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de lana, hilos, botones entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Member Alipia still works making wool sweaters. She makes sweaters for babies as well as other sizes. She has been in this business for years and it brings her both financial and personal satisfaction. She sells her merchandise at one of the markets in the city of Cusco. She also makes different handmade crafts. She wants to be able to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family this way.

Alipia is requesting this loan in order to purchase wool yarn, thread, buttons, and other supplies. 

She is grateful for the loan she was previously granted and she promises to follow her payment schedule.

loans.use: to buy wool yarn, thread, buttons, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El socio continua con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio a la vez continua dedicándose al negocio de musicales socio trabaja para los distintos compromisos que solicitan sus servicios, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de mercadería como arroz, golosinas entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member continues with his grocery store business. He has had his business for quite some time, and it is going well, thanks to the effort he puts into it every day.  He also continues with his music business, working at various weddings where his services have been requested.  

The member wants to be able to continue working, and in this way, continue supporting his family. He has requested a loan for the purchase of merchandise such as rice, snacks, and similar items. 

He feels thankful for the loan, and he promises to make his payments.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as rice, snacks, and similar items.

loans.name: Romanico

texts.en:
Romanico is a responsible father of three children and he aims to become successful in the future. He is 45 years old and married. He raises hogs to help satisfy their family's needs. Romanico has been in this business for three years and usually earns a profit of 8,000 PHP for every two pigs he sells. 

Romanico planned to buy more pigs to raise but he didn't have enough capital. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise. He mentioned that this loan will help him to improve his business and hopes that he will be able to grow his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for clean cooking gas package in order he can be able to support his wife with cooking chores

loans.name: Jovita

texts.en:
Jovita is married and blessed with four children. She is selling pork meat in the market, while her husband manages their farm. Jovita has been managing her business for 13 years and her income from it went for her children's allowances to attend school. Now, Jovita is happy because, despite the hardship in life, her three eldest children finished their studies and are presently employed. 

Jovita wants her youngest child to be like her eldest children. She is only relying on her business profit in able to sustain her child's needs in finishing his education. 

Jovita wanted to borrow a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy meat to sell in the market. Jovita will prioritize her child's needs in school through income she will earn from the business.

loans.use: to buy meat to sell in the market.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is a 32-year-old woman and a mother of six children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is fruit-seller, by profession. He sells fruits (e.g., apples, bananas, grapes). He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household.

Shazia's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purposes, so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But, due to an unfavorable financial position, he is not in a position to purchase fruits for his business purpose.

Therefore, Shazia has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes. 

Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of fruits for her husband's business.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is a thirty two year old married male with four children of which two go to school. He has been in clothing business for fourteen years and farms for additional income. Nelson started business for personal sustainability and hopes to improve his home only to be affected by an increase in license fees and price fluctuations of clothes.
Nelson intends to use the loan to buy clothes for selling.

loans.use: To buy  clothes for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) so that she can save on household cooking energy

loans.name: Hashmat

texts.en:
Hashmat is 37 years old. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her six children. Her husband is responsible to fulfill the needs of the family. One of her sons is also providing sewing services and earns an income to contribute with the father to manage the house hold. 
Hashmat's son needs different kinds of goods, e.g., needles, thread, pieces of clothes, machine oil, etc. for his business, but due to insufficient financial means he is unable to purchase these items. Therefore, Hashmat has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her son to purchase these supplies and will be helpful for his increasing his monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.
Hashmat is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy a tailoring supplies for her son's tailoring business.

loans.name: Maria Augusta

texts.es:
La socia María Augusta, sigue dedicándose a la confección de ropa, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le tare satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales, la socia cuenta con un pequeño taller donde elabora diferentes tipos de chompas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales como agujas, lanas, hilos, botones, cierres entre otros.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
María Augusta remains committed to making clothes. She has been doing this business for many years, and it is both economically and personally satisfying for her. She has a small workshop where she makes different types of sweaters among other things, and she wishes to continue working this way to support her family. 

She is requesting a loan to buy materials such as needles, wool, thread, buttons, zippers, and more.

María Augusta is grateful for the loan, and likewise she agrees to comply with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy materials such as needles, wool, thread, buttons, zippers, and more.

loans.name: Mervin

texts.en:
Mervin, a father of one, provides for his family with his farming income. After six years of experience in growing coconut, he earns a better income.  

Mervin needed to purchase fertilizer to improve the farm. He was determined to work hard in order to earn greater returns because he wants to give a better education to his child. With the microfinance loan from GDMPC, his plan was realized. 

In the future, he wants to acquire the adjacent lot to use it for farming.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en: Lilibeth has been selling food and snacks to make a living. For more than six years she has had loyal customers because her food tastes good. She has successfully repaid her previous loan used for her business. Lilibeth works hard every day in order to provide income for the family and to show customers her responsibility and reliability to serve. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase raw ingredients needed to prepare food to sell. In the future she wants to improve the general living standards of her entire family.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to prepare food to sell

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is a fifty-one-year-old married man with six children, all of whom go to school. Wilson lives in Kasese, Uganda. He has been in agriculture for fourteen years, plus timber and transport businesses for additional income. 

He started a business to generate income. Wilson is a hardworking man who is requesting a loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

His dream is to buy a plot in town. However, competition is a challenge being faced.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Eda

texts.es:
Eda tiene 45 años de edad, vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Morropon, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de comida preparada, cuenta con clientela considerable, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos como sacos de arroz, azúcar entre otros para la preparación de sus platos de comida y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Eda, 45, and her family live in Piura on the north coast of Peru. Farming, livestock-rearing and small businesses are the main sources of income for the people of this region.

Eda operates a food sales business and says that she can count on her many customers to go on buying from her. She is applying for a 2,000 new soles loan to buy the supplies she needs--rice, sugar, etc.--to make the food she sells. The investment will allow her to carry on the business and generate the income she needs to help support her family.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Kosar

texts.en:
Kosar is a 58-year-old woman residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of eight children. Her husband is an iron box maker by profession, and one of her sons is running his own business of furniture polishing. Both of them are responsible to feed the entire family and to manage the household. 

Kosar's husband needs to buy different types of manufacturing merchandise for his business, but due to insufficient financial means he is not in a position to buy this merchandise. Therefore, Kosar has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan her husband can easily purchase the relevant manufacturing goods to fulfill his business needs. This will also help him to increase sales and profit margins. 

For this financial assistance, Kosar is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy some tools and accessories for box-making purposes.

loans.name: Ida Ruth

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QOCHASAYWAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Ida Ruth tiene 45 años es viuda y tiene 1 hijo,la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa,la socia socia tambien realiza tejidos y tambien los vende en forma independiente,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar blusas,pantalones y lana para los tejidos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member, Ida Ruth, 45, belongs to the QOCHASAYWAS community bank in Cusco.  

She is a widow with 1 child.  She makes a living buying and selling clothes and making and selling knitwear.  She normally works from 8:00am until 6:00pm.  Ida Ruth has operated the clothing sales business for 7 years and says that it's going well.  For the future, she would like to have a shop where she can sell her merchandise.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy blouses and pants for resale and wool for making knitwear.

Ida Ruth says that she is grateful for the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QOCHASAYWAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Carmen Rosa tiene 47 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 4 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de comida, ella prepara diferentes platos como pollo al horno,bisteck,estofado de pollo y sopas, la socia tiene un restaurant donde trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar como carne, pollo y verduras.

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our member, Carmen Rosa, 47, is a member of the QOCHASAYWAS community bank in Cusco.

Carmen Rosa is married and has 4 children.  She operates a restaurant, making and selling baked chicken, steak, soups, stews and other dishes.  She works from 8:00am to 7:00pm.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy meat, chicken, vegetables and other supplies.

Carmen Rosa says that she is grateful for the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food business.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 36 year old hardworking lady living in Hoima town, Uganda.  She sells second hand clothes, a business she started so as to improve her welfare.  She faces a problem of debtors who don't pay on time yet she expects to reinvest the proceeds into the business.  Her dream is to have a well stocked boutique of both second hand and new clothes.

Margret needs the loan to purchase second hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to purchase second hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Aguedita Evangelina

texts.es:
La socia Aguedita pertenece al banco comunal YAHUAR MAQUI, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco.
La socia Aguedita, la socia tiene 56 años de edad, tiene 05 hijos y es separada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de joyería, la socia vende lo que son aretes, colares, pulseras, anillos entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio.
La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de aretes y collares.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Our member, Aguedita, 56, belongs to the YAHUAR MAQUI community bank in Cusco.

Aguedita is separated and has 5 children.  She operates a jewelry business, buying and selling earrings, necklaces, bracelets, rings, etc.  She says that the business is successful because she has worked hard to make it successful.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her business with earrings and necklaces.  

Aguedita says that she is grateful for the loan and committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail business.

loans.name: Betsy Gabriela

texts.es:
La socia Betsy Gabriela pertenece al banco comunal YAHUAR MAQUI, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco.
La socia Betsy tiene 20 años de edad, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como perfumes, colonias, cremas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia a la vez es estudiante de contabilidad, siendo de esta manera que la socia sale adelante.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de perfumes para damas.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Our member, Betsy Garbriela, 20, is a member of the YAHUAR MAQUI community bank in Cusco.

Betsy operates a beauty products business, buying and selling perfumes, colognes, creams, etc.  She has operated the business for a while now and says that it is successful because she has worked hard to make it successful.  Betsy is an accounting student and hopes for a career in that field.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy perfumes for resale.

Betsy is grateful for the loan and says that she is committed to repaying it in the agreed-upon time.

loans.use: to stock her beauty products sales business.

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en:
Godwin is a thirty nine year old married male with six children; four of them go to school.  They are living in Kasese, Uganda.  He has been in the retail business for fourteen years and also does farming for additional income.  Godwin started business to cater for his family's needs and he is determined to expand it into new markets.  However, high transport costs and price fluctuations are challenges he is facing. 

Godwin has asked for a loan to buy rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice to sell.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is 28 years old; she lives in a small house in Gaza with her husband, they live with her husband’s family, and her dream is to build a separate house. 
For the past six years, she has run a food market in a rented store front; she hopes in the future to buy a grocery store.  This business helped the family income, because her husband works in a public institution with a low salary and they are big family and they need to support their kids.

Noor sells different kinds of food stuffs, like soft drinks, cookies and all kinds stuff.  She asked Ryada for this loan to buy goods to sell and display in the refrigerator.  Noor is very grateful to everyone who helps her, and the one who appears on the photo is her husband Jamal, for cultured reasons she can’t publish her photos online, so she apologies.

loans.use: to buy goods to sell and display refrigerator.

loans.name: Shakeela

texts.en:
Shakeela is a 31 year old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.  She is a responsible mother of four children.  Her husband has been running his own business of medicine retailing and wholesaling for the past twelve years.  He is the guardian of his family and is also responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family.

Shakeela's husband needs to buy different kinds of medicines for reselling purposes to increase sales and to meet the demands of his customers, but due to financial constraints he is not in a suitable position to buy these medicines.  Therefore Shakeela has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan to help her husband in his business.  This loan will enable her husband to buy these medicines as per his business needs and this will also enable him to earn a profitable income from his business.  On this financial assistance, Shakeela is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of medicines for her husband's medicine business.

loans.name: Rachael

texts.en:
Rachael is a forty year old married female with ten children of which eight go to school.  They are living in Kasese, Uganda.  She is in the farming business and she rears goats for extra income.

She started the businesses to generate income and pay school fees for her children.  She hopes for success in becoming a model farmer in her area but competition and weather changes are challenges she faces.

Rachael is requesting for a loan to buy maize for planting.

loans.use: to buy maize for planting.

loans.name: Renee

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QOCHASAYWAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Renee tiene 47 años es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos,la socia es emfermera y tambien se dedica al negocio de venta de prodcutos de belleza como cremas,lapiz labiales y perfumes,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza.La socia solicita el credito para comprar perfumes,cremas y lapiz labiales.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Renee belongs to the “Qochasaywas” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco, in the department of Cusco.

Renee is 47 years old. She lives with her partner and has 2 children. She is a nurse and also works in the business of selling beauty products such as lotions, lipsticks, and perfumes. She works from 8:00am until 5:00pm. She has been in this business for 7 years and it is going very well for her. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell beauty products. She is requesting the loan to buy perfumes, lotions, and lipsticks. 

She is happy about the loan and pledges to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, lotions, and lipsticks.

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
El socio Augusto  pertenece al banco comunal YAHUAR MAQUI; él socio tiene 62 años de edad tiene 08 hijos y es casado, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de confección de ropa deportiva ,el socio confecciona casacas, polos entre otros a sus clientes que le solicitan, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, él socio a la vez tiene una orquesta musical donde toca para los distintos compromisos que solicitan sus servicios, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca adelante  a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de un equipo de sonido.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Augusto belongs to the “Yahuar Maqui” communal bank. He is 62 years old, has 8 children, and is married. He alternates his daily activities with the business of sewing sports clothing. He makes jackets and t-shirts, among other items. His clients seek him out. He is a responsible and hardworking person. He also has a musical orchestra and he plays at different events where his services are requested. This is how he provides for his family. 

He is requesting the loan to buy a sound system. He is grateful for the loan that has been provided and he pledges to make the agreed-upon repayments.

loans.use: to buy a sound system.

loans.name: Nisida Ruth

texts.es:
La socia Nisida Ruth tiene 20 años es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo,la socia se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como pollos , la socia las gallinas lo vende en forma ambulatoria, ella las hace engordar y crecer y los vende en el mercado de Calca, por medio de estos negocios la socia saca adelante a su hijo, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar en el negocio de crianza de animales. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar pollos al por mayor. 

 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Nisida Ruth is 20 years old. She lives with her partner and has one child. She raises animals such as chickens. She sells her chickens as a street vendor. She raises and fattens them and sells them in the market in Calca. It is through this business that she provides for her son. She would like to expand and improve her animal raising business. 

She is requesting the loan to buy chickens at wholesale price. She is happy about the loan and pledges to make her repayments.

loans.use: to buy chickens at wholesale price.

loans.name: Tahiran

texts.en:
Tahiran is a 42-year-old woman and mother of two sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a paan shop where he sells different flavors of paan (chewable betel leaf) and other items like candy, cold drinks, juices and similar items. He is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Tahiran's husband needs to purchase different types of relevant goods for his business so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth and earn maximum profit. However, due to an unfavorable financial position he is not able to purchase these items for his business himself. 

Tahiran has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for business purposes. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of business-relevant items and soft drinks.

loans.name: Danitza

texts.es:
La socia Danitza pertenece al banco comunal YAHUAR MAQUI, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco.
La socia Danitza tiene 20 años de edad y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de comida en uno de los mercados de la ciudad del  Cusco, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose  a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, a la vez la socia se dedica a la venta de cerveza, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma salir adelante.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de insumos como arroz, aceite entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Danitza belongs to the “Yahuar Maqui” communal bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, in the province of Cusco.

Danitza is 20 years old and single. She alternates her daily activities with selling food in one of the markets in the city of Cusco. She has been in this business for some time and it's going well for her thanks to the hard work she puts into it each day. She also sells beer. She wants to continue working in these businesses in order to get ahead in life.

She is requesting the loan to buy ingredients such as rice and cooking oil, among others. She feels grateful for the loan that has been provided and pledges to make the agreed-upon repayments.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice and cooking oil, among others

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is a 40-year-old, married woman with six children of whom four go to school. She has been in the produce business for 25 years, working from the market. She started her business to increase income and and to pay school fees for her children, knowing the importance of education. Her dream is becoming a leading seller of produce in her area, although weather changes and competition are challenges that she faces.

Margret will use the loan to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Luz Edid

texts.es: Luz es una mujer trabajadora y carismática, labora por días como empleada doméstica en casas de familia. Hace un año empezó a vender mercancía como lociones, ropa y accesorios. Aprendió del negocio trabajando con su hermana que se dedica a esto hace muchos años. El crédito lo quiere invertir en la compra de mercancía al por mayor (perfumería, cremas corporales, accesorios, ropa en general) y así poder ofrecer mayor variedad de artículos para satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, con el fin de incrementar sus ingresos. Su sueño es montar un almacén y contratar empleados, en el que pueda salir adelante y generar mayor rentabilidad para dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Luz is a hardworking and charismatic woman. During the day, she works as a domestic employee at private homes. A year ago she also began selling merchandise such as lotions, clothing, and accessories. She learned about this business by working with her sister who has been in this trade for many years.

Luz wants to invest this loan in the purchase of merchandise in bulk such as perfumes, body crèmes, accessories, and clothing. By having a wider variety of products, she will be able to satisfy the tastes and needs of her customers. In the end, she will be able to increase her earnings. Her dream is to open a shop and hire employees. This would enable her to move forward and generate higher profits so that she can provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, body crèmes, and accessories for resale so she can one day open her own shop

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia María Antonieta pertenece al banco comunal YAHUAR MAQUI, él banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco.
La socia tiene 40 años de edad ,03 hijos y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva buen  tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia elabora diferentes tipos de palto como arroz con pollo, saltado, sopas entre otros, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como carnes, aceite, arroz entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
The member María Antonieta belongs to the communal bank, Yahuar Maqui.  The bank is located in the district of Cusco, within Cusco Province. She is 40 years old, she has three children, and she lives with her partner. 

She alternates her daily activities with her restaurant business. She has had her business for quite some time, and it is going well, thanks to the effort that she puts into it every day. She prepares various dishes such as Chicken with Rice, Saltado (stir-fried beef and red onions, mixed with potatoes), soups, and others.

The member is a responsible and persevering person, and this is the way that she supports her family. She is requesting the loan for the purchase of supplies such as meat, oil, rice, and similar items. 

She feels thankful for the loan that she has been given, and she promises to make her scheduled payments.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as meat, oil, rice, and similar items.

loans.name: Kennedy Lenis

texts.es:
El es  Kennedy Lenis, decidió estudiar auxiliar de enfermería en CAMPO ALTO, ya que le dijeron que era un gran instituto, el pensó que podría ser una institución común y corriente, pero que grata sorpresa se llevo cuando ingreso a estudiar y se dio cuenta de que no era cualquier instituto, se dio cuenta de que es uno de los mejores institutos a nivel nacional, con grandes estándares de calidad, una ética profesional, docentes altamente calificados con grandes conocimiento, lo cual hace que los estudiantes de CAMPO ALTO salgan excelentemente preparados a nivel profesional y  personal.
Ahora  kennedy lenis recomienda a  los amigos CAMPO ALTO, como unos de los excelentes instituto para formarse a nivel profesional, pero siempre basándose en la ética y una cultura amena.
Por medio de compañeros se entero del convenio de kiva, lo cual le pareció de una grata ayuda para el y los estudiantes de la carrera, el beneficio de kiva seria de gran ayuda ya que el valor de las cuotas mensuales quedaría mas económico y los gastos se pueden hacer mas mínimos.
texts.en:
This is Kennedy Lenis. He decided to study to be a nursing assistant at Campo Alto, since they told him that it was a great institution. He thought it could be an ordinary place, but what a pleasant surprise he had when he began to study and he noted that it wasn't just any institute. He noticed that it is one of the best institutions at the national level, with great standards of quality, a professional ethic, and highly qualified teachers with great knowledge, which means that the students of CampoAlto leave with excellent preparation at a professional and personal level. 

Now Kennedy Lenis recommends CampoAlto to his friends as one of the excellent institutions for training at a professional level, but always based on ethics and an enjoyable culture.

Through his classmates, he learned about the agreement with Kiva, which appeared to be a great help for him and the students in the program. The benefit of Kiva would be of great assistance, since the amount of the monthly payments would be more economical and the expenses could be smaller.

loans.use: to pay for a semester of school fees

loans.name: Clarissa

texts.en: Clarissa is the sole provider for her family. She has been widowed. To earn a living, she has a farm that serves as a rooting chamber in their village. For two years, she has successfully sustained her business that was started with her husband before, and she earns well from this. Recently, she borrowed a loan from GDMPC microcredit to access capital for farming and rooting chamber costs. In the future, she wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family.

loans.use: for farming and rooting chamber costs

loans.name: Selema

texts.en: Selema is single and operates a farm to earn a living. For nine years she has been growing and harvesting coconut and fruit trees in their village. It helps a lot to support her needs. She has sustained her farm and been able to save for future emergencies. Recently, she borrowed a loan to purchase organic fertilizer. In the future, Selema wants to improve her farm to ensure better income for the family’s future.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man is 65 years old, a farmer, and lives in a small village of Prey Chhor district, Kampong Cham province. He is married and is responsible for six children, four of whom live with him and his wife while his two oldest children are married and live separately. His main activities are farming and sales of rice, which he does once a year with the support of his family members. He has been in the field growing rice for more than 35 years.

Now he needs a loan which will be used to arrange a wedding party for his child who is going to get married soon. He knows that without a helping fund from lenders, he will be exposed to a great expense. He hopes to get this loan from Kiva lenders and he is confident of paying it back on time. He is very thankful in advance.

loans.use: to arrange a wedding party for his child.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 30 years old, running a shop alongside cocoa production. She is married and has got three children in Bundibugyo-Uganda. Her business has been in existence for ten years and she deals in cocoa farming as a side income. Her market segment is composed of both men and women as she is a hardworking woman, though unfavorable seasonal changes affect her cocoa production. Sarah dreams of having a big retail shop in the future.

She is requesting a loan to buy cocoa and sugar plus rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa and sugar plus rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, sand, blocks, cement, and iron

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QOCHASAYWAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Maria Elena tiene 44 años es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de ceviche que es un plato a abase de pescado con limon y lo acompañan de camote,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 11 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de ceviche.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pescado,limon y camote.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member, María Elena, belongs to Qochasaywas Communal Bank, located in the Cusco district in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.  She's 44 years old and married, and she has two children.

María Elena makes a living selling ceviche, a dish made of fish with lime and served with sweet potatoes.  She works from 8 in the morning until 4 in the afternoon.  She has been in the business for 11 years and it's going very well for her.

She's requesting the loan to buy fish, lime, and sweet potatoes.

María Elena's dream is to expand her ceviche business.  She's happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy fish, limes, and sweet potatoes

loans.name: Julinda

texts.en: Julinda, a mother of one, has managed a farm for ten years and she earns well to support her family. She sustained it with the support of the entire family. Aside from this, she also has a general store where she earns daily. The couple wants to provide a better education for their child. That's why she has to work more for it. She took a loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy organic fertilizer.  In the future, she wants to improve the business as well as the general condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Analie

texts.en:
Analie is 29 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar.

Analie has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 6 years and also earns income from raising pigs.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, eggs, milk, and sugar

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is a twenty-seven-year-old single parent with one child living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a primary school teacher for three years and also does farming to supplement his income. Joel wants money to buy land and hopes to construct his own house, however, low pay is a challenge that he faces. Joel is a hardworking and honest man who intends to use the loan to buy land.

loans.use: to buy land

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
A $1000.00 loan is offered to Adelina to improve her business. She has a kiosk where many people come to buy every day. She will buy some additional supplies, such as milk, eggs, sugar, salt, cigarettes, coffee, soy sauce, soy sour, and bread. She has been involved in business activities since 2002. 

She feels comfortable running her business because she can earn money every day.

Running a business has made Adelina independent because she can be responsible for herself while also helping her family. She hopes to run a bigger business in the future. And she is happy with this loan because it is offered for poor people to improve their living conditions in the future.

loans.use: to buy milk, eggs,sugar, salt, cigarettes, coffee, soy sauce, soy sour, and bread

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 22-year-old, single young man from the city of Jabalia. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. His father works as an employee in a local firm, from which he gets a low income. Mohammad is a student in a local university where he studies basic education. He would like to finish his studies and find a job as a teacher. 

Mohammad took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his homework and write reports easily. Mohammad appears in the photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for study

loans.name: Rania

texts.en:
Rania is a 20-year-old, single young woman from Gaza City. She lives with her family in a small, simple house. Her father works as an employee in the public sector where he earns a low income. Rania is a student in a local university where she studies basic education. She would like to finish her study and find a job as a teacher. 

Rania took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her buy a new laptop for her studies. By taking this loan, Rania will be able to do her homework and write reports easily. Rania appears in this photo with her new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her studies

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 30-year-old lady married with three children, residing in Bundibugyo-Uganda. Her cocoa business has been in existence for 15 years and she depends on it totally as a source of income for her and the entire family. As a hardworking woman, she has the determination to expand her business and take all her children to school, though she is affected by weather changes.

Maria has asked for a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is a 32-year-old married man from Jabalia city. He lives with his wife and three kids; two sons and one daughter, in a small simple house. He works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. Abdallah is also a student in a local university where he studies social development. He would like to finish his studies and find a better job.

Abdallah took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his study. By taking this loan, Abdallah will be able to do his homework and write the reports easily.

Abdallah appears in the photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study

loans.name: Anwaar

texts.en:
Anwaar is a conservative person, who prefers not to have her photo published online. As a result, her father appears in this photo.

Anwaar is a 23-year-old, single young lady from the city of Jabalia. She lives with her family in a small, simple house. Her father works as a construction worker, as which he earns a low and unstable income. Anwaar is a student in a local university where she studies health education. She would like to finish her studies and find a job to help her family with part of their expenses. 

Anwaar took a USD Murabaha loan from FATEN. This loan will help her buy a new laptop for her study. By taking this loan, Anwaar will be able to do her homework and write reports easily.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her study

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en:
Aminah, aged 25 years old, lives in Hoima-Uganda. She deals in selling beans, tomatoes and rice on a small scale. She ventured into this business to get income to support her family and improve their standard of living.

Limited capital hinders her business; yet she desires to expand her business.

Aminah wants a loan to buy produce, primarily beans, rice and fresh foods to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce, primarily beans, rice and fresh foods to sell.

loans.name: Santos Isabel

texts.es:
Santos  es un hombre de 55 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Esta acompañado,  la esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ellos han procreado 10 hijos en este matrimonio de los cuales 7 viven con él,  3 están en la escuela y 4 que le ayudan en la agricultura y tres que están trabajando y en hogares apartes, con don santo solo viven  los 7 hijos la esposa y un nieto por lo tanto solo ellos dependen de él.  

Don Santos  se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 8  años de edad,  este trabajo se lo enseño el papá  con la mentalidad de en un futuro se pudieran defender en el  trabajo. El lugar en donde realiza su labor esta a una distancia  de 15 minutos y él viaja a pie, su horario de trabajo es de  6 de la mañana hasta las doce del mediodía 

Don Santos  con el préstamo solicitado lo necesitara,  para comprar cuatro  tubos que le servirán como poste del tendido eléctrico y comprara todo los materiales para instalar la energía eléctrica en la casa  y también pagara los derechos de bajar la luz.  Esto le ayudara mucho ya que los hijos que están estudiando les dejan deberes en las noches, están con la luz de candil; pero ya con el préstamo les ayudara a ellos para que presenten sus deberes y salgan bien en los estudios, eso es lo que más anhela,  que ellos salgan bien y se preparen ya que él no tuve la oportunidad de estudiar.
texts.en:
Santos is a 55-year-old man. He didn't have the opportunity to go to school. He is married, and his wife takes care of the domestic duties. They have produced 10 children in this marriage, of whom 7 live with him. Three are in school,  4 help him in agriculture, and 3 are working and live in separate households. Only 7 live with Don Santos, his wife, and a grandson, so they are the only ones who depend on him.

Don Santos has worked in agriculture since he was 8 years old. His father taught him this work with the mindset that in the future he could support himself with it. The place where he does his work is 15 minutes away, and he travels there on foot. His work schedule is from 6 in the morning until noon.

Don Santos needs the loan that he has applied for to buy four tubes that will serve as an electric utility pole, and he will buy all the materials to install electrical energy in his home. He will also pay for the right to connect to the electrical grid. This will help him a lot, since his children who are in school have homework at night. Now they have candlelight, but the loan will help them so that they can do their homework and do well in their studies. This is what he most desires, that they do well and prepare themselves, since he did not have the opportunity to go to school.

loans.use: to buy four tubes that will serve as a utility pole, along with all the materials to install electrical energy in his house, and also to pay for the right to connect to the electrical grid.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old, single young man from the city of Jabalia. He lives with his family in a small, simple house. His father works as an employee in a local firm where he gets a low income. Mohammad is a student in a local university where he studies Arabic literature. He would like to finish his studies and find a job as a teacher. 

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to do his homework and write reports easily. Mohammad appears in this photo with his new laptop.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es:
Valeria tiene 50 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad donde se puede apreciar grandes depósitos de ripio y arena que la población utiliza para la construcción de sus viviendas, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicado en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región de Lambayeque que pertenece a la costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta de productos medicinales y nutrientes, las ventas lo realiza en su domicilio, así como en caseríos aledaños, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Valeria, 50, lives with her spouse and children in the Cayaltí district, where there are large deposits of stone and sand that people use to build their homes.  It's in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region, on the northern coast of Peru.  The residents of Cayaltí work in agriculture, commerce, and ranching.

Valeria sells medicinal and nutritional products at home as well as in nearby communities.

She has requested a loan for 1,500 nuevos soles [PEN] to buy a variety of products to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of medicinal products

loans.name: Ulezi Group

texts.en:
Swaumu, who is a single woman, is in her late 30s. Swaumu has one son who is still in school. Since 2008, she has had a shop servicing three activities. She has a beauty salon, a beauty products selling business and a cold soft drinks business where she has a refrigerator outside the shop. She works at her business from 8 am to 9 pm each working day and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This is Swaumu's 15th loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans, all of which she repaid in full, to expand her portfolio by starting a beauty products business and buying a refrigerator for selling cold soft drinks. She is really doing great and appreciates your support.

Swaumu manages to earn extra income that she uses to pay rent for her house and cover school fees and household expenses. She will use this loan to buy new beauty products for her business like cosmetics, women's clothes etc. Swaumu dreams that one day she will be able to have a better life and improve her business. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Ulezi", which includes three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy new business beauty products like cosmetics, woman clothes etc.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad de 63 años de edad, vive solo con una hija, su nivel académico es muy bajo ya que solo estudio segundo grado sus hijos trabajan y le ayudan, solo un hijo depende de ella, los demás ya están acompañados.

Ella se dedica a la agricultura y al comercio de productos comestibles, venta de pan, casi toda la vida se ha dedicado a esta actividad,  ya que su madre le ayudo y le enseño este oficio, su negocio es a veces ambulante y trabaja todos los días.

El crédito lo necesita para mejorar su negocio de venta de productos comestibles como pan y la otra parte para reparar su casita, ya que esta es de bahareque y tiene que arreglarla antes que llegue el invierno para no mojarse y así vivir mejor.

Sus sueño es tener sus casita de bloque y que este bien construida para dejársela a su hijo, el cual le ayuda al sostenimiento de ella, también seguir trabajando fuertemente en el negocio para que gane más ingresos y pagar la obligaciones del crédito.
texts.en:
Soledad, age 63, lives with only one daughter.  Her academic level is very low, as she only studied through second grade. Her children work, and they help her.  Only one child depends on her; the rest are already in relationships. 

She works in agriculture and she sells groceries, such as bread.  She has been engaged in this occupation nearly all her life, as her mother helped her and taught her this work. Sometimes she carries out her business on foot, and she works every day. 
 
She needs the loan in order to improve her business selling groceries such as bread; and she will use part of it to repair her home, as it is made of wattle and daub, and she has to fix it before winter in order to keep from getting wet. This way she will live better.

Her dream is to have a house made of block that is well-built, in order to leave it to her son, who helps to support her.  Also, she wants to continue working hard in the business so that she could earn more income, and make her loan payments.

loans.use: to improve her business selling groceries such as bread, and to repair her house, as it is made of wattle and daub.

loans.name: Tadeo

texts.en:
Tadeo is a 62-year-old man, married with four children, who lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He has specialized in cocoa growing, an endeavor he started in 1992 with the aim of earning income. Tadeo supplies his cocoa product to a company called ESCO within Bundibugyo, Uganda. He describes himself as one with many gardens of cocoa. Still, he has a challenge of inadequate land for expansion, which shows how he is hardworking. 

Tadeo needs the loan to pay for labor on his cocoa plantation.

loans.use: to pay for labor on his cocoa plantation

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 39 years old and resides in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is an active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She is a mother of two daughters and her husband has been running his own cattle farming business for the past twenty years.  He is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family and for managing the household.
Shazia's husband wants to purchase sheep and goats for his business but due to financial constraints, he is unable to purchase these cattle.
Therefore, Shazia has requested a loan from Kiva from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy the cattle to fulfill the needs of his business.  This will also be good for him to earn maximum profits from his business.
For this financial assistance, Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy sheep and goats for her husband's live stock business.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sokha is 27 years old and married. She has two children. To support the family, she and her husband have been farming rice. The current business earns her family about 30,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Sokha has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for five cycles already and she successfully used the past loan to better support her family to have sufficient food. Now she is leading her group to apply for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Gloriefe

texts.en: Gloriefe owns and operates a retail store, selling a variety of different products to earn her living. For more than three years, she has sustained and improved the business.  She has also successfully repaid her previous loan used for this business. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She wants to expand her business to ensure a better source of income for the family. Gloriefe hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell.

loans.name: Maritess

texts.en: Maritess is 49 years old and runs a general store business to generate income. At the present, she is having difficulty earning enough income to meet her daughter's school necessities. She would like to increase her product offerings in order to earn bigger sales. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP in order to buy soft drinks, canned goods, snacks, beverages, eggs, detergents, and biscuits to sell. Maritess knows that through patience and hard work, she's will look forward to completing her daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, canned goods, snacks, beverages, eggs, detergents, and biscuits to sell

loans.name: Sol's Group

texts.en:
Sol is 32 years old and married. She lives with her family in a rural area located in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She has four dependent children to take care of and now they are in school in the local area. Rice farming is the only primary source of her family’s income to make a living and she has been in this business for one year. Sometimes her husband works for others for a fee. With the current business, she can earn approximately 67,000 KHR per day and save about 40,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is the second micro loan for Sol with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, Sol is going to use her portion to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business so as to earn a larger income to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Gevina

texts.en:
Gevina is 25 years old, has one child, and stays in Bundibugyo, Uganda.  Her major business is cocoa growing which is affected by seasonal changes in the weather.  As a result, low yields in cocoa production leads to low income for her business.  She is a hard-working lady and hopes to buy land for cocoa growing as her future dream. 

Gevina has requested a loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 49-year-old lady whose residence is in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

She is the mother of four children. Her husband owns a furniture shop in which he manufactures beds, sofas, tables and chairs. Her sons are very expert in manufacturing furniture. Her husband has been making furniture for many years and, with the help of his sons, his business has become very well established. Their practice is to make furniture and then polish the furniture to finish it. Polish increases the shine, grace and value of furniture.
The demand for furniture suddenly has increased. Her husband has spent all his money to buy raw materials but he still needs additional material.  Now, he does not have enough money to buy his remaining raw materials.

Therefore, Razia has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that her husband is able to buy the remaining materials. She is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for making furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her daughter’s tuition fees at the university

loans.name: Surya

texts.en:
Surya is a 52 year old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her nine children. Her husband has been a meat seller for many years; he is responsible for fulfilling the needs of the family. Surya also provides sewing services and earn an income to contribute to her husband's responsibility of managing the household.
 
She is in need of different kinds of goods, such as threads, pieces of cloth, machine oil, and more, for her business purposes. However, due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore she has applied for a Kiva loan, from field partner, BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above-mentioned accessories and will also be helpful for her to increase monthly sales and profit by providing better sewing services.

Surya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy some products for her business, such as clothes, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is from Pangabuan, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental. Alice has been running a general store, selling a variety of food and home-use products in the local community. She also sells snacks and refreshments in her area. Alice successfully repaid her previous loan, used for her business. In 2011, Alice joined GDMPC and she gained access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She took another loan recently to purchase additional biscuits and beverages to sell. She hopes to have a better living situation in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional biscuits and beverages to sell

loans.name: María Lizbeth

texts.es:
María Lizbeth
Poas
Venta por catálogo


María  Lisbeth trabaja con Fundación Mujer desde el 2011, demostrando una excelente conducta de pago. Ella inicia su negocio con el crédito y ha consolidado un negocio en la zona y ahora tiene la colaboración de su hija mayor y de su esposo quiénes han visto su desarrollo en la actividad, además el  importante aporte que hace al hogar. Tiene 2 hijos en secundaria y les apoya en los estudios, gracias a los ingresos de su microempresa. Ha mejorado su forma de negociar y la relación con sus clientes, espera que este nuevo proyecto de crédito individual, fortalezca su empresa, 

 Recientemente ha cancelado su crédito, consolidando su actividad, creciendo en clientes y recibiendo la colaboración de su familia, esto gracias al nivel de ventas que ha desarrollado, requiere un mayor capital de trabajo.

Los préstamos concedidos le han permitido crecer, tanto a nivel personal como empresarial va a ofrecer nuevos catálogos; dándole seguimiento a los que ya trabaja, ofreciendo una mayor variedad de producto.

Mujer emprendedora, ha desarrollado un micro negocio para apoyar a su familia, cuenta con una cartera de clientes establecida, además del apoyo familiar en cuanto a ventas y acompañamiento.
texts.en:
María Lizbeth
Catalogue Sales
Poas

María Lizbeth has worked with Fundación Mujer since 2011 and has an excellent payment record.  She started her business with a loan and has become established in the region.  Now she has the help of her oldest daughter and her husband, who have seen her development in her job and the important contribution she makes to the household.  María Lizbeth has two children in secondary school, and she supports them in their studies thanks to the income from her small business.  She has improved her way of doing business and her relationship to her customers.  She hopes this new project with an individual loan will strengthen her business.

Recently she has paid back her loan, strengthened her business, expanded her clientele, and received help from her family.  She needs more working capital because her sales have flourished.

The loans María Lizbeth has received have allowed her to grow personally as well as professionally.  She's going to offer products from new catalogues, following up with the ones she already works with to offer a wider variety of products.

She's a enterprising woman who has developed a micro-business to support her family.  She has an established customer portfolio as well as family support in sales and companionship.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfume, and other catalogue products

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en:
Nat, 58, lives in a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, in Cambodia.  She is married and has one child.  For the last 35 years, Nat has been farming and growing peanuts, earning about 55,000 KHR per day.

Nat has been with VisionFund for one loan cycle and completely paid back the past loan.  She is now leading her group to ask for a loan.  She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds for her farmland.

Nat hopes that this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business so she may improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sunguchini Group

texts.en:
Mwahija is a mother of two sons and one daughter, and all of them are in school. She is in her mid-forties and is married.  For seven years now, Mwahija has made her living by running several businesses. She manages a beauty salon and fabrics enterprise. Maize farming is another of Mwahija's businesses and she pays labors for the farming.  She normally runs farming during the rainy season since she is unable to afford irrigation. Mwahija works from 8:00am to 11:00pm per day and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This will be her fourth loan from Kiva's partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans--all of which were paid back successfully--to buy salon hair products. She managed to earn extra income which she used to build a house, cover school fees, household expenses and plow back to business. Mwahija is thankful to everyone for the loan support. She is requesting another loan which she will use to pay for her farm laborers and buy maize seeds. In the coming years, Mwahija would like to improve her business portfolio. 

She will share this loan with her loan group" sunguchini" which totals six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to pay for her farm labors and to buy maize seeds.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is aged 38 with 4 children living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. The main business she runs is cocoa farming through which she supplies cocoa to a company called ESCO. She also has a retail business as side income for her family and for self sustainability. Inadequate capital and unpredictable weather changes are what affect her profit margins and the business as well.  She dreams of expanding her business and cocoa plantation. 
Ester needs the loan to buy cocoa for selling.

loans.use: to buy cocoa for selling.

loans.name: Kimhong's Group

texts.en:
Kimhong is a 45-year-old married mother of three children.  For four years she and her husband have been farming rice and working for others for a fee to earn a living. The current business earns about 70,000 KHR per day toward the family’s need. 

Kimhong’s group consists of two female members who live in the same village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province.  She is pursuing her fifth microloan with VisionFund and is the leader of her group.  Kimhong will use her portion of the loan to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland.  She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield so that she can earn a better living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Channarin's Group

texts.en: Channarin, a 27-year-old married mother, lives in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. To make a living, she has been farming rice and working for others for a fee. Her current business earns her 60,000 KHR per day and she manages to save 20,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. Channarin has been with VisionFund for one cycle and completely paid back her past loan. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her husband to earn a large income so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

loans.name: Elena Margarita

texts.es: La señora  Elena tiene 55 años y 2  hijos de las edades de 11 y 15 años,  ella se dedica a la confección de overoles de trabajo en su taller que se encuentra ubicado en su mismo domicilio por la zona de Paraíso,  el destino del crédito es para la compra de material de construcción para la construcción de su casita y así de esta manera brindar comodidad a su familia, la señora Elena es una persona muy trabajadora lleva años en esta actividad está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella ya que esta es la única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia.
texts.en:
Sra. Elena is 55 years old and has two children (ages 11 and 15). She produces overalls from a workshop located in her home in the District of Paraíso.

The purpose of this loan is to buy construction materials for building a small house so that her family can live comfortably. Sra. Elena is a hardworking person who has been at her business for years. She is grateful to Emprender for the support it has provided to her since this business is the only means by which she is able to sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a house.

loans.name: Phally's Group

texts.en:
A married father of three children, Phally is age 42 and lives in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district, Cambodia. To support his family, he and his wife have been farming rice, raising chickens and charging batteries in their village. They have been in this business for ten years, earning about 40,000KHR per day. 

Phally is on his first microloan with VisionFund. Now he is leading his group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Phally is going to use his portion to buy chicken feed. He hopes to fatten his chickens in order to sell them for a good price.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael lives and farms in the Chuka area of Eastern Kenya with his wife and five children.He has been farming for 15 years and his primary income sources include milk, cereals and bananas. He enjoys milking and feeding his animals. His biggest challenge is marketing his products. 

Michael chose Juhudi Kilimo because they help farmers in financing their projects. During the training, he learnt that micro finance institutions (MFIs) help the poor to access finances. This dairy loan will lead to increased income for Michael from the sale of milk. This will improve their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Cheangmei's Group

texts.en:
Cheangmei, aged 29 years, is a married mother of three children. Her family lives in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. To feed the children, she has been selling clothes and sometimes her husband works for others for a fee. She can earn about 67,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

Cheangmei has been with VisionFund for four cycles. Cheangmei successfully paid back her loan, which has helped her relieve her family’s burden and improve her livelihood. Now, she is leading her group of two to apply for a new loan. As the leader, Cheangmei is going to use her portion to buy more clothes for resale. She hopes to get a high crop yield from her plantation so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Peacock Group

texts.en:
Epimack, who is in his mid-thirties, is divorced and taking care of his two school-going children. For seven years now, Epimack has been managing a general store, selling cooking oils, vouchers, breads, soft drinks and others. He also manages a genge [a very basic structure which sells general items] business, selling charcoal, fruits and vegetables. He opens his business from 8 AM to midnight daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit. 

This is Epimack's sixth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans, all of which he paid back successfully, to buy sacks of charcoal for his genge business. With the profit received, Epimack covered home food expenses and school fees for his kids. He will use this loan to rebuild his genge place with iron and steel materials. He needs to make his place strong against thieves who broke into his place and stole business items. Epimack dreams that one day he will be able to buy a motorbike for business purposes. 

He will share this loan with his loan group "Peacock" which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to rebuild his genge place [grocery stall] with iron and steel materials.

loans.name: Chanthy

texts.en:
Chanthy is 49 years old, and lives in a village about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has two daughters, and one attends school but the other is still young. 

Chanthy grows and sells small mango trees at home, while her husband is a policeman. She wants to expand her business, so she is asking for a loan. She will use the loan to grow small mango trees by buying sacks, land and fertilizer.

loans.use: to grow small mango trees by buying sacks, land and fertilizer.

loans.name: Thul

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Thul is aged 35 years and married. She and her husband have three children. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice, raising cows and growing vegetables, and Thul also works in a garment factory to earn more income. With her current business, she is able to earn approximately 32,000 KHR per day to support her family. 

This is the first loan for Thul with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is requesting a loan with VisionFund of 2,000,000 KHR to buy cows to raise. She hopes to have more crop yields and sell them for a good price so as to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy cows to raise.

loans.name: Ruos

texts.en:
Ruos (pictured here), age 36, lives in a village about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has four sons; three attend school, and another one is still too young.
 
Ruos is a garment-factory worker, while her husband grows small mango trees and vegetables at home. He carries vegetables by his own motorbike to sell at market, approximately 5 kilometers from his home. He wants to expand his business.

Ruos wants to buy a motorcycle for her husband to carry vegetables to market, and the current motorbike will let her children drive to school.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle to carry vegetables to market.

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Sokly, 47, lives in a rural area of the Bati district of Takeo province. She is widowed with three children. The family’s main sources of income come from growing rice and sometimes working for others for a fee. She has been in this business for 10 years. 

Sokly is just with VisionFund for this cycle. She is applying for a loan to buy a proper motorbike for her family’s commuting. She hopes this loan will enable her to reduce travel expenses.

loans.use: to buy a proper motorbike for her family’s commuting.

loans.name: Shagufta

texts.en:
Shagufta is a 33-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan, with her family. Her husband has been running a small general store at the corner of his house for many years. He has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She is a mother of two children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health expenses.

Shagufta wants to financially help the growth of her husband’s general store, so she requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan. Now, he can buy more stock of rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap and biscuits. 

She is an honest and regular client of BRAC Pakistan. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history. She is expecting a boost in the earnings and dreams of expanding the business further in the future. She is very thankful to Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy inventory for her husband's general store.

loans.name: Rem's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager from the Kandal Stoeng district of Cambodia, Rem is aged 48 years and married with four children who are still in school. She and her husband are hard-working farmers who make a living through farming rice and working as garment workers. She and her husband have been in this business for five years. Currently, she is able to earn about 40,000 KHR per day.

Rem has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for five loan cycles and successfully paid back the past loans with VisionFund. The loans from VisionFund have helped her family, her family’s business and enabled them to have a better house. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy cows to support her farming. She hopes to grow her rice on time so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy cows to support her farming.

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana is a 44-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She has been knitting embroidery by hand at home for many years to support her family. Her husband has grown old and stays idle at home. One of her sons is doing work in a firm but earns an insufficient income to support his family. So, he brings some embroidery work home for his mother. Shabana helps her son complete daily tasks related to embroidery. She sells knitted embroidery in her hometown. By this time, she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income.

She is a mother of six children and is motivated to provide for her family. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she has requested a loan for purchasing raw materials so she can knit and directly sell embroideries into the market to generate a healthy income for her family. She hopes to get a boost in her earnings through her large sales. She wishes to utilize a portion of revenue to provide a quality education for her children.

loans.use: to buy sequins, pearls, threads and a wooden frame for embroidery.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for renovations to her shop and to buy scissors, a curling iron, and a hair dryer.

loans.name: Srun

texts.en:
Srun now works for a company that produces glasses. He lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. He has seven children: four sons and three daughters. Three of his children are married; two are musicians; one is a garment-factory worker; and another one attends school. 

Srun’s children have a set of musical instruments; in Khmer it is usually called Ork Kadong. The people prefer to rent Ork Kadong to entertain and dance in weddings, some religious ceremonies, and especially during the Khmer New Year.

Some of the musical instruments are old, and Srun’s children want to replace them, but they don’t have money. Hence, Srun decided to apply for a loan to help his children to purchase new musical instruments.

loans.use: To help his children to purchase new musical instruments.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.en:
Franklin is a farmer living in the Chuka area of Eastern Kenya with his wife and four children. He has been farming for five years, and he produces and sells bananas, cereals, milk and eggs. He also has a transport and a retail business. In farming, he loves selling maize and beans. His biggest challenge is insufficient rainfall.
