Franklin chose Juhudi Kilimo because they assist farmers in accessing loans that will help them in their projects. During the training, he learned that MFIs (Micro Finance Institutions) help small-scale farmers to develop a lifestyle of saving.

The loan to purchase poultry will lead to an increase in eggs, and thus, an increased income for his household. Also, his family will have sufficient food for their upkeep.

loans.use: to purchase poultry.

loans.name: Rina

texts.en:
Rina (in the photo) has been married since 2005 and has two daughters. One of her daughters attends school and the other one is still young.
 
Rina lives with her parents on an island of the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.
 
Rina stays at home and does housework. Her main source of income is from her husband’s business. He is a wooden house crane constructor. He wants to buy additional construction crane materials for operating his business because some of his materials are old and do not work well.   

Hence Rina decided to apply for a loan to help with the purchases.

loans.use: to help her husband’s wooden house construction business by buying additional construction crane materials.

loans.name: Sokhim

texts.en:
Sokhim, aged 35, lives in a rural village of Sa Ang district and has two children. She and her husband are farming rice. To supplement their income, her husband also sells fish and vegetables. She has been in this business for 15 years and can earn about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 
This is a micro loan for Sokhim. She is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Walter Alirio

texts.es:
Walter es un joven de 26 años de edad y que estudio hasta sexto grado, debido a las condiciones económicas que pasaba su familia él no logro seguir estudiando para superarse en la vida, él es casado su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos en su vivienda y a cuidar de su único hijo de 1 año y medio de edad.		

Walter se dedica a los trabajos de fontanería en su pueblo, pues es una actividad que le genera ingresos económicos para su familia,  tiene aproximadamente 2 años de dedicarse a esta actividad contratado por la municipalidad de su pueblo, aparte de realizar esta actividad también se dedica a administrar una hacienda y que realiza los trabajos cuando sale de su trabajo de fontanería. Él tiene un horario  factible de 7 de la mañana a 3 de la tarde, posteriormente se va a trabajar a su segundo trabajo. 

El financiamiento del préstamo lo utilizara para la remodelación de su vivienda, específicamente lo que el remodelara será la cocina, pues las condiciones que presenta no son las adecuadas para cocinar y más aún que ya se acerca el invierno tiene miedo que se le moje su cocina, comprara bloques de concreto, laminas, hierro y madera, este pequeño proyecto de inversión es un deseo que tenían junto a su esposa de mejorar su casa y le permitirá tener una mejor calidad de vida para su pequeño hijo y su esposa, más seguridad y confianza. 

Walter desea para el futuro tener una mejor calidad de vida para él su esposa y su pequeño hijo, vivir cómodamente en un lugar digno para su hijo y que su hijo siga estudiando para que en el futuro sea  una persona profesional  y logre terminar sus estudios con una carrera universitaria, todo esto lo lograra con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación con su esposa y mucho trabajo y por supuesto con futuros prestamos que sacara.
texts.en:
Walter is a young man of 26 years of age. He studied up until the sixth grade; due to his family’s financial situation he was not able to continue studying to get ahead in life. He is married and his wife looks after their home and their only child: a son, who is one and a half years old.

Walter makes a living doing plumbing work in his village, which generates income for his family. He has been doing this job for approximately two years as a contractor for his village. He also manages a farm when he has finished with his plumbing work for the day. He works from 7am until 3pm as a plumber, and then he goes to his second job.

He will use the financing from the loan to remodel his home, particularly the kitchen as the conditions are not adequate for cooking and winter is approaching and he is afraid the kitchen will get wet. He will purchase cinder blocks, metal sheets, iron, and wood. This small investment project is a result of his wife’s and his desire to improve their house and it will allow their family to have a better quality of life with greater security and comfort.

In the future, Walter wants his family to have a better quality of life, to live comfortably in a decent place, and for his son to continue studying so that he can become a professional with a university degree. He and his wife will achieve all of this with a lot of effort and dedication, a lot of work, and with future loans.

loans.use: to buy cinder blocks, metal sheets, iron, and wood to remodel the kitchen in his house

loans.name: Razia's Group

texts.en:
Razia, aged 44, is a responsible mother living happily in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She belongs to a poor family and it is very difficult for her to fulfill all the household expenses with low income. In fact, her husband owns a scrap shop and deals with scrap iron, aluminum, plastic bottles, waste papers, etc. He has been running his business for many years. His shop is situated near his home. 

Nowadays he has gotten a huge contract to buy scrap iron from a firm so he can sell large quantities to the recycling factory, but he does not have sufficient cash in hand to show his consent to the dealer. 

Therefore, Razia has requested a loan for her husband, so that he can buy scrap iron, establish his enterprise and make some savings to meet sudden needs or incidents.
 
Razia is very impressed with this honorable support and shows her wish to take a huge loan after this loan. She thanks Kiva and the field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy scrap goods for reselling to the recycling factories.

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en:
Rubina is a 38-year-old married woman. She is a hardworking and brave mother who is helping her family by providing tailoring services in her community. As a mother, she wants to provide better facilities for her children, so this is the reason she is doing extraordinary hard work to keep her children smiling.

She has been sewing clothes since the birth of her two children. When she observed that her husband failed to provide all the necessities for her children, she decided to start tailoring work at home, and up until now she has been sewing clothes in her community. She wants to enhance the beauty of her stitching, so she wants to buy a juki machine (a professional sewing machine). Professional people use this machine for tailoring because its speed is very good.

Rubina knows the techniques of tailoring very well. Her regular customers are mostly her neighbors, relatives and the local community people. She requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine and some packs of zippers and buttons to meet increasing demands. She is very thankful to Kiva and Field Partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a juki machine for sewing clothes.

loans.name: Sophat

texts.en:
Sophat has been married since 2004 and has two children, who are in school. She lives with her parents in a village across the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. Her husband is a construction worker.

Sophat buys and sells vegetables. She buys vegetables from fellow villagers and carries them to sell in a local market. She does not have her own motorbike to transport vegetables to the market, so she spends a lot of money on transportation costs very often. Hence, she decided to apply for a loan to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike in order to transport vegetables to the market.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en: Mary Grace is 31 years old and married. To help her husband elevate their standard of living, she engages herself in a direct selling business in which she sells deodorant, lipstick, cologne and lotion. Presently, she wants to have more products to offer, but her capital is not enough to run her business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy make-up kits, lotion, and perfume to sell. She hopes that her business will continue to grow and also hopes to put up her own stall someday.

loans.use: to buy make-up kits, lotion, and perfume to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy construction materials for replacing the roof of his house.

loans.name: Sreymao

texts.en:
Sreymao (in the photo) is 32, and lives in a village about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has two sons - one attends school and the other one is still young.  

Sreymao buys and sells vegetables. She buys vegetables from her fellow villagers and transports them to sell in a Phnom Penh market. Her husband assists his wife in the business. 

Sreymao has a place in the market where she sells vegetables and she now wants to expand her shop. That’s why she decided to request a loan to buy another space in the market.

loans.use: to buy a space in the market to sell vegetables.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is well established and living in the Chuka area of Eastern Kenya, which is an area with very high productivity. She has been farming for the past 15 years. Her main source of income comes from the sale of bananas, cereals, milk, and eggs. When farming, she enjoys working in her land and taking care of her animals, but her biggest challenge is marketing problems.

Rose chose Juhudi Kilimo because they help farmers to uplift their living standards. During the training, she learned that MFIs help the poor access loans. Through the use of this loan, Rose's income base will increase, and she will better educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase farm input.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine, overlock machine and electric scissors.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy an air conditioner, a generator and an iron.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en:
Chanthou is a widow, and lives in a village approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has one son and one daughter. Her son attends school and he is also a Korean teacher. 

Chanthou has full-time employment with an NGO in Phnom Penh. Her daughter sells grocery items at home and she wants to buy more grocery items, so that she can better support her customer’s needs. Therefore, Chanthou applied for a loan to help her daughter to buy more grocery items for resale.

This photo is of Chanthou in her daughter’s grocery shop.

loans.use: to help her daughter to buy more grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Fetah

texts.en:
Fetah is 47 years old and has 5 adult children. Like many people in his community, he is involved in agriculture in order to make a living. He plants corn and sells it to others and his wife stays home to care for the house. Until now, he has had to pay others to cut the grass in his yard, which adds to his monthly expenses. 

Fetah is now requesting a loan in order to purchase a lawn mower so that he can save on the monthly expense, and also cut grass for others for a fee, which will add to his income. He is very happy to have an opportunity to see his family have a better future and looks forward to his new business.

loans.use: to purchase a lawn mower so that he can save on the monthly expense and cut grass for others for a fee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his daughter's education.

loans.name: Suryia

texts.en:
Suryia is a 40-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her children who are studying. Her husband has been running his own garment business for three years. He is the only person responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. He needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these clothes for his garment business. 

Therefore, Suryia is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband in purchasing these clothes in bulk for his business. With the help of this loan, he can increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit.
 
Suryia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase garments to sell

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a farmer living in the Chuku area of eastern Kenya. She is married and has two children, both of whom are school-going age. She has been doing farming for 10 years. Her primary source of income comes from the sale of milk, bananas, and cereals. She enjoys farming because she earns a living out of it, while her challenge is the lack of rain.

Caroline chose Juhudi Kilimo because they help the farmers in undertaking their projects with the loans they give them. During the training given, she learned that MFIs do help the poor with ways in which they can improve their income. This loan will increase their income and bring an improvement in their living standards.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and build a new room for sewing.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.es: Hilaria vive en la encantadora ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú y se sienta contenta de vivir en esta ciudad. Su actividad económica es la venta de golosinas, galletas, snack y otros cosas mas, ella es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que saca adelante a su familia y pertenece al banco comunal "Huayna Picchu" de la Asociación Arariwa y en esta oportunidad requiere el prestamo para comprar dulces, chocolates, chicles, galletas, productos de snack, jugos en cajas y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Hilaria lives in the charming city of Cusco in the south of Peru and she is happy living in this city. She sells lollies, snacks and other things. She is an enterprising and hardworking woman who is bringing up her family. 

Hilaria belongs to the Huayna Picchu communal bank at the Asociación Arariwa and right now she needs a loan to buy lollies, sweets, chocolates, lollipops, biscuits, snacks, cartons of juice, individual yoghurts and soft drink.

loans.use: to buy lollies, sweets, chocolates, lollipops, biscuits, snacks, cartons of juice, individual yoghurts and soft drink

loans.name: Nusrat

texts.en:
Nusrat is a 37-year old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been manufacturing rubbers for many years. He buys raw materials from the market and brings it to a high temperature to melt. The raw material melts under high temperature and then he injects it into dies to give it a specific shape. In this way, he manufactures spare parts, sells them in the market and makes enough income to contribute to his family's livelihood.

She has four children and she barely manages to satisfy their needs. She is required to provide them with good food, health, and education. She needs to earn additional income to support her family well. She is in her sixth loan cycle with BRAC Pakistan and it will be her first loan with Kiva. Currently, she has requested a loan to buy more raw materials for manufacturing rubber through the molding machine so that her husband can increase his sales. She expects a boost in her earning and wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

Nusrat is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for manufacturing rubber.

loans.name: Assetou

texts.fr:
Madame ASSETOU née en  Avril 1978 à Sikasso, elle est mariée,  mère de 4 enfants et réside avec son époux aux logements sociaux ATTBOUGOU  à SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Madame ASSETOU mène les activités d’achat et de vente d’habillements pour femmes  il ya environ quatre ans, elle mène cette activité de façon ambulante.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle sollicite auprès de l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso un deuxième prêt.  
Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et à Dakar. Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat d’environ 10 pièces de bazin et 10 pièces de tissus pour la revente en détail en ambulante à une clientèle composée principalement des femmes au comptant et à crédit. 
EIle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40 000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’une part de payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre part pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Assetou was born in April 1978 in Sikasso.  She is married, has four children and lives in a social housing unit in Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).  Assetou has been selling women's clothing for around four years, she makes her sales on foot.

In order to respond better to the growing demands of her customers, Assetou works with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  This will be her second loan with the organisation.

Assetou buys her supplies in Bamako and Dakar.  She will use this loan to buy ten pieces of damask and ten pieces of other fabric, which she will then sell on foot, to women, for cash or on credit.  She expects to earn a monthly average of 40,000 francs CFA, and will use her earnings to repay her loan and interest.  She will save the rest of her earnings.

loans.use: to buy damask and other fabrics for resale.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “QOCHASAYWAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco

La socia Bertha tiene 45 años de edad es casada y tiene 3 hijos,la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas,lapiz labiales y perfumes,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los productos de belleza.La socia solicita el credito para comprar perfumes,cremas y lapiz labiales. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This group member belongs to the Qochasaywas communal bank located in the district of Cusco of Cusco province in the Cusco department. 

Bertha is 45 years old and married with three children. She sells beauty products such as creams, lipstick and perfume from 8am until 5pm. She has worked in this area for seven years and it is going very well for her.

Bertha’s dream is to have a store where she could sell her beauty products from. She has requested a loan to buy perfume, creams and lipstick. 

Bertha is happy about this loan and she promises to honour all her loan repayments.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams and lipstick

loans.name: Jumelle Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe JUMELLE sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles traditionnelle à SANOUBOUGOU I un des quartiers populaire de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme AMINATA fait la vente des boissons dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt 25 casiers de 24 bouteilles de boissons à SIKASSO, sa vente se fait en détail sur place et au marché de  à une clientèle composée d’ hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 50 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five women of the 'Jumelle' Group are married and are, on average, forty-three years old, and have four children.  Most of them live in traditional families in Sanoubougou I, one of the busy districts of the town of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).

This will be the group's eighth loan with the field partner, Soro Yiriwaso.  They work with this organisation in order to satisfy the demands of their customers.

Aminata (standing second from the right in the photo) sells drinks.  She will use her loan to buy twenty-five crates of twenty-four bottles of soft drinks in Sikasso.  She sells the drinks to men and women, locally and at the market, for cash or on credit.

Aminata expects to earn a monthly average of 50,000 francs CFA, which she will use to repay her loan and interest.  She will save the rest of her earnings.

loans.use: to buy drinks for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and wooden beams

loans.name: Sabaly Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre membres du groupe SABALY sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants, vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaire de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme KOROTOUMOU fait la vente de tomate dans ce groupe femmes. Elle est assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  2 corbeilles de 100 kg de tomate à Médine pour la revente en détail à la maison et au marché à une clientèle composée d’ hommes et de femmes en espèce. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 21 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The four members of Sabaly Group are married women with an average age of 41, and an average of four children. They are living for the most part in traditional families in Hamdallaye, one of the popular districts of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are on their first loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and have the goal of satisfying customer demand.
 
In this group of women, Korotoumou is a merchant of tomatoes. She is shown in the photo sitting on the far right. With her loan, she intends to purchase two 100 kg baskets of tomatoes in Medina. These she will retail from her home and at the market to a clientele composed of men and women.

Korotoumou hopes to earn an average monthly income of 21,000 Francs CFA, a portion of which she will use to repay her loan and its interest. The remainder she plans to keep for her savings.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
La socia es la señora Susana, la socia continua dedicándose a  la Ganadería, principalmente  la venta de leche de vaca, la socia lleva años dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia vende leche a todos sus clientes que solicitan sus servicios, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de una vaca.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
This group member is called Susana. She is still working with cattle, mainly selling dairy cows. She has worked in this area for many years and it has gone very well for her thanks to the effort that she puts into her work every day. She sells milk to all the customers that seek out her services. She would like to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family.

Susana is requesting a loan to buy a cow. She is grateful for the loan she has been granted and she promises to honour her repayments.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El socio es el señor José, el socio continua dedicándose a la Ganadería a la venta de leche de vaca, él socio vende a todos sus clientes que le solicitan , a la vez el socio continua dedicándose a brindar transporte público interprovincial, él socio es una persona responsable y empeñoso, el socio lleva años dedicándose a esta actividad el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de una vaca y alimento.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
José is a borrower who continues his activity of cattle raising and selling milk.  He sells to all customers who request it and he also works in inter-provincial transportation.  He is a responsible, hard-working man who has been in this line of work for several years.  Business has gone well for him because of his dedication.

José wants to continue working and supporting his family.  He is requesting a loan to buy a cow and animal feed.  He is very grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy a cow and animal feed.

loans.name: Ndiaya's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée le 21 décembre 2012 à l'inauguration du bv de Maka Séreres. Il est composé de membres habitant le même village et ceux environnants qui vivent dans la bonne entente et sont solidaires entre elles.

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la vedette Khady est âgée de 59 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants dont 02 garçons.

Son prêt reçu, elle achète 04 moutons à 25 000 frs l'un, des produits sanitaires à 10 000 frs.En parallèle elle fait une activité secondaire comme la vente de légumes et sucre qu'elle revend à la place du village et dans les marchés hebdomadaires du village voisin. Elle élève les moutons et quand le remboursement approche, les revend en se faisant un bénéfice pour payer son prêt. 

Avec les bénéfices reçus, elle participe au bon fonctionnement de son foyer en aidant son mari dans les charges familiales.
texts.en:
This group was created on 21 December 2012 at the inauguration of the 'banc villageois' Maka Séreres.  It is made up of women who get on very well and work to support one another.  They all live in the same village, or nearby villages.

Khady (standing on the right of the photo, with her hand raised) is fifty-nine years old.  She is married and has four children, of whom two are boys.  She will use her loan to buy four sheep for 25,000 francs CFA each, and health products for 10,000 francs CFA.  When the time comes to repay her loan, she will sell the sheep and use the profit to repay the loan.  

In parallel with this, Khady runs a second business selling vegetables and sugar in the local village square, and at the weekly markets in the neighbouring village.

Khady uses her earnings to help her husband provide for the expenses of their family, and ensure the smooth running of their household.

loans.use: to buy sheep for fattening up for resale.

loans.name: Benkelema Group

texts.fr:
Les cinq membres du groupe BENKELEMA sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 31 ans, et ont en moyenne 4 enfants, vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à HAMDALLAYE un des quartiers populaire de la ville de SIKASSO  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. 
Mme KONIMBA fait la vente de friperie dans ce groupe de femmes. Elle est assise à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
 Elle compte acheter avec son prêt  1 balle de friperie à Sikasso pour la revente en détail à la maison et au marché à une clientèle composée d’ hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit. 
 Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 20 000 francs CFA dont une partie est  utilisée  pour payer le prêt et son interêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
The five members of the Benkelema Group are married women with an average age of 31, and an average of four children. They are living for the most part in traditional families in Hamdallaye, one of the popular districts of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are on their first loan with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and have the goal of satisfying customer demand.
 
In this group of women, Konimba is a merchant of used clothing. She is shown in the photo sitting second from the left. With her loan, she intends to purchase one bale of used clothing in Sikasso. She will retail her merchandise from her home and at the market, for cash and on credit, to a clientele composed of men and women.

Konimba hopes to earn an average monthly income of 20,000 Francs CFA, a portion of which she will use to repay her loan and its interest. The remainder she plans to keep for her savings.

loans.use: to purchase one bale of used clothing.

loans.name: Elida Elizeth

texts.es: Elida se encuentra muy feliz porque gracias al apoyo financiero brindado por los inversionistas en KIVA en alianza con COMIXMUL, compro abono, fertilizantes, pago mano de obra para la recolección del grano y la limpia de la misma. Gracias a este financiamiento su vida tuvo un gran cambio pues la tasa de interés es muy cómoda y el periodo de pago es beneficioso para ella como pequeña productora. Después de la enfermedad de la roya que fue afectada antes de su primer financiamiento ella relata su economía era muy mala ya que el tiempo, dinero invertido la roya lo consumió y no tenía como volver a levantarse pero gracias a este financiamiento ella pudo dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivo afectado y recuperar parte de ello. Hoy en día en compañía de su esposo pudieron llevar a cabo la elaboración de un vivero por el cual hoy en día solicitan un segundo financiamiento para la compra de insumos agrícolas con los que podrán dar asistencia y mantenimiento a sus cultivos de café y poder cultivar el vivero que ya tiene para sembrar. Elida espera nuevamente ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma KIVA para poder llevar a cabo sus planes de sembrar el vivero dar mantenimiento al mismo así como también mejorar sus cultivos y la producción.
texts.en:
Elida is thrilled because thanks to the financial support of KIVA lenders in alliance with COMIXMUL, she bought fertilizer and hired workers to harvest and clean the coffee beans.  Thanks to this financing her life changed greatly since the interest rate was very comfortable and the payment terms were beneficial to her as a small producer.  Before her first loan, her economy was bad due to the crop's rust disease which caused a loss of time and money invested; and she did not known how to get back on her feet.  Thanks to the financing she was able to care for and maintain the affected crop and recover part of it.

Now, she and her husband have set up a greenhouse and are requesting a second loan to buy farm supplies for the coffee crop and to cultivate in the greenhouse where they will plant seeds.  Elida is hoping to be supported again by different KIVA lenders so she can carry out her greenhouse plans and also improve her crop production.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies for coffee crop care and maintenance.

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es:
Pedro Jose vive en la encantadora ciudad del Cusco al sur del Perú y se sienta contenta de vivir en esta ciudad porque tiene hermosos paisajes y la gente es amigable. Su actividad económica es la preparación de desayunos,almuerzos y cenas y perteneces al banco comunal de la Asociación Arariwa y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos por ejemplo panes, leche, mermeladas, carne y otras cosas mas.
 
Agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo y se siente contento por el apoyo y se compromete a pagar las cuotas con mucha responsabilidad.
texts.en:
Pedro Jose lives in the charming city of Cusco in southern Peru where he is happy to live because of the beautiful scenery and friendly people.  He runs a food business, preparing breakfast, lunch and dinner.  He belongs to a communal bank of the Arariwa Association and on this occasion is requesting a loan to buy breads, milk, jams, meat and other items.

He is grateful for the loan and support, and committed to paying the loan back in a very responsible manner.

loans.use: To buy supplies such as breads, milk, jams, meat and other items.

loans.name: Patrick  Mbégane

texts.fr:
Patrick Mbégane est un jeune qui fait du commerce depuis 3 ans. Il est célibataire sans enfant et habite dans un village situé dans la zone appelée » Petite Côte ». Il a ouvert une boutique d’alimentation générale qu’il veut renforcer en prenant un crédit. Il s’agira pour lui d’acheter de l’huile, du riz, du lait, du sucre denrées qui sont le plus rapides à écouler.
Patrick Mbégane est célibataire et habite encore dans la maison familiale, ce qui lui vaut de s’occuper de la dépense quotidienne et du payement des factures d’eau. Avec les revenus de la boutique, il peut gérer ces charges.
Vu qu’il a une clientèle fidèle, mais qui demande aussi certaine denrées qu’il n’a pas, il aimerait avoir un grand magasin de grossiste avec tout ce qu’il faut comme alimentation dans le cadre général.
texts.en:
Patrick Mbégane is a young man who has been a merchant for three years. He is single with no children and lives in a village in the area called "Petite Côte". He opened a general food supply store that he wants to expand through taking a loan. He will use this loan to buy oil, rice, milk, and sugar, which are the supplies that sell more quickly.

Patrick Mbégane is single and still lives in his family home, and is responsible for paying for his daily needs and the payment of the water bills. With the income from his shop, he can handle these responsibilities.

Since he has a loyal customer base, but who have a demand for some foods he does not carry, he would like to have a large wholesale shop with everything necessary in the general food sector.

loans.use: to purchase food supplies that he will resell in his shop.

loans.name: Astou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée le 21 décembre 2012 lors de l'inauguration du banc villageois de Maka Sereres. Il est composé de membres habitant le village et ceux environnants. Leur principale activité est le petit commerce. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la vedette Khardiata est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 03 filles. 

Son prêt reçu, elle va acheter 02 fûts d'arachide de 100 kgs chacun à 400 frs le kg qu'elle revend entre 600 et 650 frs le kg. Elle achète également un paquet de savon de 24 morceaux à 4000 frs qu'elle revend à 250 le morceau et de la lessive (savon en poudre) le sac à 8000 frs qu'elle revend à 100 frs dans de petits sachets qu'elle fait en détail. Ainsi elle réalise un bénéfice de 1500 frs par sac. 

Avec la totalité des bénéfices, elle renforce ses épargnes, paie la scolarité de ses enfants de aide son mari dans la gestion du foyer.
texts.en:
This group was formed on 21 December 2012 at the inauguration of the 'banc villageois' Maka Sereres.  It is made up of women who all live in the same village, or in nearby villages.  Most of the women are small traders.  

Khardiata (standing on the right of the photo, with her hand raised) is forty-seven years old.  She is married and has seven children, of whom three are girls.  

She will use her loan to buy two barrels of peanuts (each weighing 100kgs) for 400 francs CFA a kilo, she will resell them for 600-650 francs CFA a kilo.  She will also buy a box of twenty-four soaps for 4,000 francs CFA, which she will resell at 250 francs CFA a piece.  In addition, she will buy a sack of washing powder for 8,000 francs CFA, this she will sell in small packets for 100 francs CFA each, making a profit of 1,500 francs CFA.

With all her profits, Khardiata will pay for the schooling of her children, help her husband provide for the needs of their household, and increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy peanuts, soap and washing products (such as soap powder) for resale.

loans.name: Paulina Doris

texts.es:
La socia Paulina continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de leche, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia vende su mercadería todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia lleva años dedicándose este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada di a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de leche para su negocio.
 La socia Paulina pertenece al banco comunal “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real” de la Asociación Arariwa y se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Paulina continues with her milk selling business. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman who sells her goods to everyone who requests them. She has been in this business for several years and has done very well as a result of the effort she puts into her work; so she wants to continue working to support her family.

Paulina is requesting a loan buy milk for her business.

Paulina is a member of the Communal Bank “San Bartolomé de Tambo Real”, which is part of Asociación Arariwa. She is grateful for the opportunity given to her and promises to complete her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy milk for her business.

loans.name: Willmar Stanley

texts.es: Willmar tiene 23 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposa y su pequeña hija de 3 años de edad. Willmar trabaja como empleado en un taller cercano a su localidad desde hace 2 años. Wilmar desea repellar la pared y encementar el piso de la vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de cemento, arena y grava ya que no puede hacerlo por su propia cuenta por no contar con el capital disponible pero si tiene la capacidad de pago que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Wilmar is 23 years old and lives at home with his wife and his young daughter who is 3 years old. Wilmar has been working as an employee in a nearby neighborhood workshop for 2 years.

Wilmar wants to plaster the wall and put in a concrete floor of the house which is why he is asking for this loan from FUSAI in order to buy cement, sand, and gravel as he can not do it on his own since he does not have cash-on-hand but he has the ability to make loan payments.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and gravel in order to plaster the wall and put in cement floors in his home

loans.name: Fatid Janeth

texts.es:
La joven Fatid es una persona responsable, emprendedora  y  trabajadora vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras es madre soltera y vive junto a su  hijo  y sus padres.
Doña Fatid su negocio es la  elaboración de ropa y tiene 4 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, el préstamo lo necesita para la  compra  de telas e hilos para seguir elaborando su producto. 
Doña Fatid espera que la inversión le permita obtener las ganancias necesarias para seguir apoyando a su familia e hijo, también planea aumentar su nivel de  ventas.

Choluteca, Honduras – Febrero del  2014
texts.en:
Fatid is a young, hard-working, responsible, enterprising woman who lives in a community in southern Honduras.  She is a single mother and lives with her son and her parents.

Fatid has been in the sewing business for four years and makes clothing.  She needs a loan to buy fabric and thread to continue with her work.

Fatid hopes the loan will allow her to earn the money necessary to continue supporting her family and son.  She also wants to increase her sales volume.


Choluteca, Honduras - February, 2014

loans.use: To buy fabric and thread for her business.

loans.name: Martina Esperanza

texts.es: Martina Esperanza mayor de edad, casada, con un hijo aún bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, ella es una microempresaria la cual posee en su casa de habitación una pulpería donde vende todo tipo de productos desde granos básicos como: arroz, azucar, frijoles, golosinas, detergentes, leña, aceite hasta productos congelados; las compras las realiza al contado en camiones distribuidores, así como también en mercado de este municipio, las ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales, los créditos los recupera los quince y treinta de cada mes. Martina Esperanza desde muy temprano abre las puertas de su pulpería para ofrecer sus productos y de esa manera brindar una mejor atención a los clientes. El objetivo de este crédito es para invertirlo en capital de trabajo en la compra de granos básicos y productos congelados entre otros, ella está agradecida con los inversionistas kiva por la ayuda que les brindan apersonas de escasos recursos económicos y a países pobres como Nicaragua, para tener fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en:
Martina Esperanza is mature aged, married and still cares for one child. She comes from one of the municipalities of Chinandega located in the west of the country. Martina Esperanza is a small business holder who runs a grocery store out of a room in her house where she sells all types of products including staple items such as rice, sugar, beans, lollies, detergent, wood and oil, as well as frozen products. She pays in cash for her purchases from delivery trucks as well as from the municipal market. The sales are made in cash and on credit to regular and sporadic customers. Credit payments are repaid on the 15th and 30th of every month.

Martina Esperanza opens her grocery store’s doors very early to offer her products for sale so that she can give her customers the best possible service. She aims to invest this loan in working capital to buy staple items and frozen products, amongst others. She is grateful to Kiva lenders for the support they offer people of scarce financial resources in poor countries like Nicaragua which allows them to have sources of employment.

loans.use: to buy staple items such as rice, sugar, beans, oil, detergent, lollies and frozen products amongst others

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée le 21 décembre 2012 à l'inauguration du bv de la localité. Il est composé de membres qui habitent le village et ceux environnants.  Les membres vivent dans la bonne entente et sont solidaires entre eux. Leurs principales activités sont l'embouche et le commerce. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la vedette Mbayang est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants dont 04 filles. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle achète 02 moutons à 20 000f l'un, 10 000 f d'aliments et de produits sanitaires qu'elle élève pendant 06 mois. Le reste de l'argent elle achète des légumes qu'elle revend dans les marchés hebdomadaires en sorte de fonds de roulement. Elle revend entre 45 000f et 55 000 f pour les moutons et revend avec un bénéfice de 10 000 à 15 000 frs pour ce qui est des légumes. 

La totalité des bénéfices générés, elle investit dans le domicile conjugal en aidant son mari dans la gestion du foyer, assiste ses enfants pour les frais scolaires, les frais médicaux et leur habillement.
texts.en:
This group was created December 21, 2012 at the inauguration of the city's Banc Villageois. It is composed of members who live in the village and the surrounding areas. The members live in harmony and mutual solidarity. Their main businesses are fattening livestock and working as merchants.

Shown standing at the far right of the photo with her had raised, the featured borrower, Mbayang, is 47 years old. She is married and the mother of eight children, four of whom are girls.

With the loan she receives, she is purchasing two sheep at 20,000 Francs CFA each, and 10,000 Francs CFA in food and health products for fattening the sheep for six months. The rest of the money she uses to purchase vegetables that she resells at the weekly market to increase her working capital. She resells the fattened sheep for between 45,000 and 55,000 Francs CFA per head, and resells her vegetables at a profit of 10,000-15,000 Francs CFA.

With the income she earns, Mbayang invests in the marital home by helping her husband in the management of the household expenses, and paying for her children's school fees, medical expenses and clothing.

loans.use: to purchase sheep which she will raise and resell at the end of six months.

loans.name: Nikko James

texts.en:
Nikko James is studying a Basic Seaman Training Course at the University in Zamboanga del Sur. His parents earn from their salary as government employees and have three dependents, so paying educational costs is not easy. He is requesting this loan to pay school tuition fees. His goal is to become successful and he always encourages his siblings to continue studying so that they prepare themselves and become professionals. He dreams of having a better career in order to have a better life in the future.

Each semester, GDMPC allows borrowers to take out two loans. This is one of the two loans for Nikko.

loans.use: to pay school tuition fees

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: Luz Marina tiene 57 años de edad y tiene dos hijos, ella vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú y se siente alegre por vivir en esta ciudad. Luz Marina es una mujer emprendedora que saca adelante a su familia y su actividad económica principal es la elaboración de pizzas pues tiene dos pequeños locales, ella pertenece al banco comunal "Huayna Picchu" de la Asociación Arariwa y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de harina, aceitunas, tomates, cebollas, aceite y otras cosas mas.
texts.en:
Luz Marina is 57 years of age and has two children. She lives in the beautiful city of Cusco in the south of Peru and she is happy to be living in this city. 

Luz Marina is an enterprising woman who is bringing up her family. Her main source of employment is making pizzas in two small stores. She belongs to the Huayna Picchu communal bank at Asociación Arariwa and right now she needs a loan to buy supplies such as sacks of flour, olives, tomatoes, onions, oil, and other items.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sacks of flour, olives, tomatoes, onions, oil, and other items.

loans.name: Argentina Group Daraja

texts.en:
Juliana is in her early thirties and married with two children, who are both still at school. She has been running two projects: a farm and a retail shop. She has been in her business for seven years now. She works from 6.30am to 10pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Juliana's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy equipment and more seeds to plant in her farm. She dreams of building her own house.  

Juliana will share this loan with her loan group "ARGENTINA" which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy equipment and more seeds to plant

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
Balqees is a forty-eight-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her two daughters, who are both studying. Her husband has been running his own business selling clothes for eight years. He is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. 

For his business, Balqees's husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk to resell but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to make this purchase. To assist her husband in this purchase, Balqees is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. Not only will this loan enable him to buy different types of clothes to resell, it will also help him increase the size of his business and earn a greater profit. Balqees is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of clothes for her husband's clothes-selling business.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc villageois a été crée le 21 décembre 2012. Il est composé de membres qui vivent dans le village dont le bv porte le nom et ceux environnants et qui inspirent confiance. L'entente et la solidarité sont très respectées dans le groupe. Leurs principale activité est l'embouche et le commerce. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la vedette Fatou est âgée de 51 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 05 garçons. 

Avec le prêt reçu, elle achète 02 moutons au niveau des marchés hebdomadaires à 40 000f l'un de l'aliment bétail avec le reste et engraisse à l'approche de la date de remboursement pour revendre à 75 000 f chacun. 

Les bénéfices générés par l'activité, elle achète un mouton pour les besoins de la famille avec une partie et l'autre va servir à appuyer le mari dans les charges familiales, assister ses enfants pour la scolarité, l'habillement et les soins de santé en cas de besoin.
texts.en:
This group was created December 21, 2012. It is composed of members who live in the village of which the Banc Villageois bears the name, and its surrounding areas. The members inspire trust and confidence, and understanding and solidarity are highly respected within the group. Their main businesses are fattening livestock and working as merchants.

Shown standing at the far right of the photo with her hand raised, the featured borrower, Fatou, is 51 years old. She is married and the mother of five boys. With the loan she receives, she is purchasing two sheep at the weekly markets for 40,000 Francs CFA each, and livestock food with the rest. She will fatten the sheep until near her loan repayment date, when she will resell them for 75,000 Francs CFA each.

With the income she earns in her business, Fatou purchases one sheep to pay for the needs of the family, and the income from the other will serve to support her husband in the household expenses, paying for her children's school fees, clothing, and medical expenses when necessary.

loans.use: to purchase sheep that she will raise and resell after a certain time.

loans.name: Sinat

texts.en: Sinat is 39 years old, a married woman of four children, living in Takeo Province. She is a farmer and her husband who is with her in the photo runs a business of purchasing junk materials to resell. Both of them can earn $10 per day. Now Sinat would like to apply for a loan of $500 to raise her husband’s business capital for buying junk materials to resell. This loan helps her husband’s business in getting more profit as well as getting a better standard of living.

loans.use: to raise her husband's business capital for buying junk materials to resell

loans.name: Kiran

texts.en:
Kiran is a 32-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has owned a shop for stitching and selling embroidery by machine in his nearby town for many years. He has been recruiting skilled people for embroidery work on daily wages; he also brings some material back home for Kiran because she helps him in embroidery work. Kiran's husband is an expert in his profession; he is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like his arts and appreciate his efforts. 
Kiran's husband wants to cope with increasing demand for bridal dresses which is why he wants to buy stocks of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors in bulk.
Kiran requires some capital to buy the desired inventory for her husband but she does not have the sufficient amount. That is why she humbly requests a loan from BRAC Pakistan. Through this loan her husband would be able to buy stocks of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors. Kiran is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw material for embroidery.

loans.name: Silvard

texts.en:
Silvard lives in Sevan city which is in the Gegharkunik region. She is already a rather successful businesswoman and feels happy, since she has managed to find a very good and reliable partner in her business. Her credit history is exemplary and rich, with three very profitable partnerships with Kiva and its field partner Nor Horizon. Silvard has her own shop where she runs a food and household goods trading business. Her shop is much visited, since she has a great assortment of sweets, cakes, soft drinks, juices, bread, sausages and a great variety of household goods. The sale of these all help Silvard to offer a better quality of life to her family. In her business her husband and daughter help her very much. Thanks to her business, Silvard managed to improve her family's living conditions and she managed to buy a car which she needed to bring in merchandise for her shop.

Now, Silvard asks a loan of 1,100,000 Armenian drams to refresh her shop assortment which will surely help her to cater to more buyers and have a higher level of profit from sales.

loans.use: to refresh her shop assortment which will help cater to more buyers and create higher profits from sales

loans.name: Yehowa Akwe-2 Group

texts.en:
This group is composed of four people, who all live in the same neighborhood. The group’s representative, Georgina (standing second from left in the photograph), is 46 years old; she did not go to school much. Georgina lives with her husband and children, all of whom go to school. 
Georgina takes care of the household’s varied expenses and supports her husband to take care of the children. To support her family, she has been selling plates in her region for twenty-one years. Georgina gets her supplies from a market in Accra. To strengthen her business and meet her clients' demands, Georgina, together with her group, is requesting financial support from ID-Ghana for the fourth time. The other group members are into the sale of scarves, fish, and Malta Guinness drinks.

loans.use: To buy plates from the market and sell to customers.

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  SABOUGNOUMA sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  39ans, 5 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la  3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités et elles sont à leur premier prêt. 
Mme AWA (3eme sur la photo de la gauche à la droite)compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 pièces de pagnes. Elle s’approvisionne à KOLONDIEBA et à BAMAKO.Sa vente se fait à KOLONDIEBA à une clientèle composée de femmes.Elle effectue ses ventes au comptant et parfois à crédit. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of Sabougnouma Group are married women who average 39 years of age and five children. They all live in polygamous families in Kolondieba, one of the prefectures in the third administrative region of Mali.

They are collaborating with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their businesses. They are seeking their first loan.

Mrs. Awa (third woman from the left in the photograph) intends to use her loan to buy 10 lengths of "pagnes" (colorful African cloth). She gets her supplies in Kolondieba and in Bamako.

She sells in Kolondieba, for cash, and sometimes on credit, to a clientele composed of women.

She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 15'000 (ca US$  30), which will enable her to repay her loan and to help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to 10 lengths of "pagnes" (colorful African cloth)

loans.name: Toumanibougou Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  TOUMANIBOUGOU sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de  40 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à KOLONDIEBA, une des préfectures de la 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités et elles sont à leur premier prêt. 
Mme MINATA( 2eme sur la photo de la droite à la gauche)compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 2 colis de condiments.Elle s’approvisionne à KOLONDIEBA.
Sa vente s’effectue au comptant à une clientèle composée de femmes.Sa vente se fait  à KOLONDIEBA. 
Mme MINATA compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of Toumanibougou are married women who average 40 years of age and four children. They all live in polygamous families in Kolondieba, one of the prefectures in the third administrative region of Mali.

They are collaborating with Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, in order to carry out their businesses. They are seeking their first loan.

Mrs. Minata (second women from the right in the photograph) intends to use her loan in order to buy 2 packages of condiments. She gets her supplies in Kolondieba.

She sells for cash in Kolondieba, to a clientele made up of women.

She intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 20'000 (ca US$ 40), which will enable her to repay her loan and to help her husband cover daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: Don Juan es originario de la ciudad de Boaco. Es de oficio Agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de Maíz y pastoreo de ganado. Esta agradecido con Kiva y MiCrédito ya que logro comprar unos terneritos que le hacían falta en su ganado. Solicita el crédito para comprar: Cinco terneros. Estima que el crédito le será de mucha ayuda ya que podrá comprar esos terneros y venderlos a un mejor precio obteniendo así mejores ganancias.
texts.en: Juan is from the city of Boaco. He is a farmer by trade and he grows corn and grazes cattle. He is grateful to Kiva and MiCrédito, because he bought some calves he needed. He is asking for the loan to buy five calves. He thinks that the loan will be a big help because he will be able to buy these calves and sell them at a better price, obtaining better profits.

loans.use: to buy five calves.

loans.name: Ines Patricia

texts.es: La Sra. Inés  sigue con la misma actividad de la venta de cosméticos y  productos de belleza por catálogo lleva años con este negocio y también con la institución,  ella entrega a distintos lugares oficinas y domicilios donde le hacen pedidos,  este préstamo es su quinta secuencia dentro de la institución, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el anterior crédito que lo utilizo en la compra de joyas,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de cosméticos al por mayor, la razón para solicitar este préstamo es incrementar su capital de trabajo y así de esta manera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Inés is still making catalogue sales of cosmetics and beauty products, a business she has worked in for years.  She delivers to the various offices and homes where the orders were placed.  This is her fifth loan with the institution.  She said the previous loan went very well for her; she used it to buy jewelry.

Currently Inés is requesting a loan to buy cosmetics wholesale to increase her working capital and improve her family's quality of life.

Inés is happy about this support and grateful to the institution.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
Doña Andrea es una señora muy emprendedora con muchas ganas de salir adelante de 55 años de edad la cual es casada y madre de 4 quienes son personas adultas y en hogares aparte. Doña Andrea aprendió el rubro y oficio de la agricultura ya que desde muy pequeña apoyaba a su padre en la tierra que el cultivaba y hoy en día sigue apoyando de diferente manera hoy con su esposo. El terreno que ella en compañía de su esposo trabaja es propio gracias a una herencia de sus padres ubicados en la misma comunidad a la cual se trasladan caminando desde su casa de habitación. Doña Andrea en su juventud no pudo estudiar por lo que su grado de educación es de primaria cursando 2 años únicamente ya que la economía en su hogar no era la mejor pero aprendió a trabajar fuertemente para educar sus hijos.
Ella sueña con tener una mayor cantidad de tierra cultivada de café, generar mayores volúmenes y así tener un mayor rendimiento sobre su cosecha asegurando el patrimonio para su familia y sus nietos. Para con sus hijos dejarles un patrimonio fuerte el cual puedan seguir trabajando y cada día fortaleciendo más y más. Por lo que ella hoy en día solicita financiamiento con el cual asistirá sus cultivos aplicando insumos agrícolas como abono, fertilizantes, formula cafetalera, fungicidas que evitaran la contaminación de bichos y enfermedades
texts.en:
Andrea is a very enterprising woman who really wants to get ahead. She is 55 years old and she is married and the mother of 4 children who are grown and on their own. Andrea staring learning about the trade of agriculture when she was very young. She helped her father on his land and today she helps her husband in a different way. The land that she works with her husband is her own, thanks to an inheritance from her parents. It is located in the same community and they get there by walking from their house. In her youth, Andrea wasn't able to go to school and so she just has 2 years of primary school.  Her family's finances weren't the best, but she learned to work hard to raise her children.

She dreams of having more land planted with coffee, of generating a greater volume and thus having a better yield from her crop. This way, she ensures an inheritance for her family and her grandchildren. She wants to leave her children a strong inheritance so they can keep working and get stronger day by day. Today she is asking for a loan to help her crops by applying agricultural materials such as fertilizer, coffee formula, and fungicide to avoid bugs and disease.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials to protect, help and thus ensure her coffee crops.

loans.name: G.s El Obraje#4 Group

texts.es:
La  joven  Kelyn es una persona honesta y responsable vive con   su  esposo y sus  padres  en un municipio al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es  la  compra y venta  de  ganado. 
Kelyn el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de vacas y con el préstamo  espera  que sus ventas aumenten gracias a que contara con más mercancía  que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan y así cubrir sus necesidades.
Kelyn  así mismo desea  que  mejore  su situación  económica  y  se vea reflejado  con este préstamo, en unos años desea que su negocio este posicionado como  el más   conocido de la zona y de su  caserío poder asi seguir apoyando    a sus   padres.
Doña Carmen  Estela su negocio  es la  compra y venta  de ganado desde hace 3  años.
Doña María  Ángela su negocio  es  una  pulpería   desde hace 5  años.


Choluteca, Honduras – Enero  del   2014
texts.en:
Kelyn is an honest and responsible person. She lives with her husband and her parents in a town in southern Honduras. Her business is buying and selling cattle.  
 
Kelyn needs the loan to buy cows. She hopes her sales will go up with the loan because she will have more merchandise to offer her customers who visit her and she will be able to meet their needs. 

Kelyn also wants to improve her financial situation and that is reflected in this loan. In a few years, she wants her business to be the best known in the area and in her community so that she can keep helping her parents.

Carmen Estela's business has been buying and selling cattle for 3 years.
María Ángela's business is a convenience store she has had for 5 years. 


Choluteca, Honduras – January, 2014

loans.use: to buy cows for her business.

loans.name: Danilo Jose

texts.es: Danilo José mayor de edad, soltero, con un hijo aún bajo su responsabilidad, originario del municipio de Chinandega, es propietario de una unidad de transporte selectivo (taxi) en el cual presta servicio en esta ciudad; él trabaja dos turnos; él es un hombre trabajador, honrado, responsable con sus obligaciones, que desde muy temprano sale a ofrecer su servicio. negocio que tiene desde hace mas de 10 años Danilo José solicita el préstamo para realizar mejoras en su unidad de transporte como parte del mantenimiento como: juegos de piztones, juego de anillos, juego de valvulas, amortiguadores delanteros, punta de flecha entre otros, para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Él está muy agradecido con los inversionistas kiva por la ayuda que les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y a países pobre como Nicaragua para tener fuentes de trabajo.
texts.en: Danilo José is an adult, single and has a son he is raising. He is from the town of Chinandega and he is the owner of a transportation unit, a taxi. He offers his service in this city and he works two shifts. He is a hardworking man who is honest and responsible with his obligations. He goes out very early to offer his services. He has had his business for 10 years. Danilo José is asking for the loan to to do improvements on his transportation unit. He will buy things like a set of pistons, a set of rings, a set of valves, front shock absorbers, a cv joint and more. This way, he can offer his customers a better service. He is very grateful to the Kiva investors for the help they offer to low income people and poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have sources of employment.

loans.use: to invest in maintenance on his transportation unit.

loans.name: Gloria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Gloria vive en Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas ciudad de la región costa, con un clima agradable. Es una ciudad muy comercial la misma que es considerada puerto terrestre que une a la sierra y a la costa. Gloria es una señora de 55 años, vive sola en casa propia, sus hijos la visitan a menudo ya que viven cerca de su domicilio. Gloria hace 30 años se dedica a la crianza de chanchos, este negocio la ha mantenido por tanto tiempo, gracias a estos ingresos ella pudo levantar su casa poco a poco.
También un día a la semana visita las ferias donde comprar los animales y por la tarde los vende, es una señora muy trabajadora, ha podido salir sola adelante.
Desde hace varios años atrás a trabajado con la institución, gracias a los créditos entregados ella ha podido crecer en su negocio. Ahora solicita para la compra de más chanchitos, quiere comprar tres lechones y el alimento para sus animalitos. 
Gloria siempre está agradecida con la Fundación y con KIVA ya que en estos años la institución han sido cómplice del crecimiento de su negocio porque gracias a los créditos ella ha podido salir adelante.
texts.en:
Gloria, 55, lives in Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, a city with a nice climate in the coastal region.  It's a very commercial city that's considered a land port that joins the highlands to the coast.  Gloria lives alone in her own house.  Her children live nearby and visit her frequently.

Gloria has raised pigs for 30 years.  She has had her business for so long that she was able to build her house little by little.  One day a week Gloria also goes to street fairs to buy animals.  She sells her animals in the afternoon.  She's a very hardworking woman who has been able to make progress on her own.

Gloria has worked with the institution for several years.  Thanks to the loans she has received she has been able to grow in her business.

Currently she's requesting a loan to buy more piglets.  She wants to buy three piglets and animal feed.

Gloria's always grateful to the foundation and to Kiva.  The institution has been a partner in the growth of her business during this time and, thanks to the loans, she has been able to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame AMINATA  née en 1971 à Sikasso, divorcée et  mère de 2 enfants, elle réside chez elle-même aux logements sociaux ATTBOUGOU à SIKASSO 3ième région administrative de la république du MALI. 
Madame AMINATA  mène des activités d’achat et de vente des pagnes wax et des chaussures il ya cinq ans, elle mène cette activivé de façon ambulante.
A fin de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle sollicite auprès de l’Institution de Micro Finance Soro Yiriwaso un quatrième prêt. Elle s’approvisionne à Bamako et à Bobo. Ce prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 30 pièces de pagnes wax et 20 paires de chaussures pour les femmes.
Sa vente se fait en ambulant à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit . 
EIle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000 francs CFA par mois. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et l’autre pour son épargne.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata was born in Sikasso in 1971. She's divorced and the mother of two children. She lives in Attbougou, a social housing in Sikasso, third administrative region of the republic of Mali.

She's been buying and selling "wax pagnes" (colorful African cloth) and shoes for five years.

In order to satisfy the needs of an ever-increasing clientele, she's seeking a fourth loan from Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso.

She gets her supplies in Bamako and in Bobo. This loan will enable her to buy 30 lengths of "wax pagnes" and twenty pairs of women's shoes.

She sells for cash and on credit to a clientele comprising both men and women. She works as a traveling saleswoman.

She foresees turning an average monthly credit of XOF 40'000 (ca US$ 80), which will enable her to repay the loan and interests. The remainder will be put away.

loans.use: to buy 30 "wax pagnes" (colorful African cloth) and 20 pairs of women's shoes.

loans.name: Clémence's Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été crée le 17 avril 2010. Il est constitué de femmes du même village et ceux environnants qui entretiennent de bonnes relations et font comme activité principale le commerce de détail. 

Debout à droite de la photo et levant la main, la vedette Clémence est âgée de 47 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants dont 03 filles. 

Son prêt reçu, elle achète 05 bidons d'huile de 20 litres à 17 000 frs l'unité, 05 sacs de sucre à 25 000 frs le sac pour revendre au détail dans sa boutique du village. Elle revend le litre d'huile à 1 000 frs et le kg de sucre à 700 frs. 

Avec les bénéfices, elle assiste ses enfants pour leurs frais de scolarité, les fournitures et aussi renforcer ses épargnes.
texts.en:
This group was established on April 17, 2010. It is made up of women from the same village or the ones surrounding it. They get along well and their main business is retail.

Clémence, age 47, is the featured borrower of the group. She's the woman standing on the right and raising her hand in the photograph. She's married and the mother of seven children, three of them girls.

Once she gets her loan, she will buy five cans of cooking oil costing XOF 17'000 each and five bags of sugar (XOF 25'000 each), to retail at her shop in the village. Her retail prices are XOF 1'000 for one liter of cooking oil, and XOF 700 for one kg of sugar.

With her profits, she supports her children's school expenses and buy school supplies. She also strengthen her savings.

loans.use: to buy 5 20-liter cans of cooking oil and 5 bags of sugar

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a widow with children, all of whom are grown up. She owns a house that she uses for hiring. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past 28 years, she has been selling plastic products and detergent to her neighbors and passersby. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 1,400 GHS (Ghana cedi), she wants to purchase more plastic products and detergent for resale. She decided to join ID Ghana to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic products for resale.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
La señora Ana  es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable vive junto a sus hijos en una comunidad en la zona sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta  granos  y pescado el cual es muy conocido en su comunidad.
Doña Ana necesita el préstamo para la compra de maíz  y pescado. Los cuales  necesita para seguir realizando su actividad, espera que gracias al préstamo poder contar con los productos necesarios para seguir realizando su negocio y así cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y de igual manera que las ventas tengan un gran aumento el cual se vea reflejado en la calidad de vida de la familia en el hogar.
Doña Ana espera que su negocio  siga creciendo y convirtiéndose en el más conocido de la comunidad para de esta manera poder seguir apoyando a su familia y  que  sus hijos continúe con los estudios y tengan mayores oportunidades en la vida.


Choluteca, Honduras – Febrero del  2014
texts.en:
Ana is very hard-working and responsible. She lives with her children in a town in the south of Honduras and has a business - well-known in the area - selling grains and fish.

Ana needs this loan in order to buy corn and fish. She needs these items to continue with her work and hopes that, with this loan, she can count on having the necessary items to carry on with her work and satisfy customer demand. She hopes that her sales will will increase greatly and that this will be reflected in her family's quality of life.

Ana hopes that her business will continue to grow and become the most well-known business in town. She will then be able to continue supporting her family and her children can continue their education and have better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras – February,2014

loans.use: to buy corn and fish for her business.

loans.name: Vardan

texts.en:
Vardan is 54 years old and he lives in the village of Ddmashen in Gegharkunik region. Vardan used to work as a driver; during 1989-1994 he took part in the conflict between Nagorno Gharabagh and Azerbaijan.  Now he is already retired and he is running a farm. 

On his farm, he has two cows, a heifer, three piglets, fifteen sheep and thirty chickens. Vardan sells all his farm goods and it brings rather good income to his big family. Vardan is married and he has two sons. His elder son is married and lives with his family with Vardan. He works as an auto mechanic. His younger son is on contract military service in peacekeeping troops. Vardan wants to improve his family’s living conditions and he has managed to partly repair his house.

He asks for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to buy living room and kitchen furniture for his house.

loans.use: to buy living room and kitchen furniture for his house.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.es: Abraham vive en la encantadora ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú y se siente contento de vivir en esta ciudad, él es una persona trabajadora y emprendedora que se dedica a la venta de comida y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar, verduras, pollo y carne. Abraham está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: Abraham lives in the enchanting city of Cusco in the south of Peru and is happy to live here. He is hard-working and enterprising and has a business selling meals. On this occasion Abraham needs a loan in order to buy bags of rice and sugar, as well as vegetables, chicken and meat.. Abraham is happy with this loan and promises to make his repayments.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and sugar, as well as vegetables, chicken and meat.

loans.name: Virgen Asunta Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VIRGEN ASUNTA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Anta, perteneciente a la provincia de Anta y departamento de Cusco.

 La socia es la Sra. Cirila ella es casada y tiene 61 años y tiene 5 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de comida, la socia prepara diferentes platos como pollo con papas, sopas y saltados de carnes, la socia trabaja desde las 10:00 p.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 7 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un restaurant. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar productos para cocinar como pollo, carne y verduras.
 

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de leche, negocio de venta de verduras, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de comida.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Virgen Asunta" communal bank, located in the Anta distric of Anta province, in Cusco department, Peru.

One member is Cirila: she is 61 years old, married and has five children. Cirila has a business selling meals. She prepares different dishes such as chicken and potatoes, soups and stir fries. Cirila works from 10am until 5pm and has had the business for seven years. The business is going well but Cirila's dream is to own a restaurant. Cirila is applying for this loan to buy items to cook, such as chicken, meat and vegetables.


The other members of the group have the following businesses: selling milk, selling vegetables, a grocery store and selling meals.

Cirila is grateful to those who are helping her with her dream through this loan. She promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy items to cook, such as chicken, meat and vegetables.

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en:
Rizwana is active borrower of BRAC Pakistan. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is 30 years old and a mother of three children. Her husband has been running a welding shop for five years, and he is the only person responsible for supporting the entire family and managing the household. 

Rizwana's husband wants to buy different types of tools and welding accessories for his business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means he cannot afford to buy these tools. Therefore Rizwana has applied for a Kiva loan from field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan, her husband can purchase the relevant items for his business purposes and earn a profitable income to meet the daily needs of family and business.

Rizwana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of tools and welding accessories for her husband's business

loans.name: Abed Almajeed

texts.en:
Abed Almajeed is 42 years old; he lives with his wife and his three children in Gaza.

He has a shop selling chickens, and he earns a monthly income of US$ 900. He started his business in 2012. He brings the chickens from a poultry farm near his shop, but his business still needs a lot of improvement, so he plans to hire one employee to help him. He needs to make changes in his business before that, so he applied for this loan to buy an incubator for chicks. This will increase the number of his chickens and improve financial conditions and will support the needs of his family and allow him to reinvest in his business.

Abed Almajeed's dream is to educate his children and give them the best in their life. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to buy an incubator for chicks, which will increase the number of his chickens

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen lives in Chuka area of Eastern Kenya and has one child. She is a farmer who sells bananas, yams, milk, and eggs in the local market. Hellen enjoys farming because of the income she generates. Her biggest business challenge is marketing her produce. She chose Juhudi Kilimo for her loan because they offer better services to small-scale farmers.

Hellen is requesting a loan to purchase equipment for her farm. Her loan will help generate more income and will help with her farming activities. Hellen will use this income to help improve her family's living standards.
