loans.use: to purchase farm equipment

loans.name: Lyudmira

texts.en:
Lyudmira is 58 years old and she lives in the village of Geghamavan in the Gegharkunik region. Lyudmira has a daughter and a son; both of them are married. Her daughter lives separately with her family, and her son and his family live with Lyudmira. He helps his mother a lot in farming; they are raising two cows, a heifer, a piglet, a calf, four sheep and twenty chickens in the farm.  On their plot of land they successfully cultivate potatoes and sell their harvest. They also sell their farmed dairy-products and meat  and earn good money from that, too. Lyudmira wants to make her farm richer and sell more meat.

That is why she is asking for a loan of 300,000 Armenian drams in order to buy five sheep and animal fodder for their cattle.

loans.use: to buy five sheep and animal fodder for their cattle

loans.name: Azra

texts.en:
Azra is a 46-year-old woman who is a mother of nine children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a hotel where he also sells different types of food items such as Pakistani dishes, tea and cold drinks. Azra’s husband is responsible for feeding the entire family and managing the household. Azra's husband needs to purchase different types of food products and other items to increase the size of his business, improve his sales and growth, and earn maximum profit. Unfortunately, due to his unfavorable financial position, he is not able to purchase these items.

Azra is requesting a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband buy food and commodities for his hotel business. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy commodities and food items for her husband's hotel business

loans.name: Hatua Group

texts.en:
Flora, who is in her early forties, is not marred and has three children who are in school. For the past four years, she has had a business selling soap and clothes. Flora works daily from eight in the morning through six at night and is able to make a fair monthly profit. She has received four previous loans from Tujijenge Tanzania that she used to buy clothing and soap. Flora successfully repaid her loans and used the profits to cover school fees and household expenses. 

Flora is requesting a loan to buy new products to attract customers. She will share her loan with her loan group “Hatua Group,” which has four members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan. In the coming years, Flora would like to be a known as a businesswoman.

loans.use: to buy new products to attract customers

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 25 years old and lives in Gaza with his family. For the past two years, he has operated a cake shop that is located in a good popular area. Mohammad’s customers like his cakes. He treats them gently and makes cakes for special occasions based on customer requests.

Mohammad is requesting a loan to purchase display shelves and an electronic oven. His loan will allow him to increase his stock. Mohammad is ready to work even harder and make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. Mohammad’s dream is to expand his business. He is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase display shelves and an electronic oven

loans.name: Dorica

texts.en:
Meet Dorica, a farmer living in Kisii. She is married and has 12 children. For the past ten years, Dorica has been a farmer who produces and sells milk, eggs, bananas, maize, and nappier grass. She enjoys planting and selling nappier grass because it is grown in rare areas. Dorica chose Juhudi Kilimo because she wanted a loan for farming. During her training, she learned how to develop a culture of saving.

Dorica is requesting a loan to purchase a dairy cow. Her loan will increase her income as she will have milk from her new cow and her family will also have milk for consumption.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Akhtar

texts.en:
Akhtar is a 59-year-old woman and mother of five children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is a fruit seller by profession.  He sells fruits like apples, bananas, grapes, etc. He is only responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household.

Akhtar's husband needs to purchase different types of fruits for reselling purposes so that he can increase the size of business, improve his sales growth, and earn maximum profit. But due to unfavorable financial position, he is not in a condition to purchase fruits for his business purpose.  Therefore Akhtar has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase the above items for his business purpose. 

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different kinds of fruits for resale

loans.name: Rukhsana

texts.en:
Rukhsana is a 51-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her son and two daughters. Her children are doing their studies. Her husband has been running a barber shop for 10 years; he is solely responsible to feed the entire family and manage the household. He needs to purchase accessories for the barber shop, such as blades, furniture, mirror, combs, etc., but due to insufficient financial means, he is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, Rukhsana is applying for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can assist her husband to purchase these barber-shop accessories in bulk for his business. He can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.

Rukhsana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy barber-shop accessories for her husband's business.

loans.name: Shyamali

texts.en:
Shyamali is a 47-year-old married woman with one child. Her husband is 52 years old. Shyamali is illiterate, only able to sign her name and her husband completed education up to grade 10. 

Her husband has a small business repairing goods but his income is not enough. Providing education to her son and running a household is very difficult for her, so Shyamali decided to purchase a new soldering machine to improve their business skills and earn more money. For this reason she has applied for a loan to BJS (Kiva’s partner). She has already started to take orders for repairing torn, cracked goods. She hopes she will succeed in her life and can be able to purchase more machines to enhance her own business with the outcome profit.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for giving her this great support to enhance her business.

loans.use: To purchase a soldering machine for business purposes.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Santo Tomás una comunidad con paisajes verdes, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de cefeto, maíz, yucas, pituca entre otros ,comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la venta a la agricultura, cultiva cafeto de la variedad catimor, tiene sembrando 2 ha de cafeto de su propiedad, esta actividad la realiza hace más de 20 años en su Caserío, también se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado vacuno, son una familia emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para mantenimiento de dicho cultivo, con ello obtendrá buena producción y mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Jaime is 48 years old.  He lives with his wife and children in Santo Tomás, a community with green landscapes whose people are devoted to agriculture, especially growing coffee, corn, yucca (cassava), pituca and others, as well trade and raising cattle.  It is located in the Cutervo province, which is in the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern sierra.

Jaime works in agriculture.  He grows coffee of the Catimor variety.  He has 2 hectares of coffee bushes on his property.  He has been doing this work for over 20 years in his village.  He also works raising and selling cattle.  They are an entrepreneurial family.

He has requested a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles to maintain his crops, so that he can have a good harvest and increase his earnings to improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase manure to maintain his coffee crops.

loans.name: Sugran

texts.en:
Sugran is 39 years old and a married woman. The man shown in the photo is Sugran’s husband, who is running a business of selling clothes to the people of their locality on his motorcycle. He buys clothes of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of their community. 

For the improvement of her husband’s business, Sugran has applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). It will help him to purchase a variety of clothes of the summer season. Sugran is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothes of the summer season.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
Meet David, a farmer living in the Siongiroi area of South Rift, Kenya. He is married and has five children, all of school-going age. He has been doing farming for eight years. His income source comes from the sale of milk, eggs, vegetable crops and tea; he also has a transport business using a motorbike.

David chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan because they offer low interest rates on their loans,  and they also offer a grace period on loan repayment. During the training, he learned that MFIs (microfinance institutions) assist small farm holders in ways of income generation. Because his highest expense is school fees, the dairy cow will provide more milk for income generation, and hence, cater for the school fees; it will also improve the family's living standards.

loans.use: to construct a dairy cow unit.

loans.name: Namita

texts.en:
Namita is a 40-year-old woman from a rural village in Maynaguri in the district of Jalpaiguri. She and her husband, aged 45 years, are illiterate and can only sign their names. They live in their own kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo) with their two children.

Namita is a hard-working entrepreneur who struggles to give her children everything they need so they lack for nothing.  Namita and her husband both are engaged in a business of making 'bori' (a conical ball made of pulp used in vegetable curry in India).  They sell the products in the local market and to their neighbors, relatives and friends and earn for their family. They are working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Yet their income is too low to give sufficient financial sustenance to their family. 

Namita requested a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase additional ingredients for their product, in order to expand their business. She expects a boost in her business income from it.

Namita dreams of being more profitable in business and hopes to have a comfortable life, and at the same time be able to give good education and a better future to her children and further expand her business.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for expanding their existing business of making 'bori'

loans.name: German

texts.es:
German, vive en casa propia en La Paz, se dedica a la confeccion de deportivos, realizando contratos con diferentes colegios.trabajando por mas de ocho hras diarias.

El credito que solicita es para la compra de tela para poder continuar con su negocio ya que es su unica fuente de ingresos que le permite cubrir todas sus necesidades.
 
El sueño de German es poder tener un taller mas grande ya que actualmente trabaja en su casa.
texts.en: German lives in his own home in La Paz. He earns his living by preparing sportswear with contracts from different high schools. He works for more than eight hours daily. He is requesting this loan to purchase fabric to continue his business because it is his only source of income to cover their household's needs. German's dream is to have a larger workshop. He currently works from home.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to manufacture sportswear.

loans.name: José Neftali

texts.es:
José tiene 54 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta tercer grado ya que en aquellos tiempos era difícil para su familia brindarle la educacón debido a la falta de recursos económicos, a la edad de 18 años conoció a la que ahora es su eposa, tiene 4 hijos, de los cuales 3 se encuentran estudiando educación básica y el otro hijo estudia bachillerato.  

José tiene una experiencia de 41 años trabajando en la agricultura y acuicultura ya que la aprendió de su abuelo con quien se crió y que también se dedicaba a la misma actividad, hoy en día este trabajo es la principal fuente de ingresos de José con la cual mantiene a su familia. A esta actividad se suman sus dos hijos a quienes les está enseñando para que ellos sean los que manejen el negocio de la familia en un futuro, sus hijos le ayudan a trabajar cuando ya han terminado de realizar sus tareas estudiantiles.

El crédito que está solicitando será utilizado para el trabajo agrícola, para comprar semillas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz que mantiene con un sistema de riego, además lo utilizará para mejorar la vivienda, ya que se acerca la época de invierno y el techo de su casa tiene algunas áreas dañadas, y también invertirá para comprar concentrado para peces. 

Los planes que él tiene a futuro, principalmente son apoyar la educación de  sus hijos hasta que se gradúen de la universidad, mejorar y ampliar su cultivo de peces y tener una diversificación de cultivos agrícolas, y todo esto, lo logrará con el uso eficiente de las ganancias y la buena administración de un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
José is 54 years old. He was able to study until the third grade, since in that time, due to lack of economic resources, it was difficult for his family to offer him the education he should have had. At the age of 18 he met the woman who is now his wife. They have four children, of which three are in primary school and the fourth is in secondary school.

José has 41 years of experience working in agriculture and aquaculture. He learned from his grandfather, who raised him and who did this same work. Now this is José's main source of income, with which he supports his family. Two of his children join him in this work; he is teaching them so that they can manage the family business in the future. His children help him when they have finished their homework.

The loan he is requesting now will be used for agricultural work, to buy seeds and fertilizers to grow corn, which he tends using an irrigation system. He will also use the loan to improve his house, as winter is coming and the roof has some damaged areas. And he will also invest the loan in the purchase of concentrated fish feed.

His future plans are mainly to support his children's education until they graduate from university, to improve and grow his fish farming, and to diversify his agricultural crops. He will achieve all this through efficient use of his profits and good administration of a new loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers for growing corn, to improve the roof of his house, and to buy concentrated fish feed

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 38 years old and illiterate but she is a hard-working lady. Her husband is 42 years old and involved in business. They lead a very hard life. Anita works with her own livestock, and has a scanty income. She has one daughter to raise who is in grade 10 now. 

With the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) she wants to purchase a cow to enhance her own business and to give financial support to her husband. She wants to sell the milk at the market to earn money and to give financial assistance to her family. In the future she wants to buy two more cows and extend this business.  

Maybe Anita would have to fight her battle alone if BJS and Kiva did not come to her way and hold her hand tightly. It was a fine morning when Anita met one of the field staff of BJS and came know about BJS activities and decided to take a loan. BJS stands beside her to fight against poverty, so she is very much obliged to BJS and Kiva that they came into her life like a light of success.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to enhance her business of milk supply for extra income.

loans.name: Shyamali

texts.en:
Shyamali is a courageous woman who is 28 years old and comes from Maynaguri, Jalpaiguri District. She has a husband and two children in her family. She has completed her education up to grade 10. Shyamali dreams that her children will get a proper education and become responsible and good citizens. 

Shyamali has been involved in animal husbandry for many years, selling different animals in the market. Her husband works as a daily laborer, with an inconsistent income. She heard about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and took a loan to purchase a cow for her business. She wants to build a large husbandry business with many animals.  In the future she wishes to become a good entrepreneur and wants to prosper in her life.

She is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva because in her bad days they came forward to help her and she has seen the light of prosperity.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for her animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 29-year-old married woman. She has been running a butcher shop with her husband (also shown in the photo) for the past 10 years. They sell the meat of goats and buffaloes to many of their neighbors and other community members. By this time they have become famous for providing good quality meat in their community. Her business is good enough to lead her a decent life. She has four children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life.  

It’s her fifth year with Kashf Foundation; she is happily running her business through the support of it. In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan of 45,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to purchase two more goats, along with some cutters. She expects a boost in their earnings and wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats, along with some cutters.

loans.name: Aemina

texts.en:
Aemina is a 45-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing and education. She has been doing the work of agriculture for many years with her husband. She crops different vegetables and fruits and sells them in the local market. Her son also assists her in growing various crops by watering the soil for good quality production. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds, along with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Aemina applied for a loan of 50,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees). This would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds, along with packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es:
Jorge tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de la Rinconada una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás una comunidad que tienen gran cantidad de arena que la población utiliza para construcción, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de cafeto de la variedad catimor, cultivando 5 has de su propiedad, también se dedica a la cria y venta de ganado vacuno, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para el pago de mano de obra por el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y compra de abono y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Jorge is 47 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of Rinconada in the rural district of Santo Tomas. The community has a large quantity of sand that the population uses for construction. The population is engaged in agriculture, trade, and raising livestock. It is located in the Province of Cutervo which is in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

Jorge earns his living as a farmer, especially in the cultivation of coffee of the Catimor variety. He has 5 hectares of property. He also breeds and sells cattle. His wife assists him with this work. He has requested a loan of 4,000 Peruvian soles for paying laborers to help maintain their coffee crop and to purchase fertilizer that will allow a timely production of coffee to offer his customers.

loans.use: to pay laborers to maintain his coffee plants and to fertilize his crop.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Lucio tiene 56 años de edad, él carece de preparación académica debido a que en aquel tiempo se le dificultó a su familia enviarlo a la escuela por sus escasos recursos económicos, está casado y su esposa se dedica  a los oficios domésticos, tiene 2 hijos los cuales están estudiando.

Lucio es un hombre dedicado a su trabajo, tiene 10 años de trabajar en la albañilería y ya cuenta con mucha experiencia, este trabajo lo aprendió en un curso de formación que fue impartido por programas solidarios del gobierno, además cuando no tiene mucho trabajo de albañil, Lucio se dedica a la agricultura actividad que aprendió de su padres y su abuelo; fue de esta manera como él decidió dedicarse a ambos rubros, pues se sintió motivado por los buenos resultados económicos que se tienen, además porque se le facilita la compra de materiales de todo tipo porque cerca de su casa hay una agro-ferretería, su hijo mayor se involucra ayudándole en el trabajo.


El crédito que está solicitando, lo necesita para pagar deudas que tiene pendientes con una ferretería, ya que fue allí que se adquirieron las principales herramientas de trabajo y otra parte del crédito será destinada en compra de medicamentos y pago de consultas médicas para su esposa ya que ultimadamente presenta problemas de salud. 

Sus sueños son, que su esposa goce de buena salud, ya que es parte fundamental de su familia, terminar de pagar el crédito y adquirir uno nuevo para la compra de más herramientas para construcción, apoyar la educación de sus hijos hasta que sean unos profesionales de éxito, con las ganancias y el buen manejo del crédito sueña con tener su propio vehículo el cual le sirva para trasportar los materiales y equipos de construcción y salir y disfrutar de momentos agradables con su familia.
texts.en:
Lucio, 56, didn't get an education because his family didn't have the financial resources at the time.  He's married and his wife is a homemaker.  They have two children, both of them in school.

Lucio's very devoted to his job.  He has worked in construction for 10 years and has a lot of experience.  He learned this work in a course offered through government solidarity programs.  When he doesn't have a lot of construction jobs he also works in agriculture, which he learned from his parents and his grandfather.  He decided to work in both fields because he was motivated by the good economic results and because it's easy to buy all types of materials at the nearby agricultural hardware supplier.  Lucio's oldest son helps him in his work.

Lucio needs this loan to pay a debt to the hardware store where he bought his main work tools.  He'll use another part of the loan to buy medicine and to pay for medical consultations for his wife, who has health problems at the moment.

His dreams are for his wife to enjoy good health because she's essential to his family, to finish paying back the loan and get another one to buy more construction tools, and to support his children's education until they become successful professionals.

Lucio hopes that, with his profits and by managing his loan well, he can get his own vehicle to transport his construction supplies and equipment as well as to enjoy good times with his family.

loans.use: to pay a debt and to pay for medical treatment for his wife

loans.name: Apolinario

texts.es:
Apolinario tiene 64 año de edad, es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, solamente estudió hasta noveno grado pues no pudo continuar bachillerato debido a que el instituto le quedaba a 40 km de su casa y en aquella época no había transporte, ahora él está casado y su esposa se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos, tiene 3 hijos, pero con él solo viven su esposa, 2 nietos y una hija. 


Apolinario se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde muy pequeño, él siembra maíz, frijoles y maicillo, esta actividad la aprendió de su padre y abuelo quienes le inculcaron buenos principios y valores y es lo que lo ha llevado a ser una persona muy conocida y respetada en la comunidad, tiene 49 años de experiencia en la agricultura lo que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, ya que vende casi el 50% de sus cosechas y lo demás lo utiliza para el consumo familiar, el lugar de trabajo le queda a 5 km de su casa, y se involucra en el trabajo uno de sus hijos en un horario de 7:00 AM a 1:00 PM.

El préstamo que está solicitando, lo necesita muchísimo para preparar el proceso de riega de sus cosechas, en la cual tendrá que pagar trasporte para trasladar la cosecha del campo a su casa, pagar el alquiler de una máquina que le destusará y desgranará el maíz, de esta forma se le facilitará el proceso de preparación y almacenamiento de los granos básicos ya que si no fuera por la ayuda de la maquinaria agrícola, el proceso tardaría aproximadamente un mes.

Apolinario tiene muchos propósitos a futuro, desea ampliar y diversificar sus cultivos, apoyar a sus hijos y nietos en todo lo que sea necesario para su preparación y formación académica ya que manifiesta que uno de sus nietos quiere estudiar para veterinario, todo espera lograrlo con la buena inversión de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Apolinario is 64 years old, and is a hardworking and responsible man.  He only attended school until the ninth grade.  He was not able to continue high school because the school was 40km from his house and in those days, he did not have transportation.  He is now married, and his wife is a homemaker.  They have three children, but only one of their daughters and two grandchildren live with them.  

Apolinario has devoted himself to agriculture from a young age.  He plants corn, beans and sorghum.  He learned this activity from his father and grandfather, who taught him good principles and values that have made him into a well-known and respected person in the community.  He has 49 years of experience in agriculture, which has now become his main source of income.  He sells about 50% of his harvest, and the rest he uses for his family.  His workplace is about 5km from his house.  One of his sons helps him with the work, and they work from 7am to 1pm.  

He really needs the loan that he is seeking to prepare the irrigation system for his crops, pay to transport his harvest from the field to his house, and pay for the rental of a machine to shuck the corn.  Through this, he will facilitate the preparation and storage of the basic grains, because if it were not for the help of these agricultural machines, the process would take about a month.

Apolinario has many aims for the future.  He wishes to expand and diversify his crops, support his children and grandchildren in everything that they need to prepare and develop academically, as one of his grandchildren wants to become a veterinarian.  He hopes to achieve all of this by investing his earnings well.

loans.use: prepare the irrigation system for his crops, pay to transport his harvest from the field to his house, and to pay for the rental of a machine to shuck the corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 33-year-old married woman. She has been in the business of a beauty parlor for the last six years. She offers many facilities to her customers such as makeup, hair styling and facials. Over time she has attained a regular list of customers and makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

She needs to deal with more customers time after time. For this she requires hair-care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening in large quantities, so she applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) through Kashf Foundation. She is in her third loan cycle with a good repayment history. She is very experienced in her business and confident that her business will move toward a positive direction as a result of the loan investment.

loans.use: to buy hair-care products, skin products and creams of bleaching and whitening

loans.name: Nurfa

texts.en:
Nurfa lives in Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri. She is only 25 years old and is a housewife.  She lives with her husband Jobaidul and their only son in their own kachha house (made of straw, mud and bamboo).  Their son is below school-going age. They both attended school up to grade 7.

Nurfa’s husband has been managing a poultry farm for the last nine years.  He makes his family's living by managing a business of eggs. He raises poultry in his own house. Nurfa also helps her husband in his work. He faces a major challenge of disease outbreaks in their poultry.  He is unable to cover all the expenses of the family with his little income.  Now he wants to expand his business. 

Thus Nurfa has decided to take a loan from BJS to help her husband in expanding his business. She would like to raise more chickens and sell both chickens and eggs in the market. The loan will help him to purchase more chicks.

Nurfa is now excited and optimistic about their venture.  She is hard-working and enjoys the poultry work. She thinks that she will be successful in her business and get a good profit from it so as to give a decent lifestyle to her family.  In the future, she would like to increase their poultry and continue to grow their business.

She is really grateful for the help of the lenders (BJS and Kiva) for making her dream come true.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks and medicines to expand their existing poultry farm business.

loans.name: Bushra

texts.en:
Bushra is a 41-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store with her husband at the corner of her house. Her husband also assists her by purchasing stock of goods from the market, as he has maintained many contacts over the years. 

She is a mother of four children and is motivated to provide her family with good quality food, clothing and health. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of 60,000 PKR (Pakistani rupees) to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages to meet with the increasing demand at her store. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salts, biscuits and beverages.

loans.name: Ruth Maribel

texts.es:
Ruth tiene 22 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado de educación básica, está acompañada desde hace tres años, su compañero de vida se dedica a la pesca artesanal todos los días, solo tienen un hijo de 2 años de edad y nadie más vive con ellos.


Ruth tiene un negocio de una pequeña tienda desde hace 6 meses, decidió iniciar vendiendo productos de la canasta básica ya que los vecinos tenían que viajar un km para ir a comprar azúcar, café, y otros productos básicos, ella inicio el negocio con un capital de cien dólares y poco a poco va creciendo comprando más productos. 

El préstamo que Ruth está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo necesita para comprar frijol, azúcar, arroz y también garrafas de aceite, sin duda el comprar al por mayor le conviene porque le dan un mejor precio, podrá cubrir lo que demandan los clientes de su comunidad, y además mejorará los ingresos para su familia.

El sueño principal de Ruth es tener en su tienda lo más necesario para los clientes y luego ir pensando en la construcción de su casa porque donde vive no es propio, considera que la única manera de llegar a cumplir sus sueños es con la ayuda de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Ruth is 22 years old. She studied through the sixth grade of elementary school. She has been married for three years. Her partner earns his living as a traditional fisherman. They only have one 2 year old son and no one else lives with them.

Ruth has had her business, a small shop, for 6 months. She decided to start selling products to her neighbors because they previously had to travel a kilometer to go buy sugar, coffee, and other commodities. She started this business with $100 in capital. She's been growing slowly and buying more products. The loan Ruth is requesting from CrediCampo will be used to buy beans, sugar, rice, and bottles of oil in bulk. Buying in bulk will suit her because she will get a better price. She can meet her customers' demands in their community and improve the income of her family.

Ruth's main dream is to have a stocked store for her customers and then to start thinking about building her own house because they do not live in a home that they own. She believes the only way to fulfill her dreams is with the help of loans.

loans.use: to stock her store with beans, sugar, rice, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Aliaxsar Hermogenes

texts.es:
Aliaxsar Hermogenes tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserio Mosquerral, una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de cafeto, dedicándose a este rubro desde hace 6 años, también se dedica a l cultivo de maíz y frejol su esposa le apoya en esta labor ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos y pago a jornaleros por el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Aliaxsar Hermogenes is 30 years old.  He lives with his wife and their children in the village of Mosquerral, a rural zone in Pomahuaca.  Its population is devoted to agriculture, trade and raising cattle.  It is located in the province of Jaén, which is in the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern sierra.  

He works in agriculture, specifically growing coffee, a trade that he has worked in for six years.  He also grows corn and beans.  His wife helps him with his work.

He has requested a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to purchase manure and pay for labor to care for his coffee crops.  This way, he will have a good harvest to offer is customers, improving his earnings for his family.

loans.use: purchase manure and pay for labor to care for his coffee crops.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Haleema is a 44-year-old, married woman. She has been doing business, selling milk, for the past 15 years. 

She has two calves and one buffalo in milk. She sells milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter that she makes from the milk. Her business is good enough to help her lead her decent life. 

Haleema has four children. She is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life, with good education, food, and clothing.  She has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

It’s Haleema's third year with Kashf Foundation. She is happily running her business through support of it. Now she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000 to purchase one cow. She hopes to have an increase in the production capacity of milk which, ultimately, helps in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one cow.

loans.name: Elva Ivett

texts.es:
Elva es una joven de 24 años de edad, solo tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta sexto grado de educación básica, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la  agricultura, tiene 2 hijos que todavía no asisten a la escuela pues están muy pequeños, Elva vive en casa de su suegra ya que no tiene casa propia. 

Elva se dedica a los oficios domésticos, ella lava ropa y cocina, ya que su esposo es agricultor y es quien lleva el dinero para la comida de la casa, ella más que todo se dedica a cuidar a sus hijos pues están pequeños y requieren de un mucho cuidado, su esposo le ayuda al llegar de su trabajo.

Ella solicita este crédito para comprar 800 adobes, dos fletes de madera y mil tejas, pues necesita construir su casa ya que donde vive no es propio, de esta manera ella podrá tener privacidad y podrá satisfacer esta necesidad con la ayuda del crédito. 

El sueño de Elva es tener una casa propia,  para que así su familia tenga más espacio para desplazarse, ella espera trabajar muy duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos y poder darles una mejor calidad de vida, una mejor educación, y poder atender a su familia en todo lo que necesiten.
texts.en:
Elva is a 24 year old that only had the opportunity to study though the sixth grade of elementary school. She is married and her husband works in agriculture. She has 2 children who still attend school because they are very young. Elva lives with her mother since she does not have her own home.

Elva dedicates herself to domestic chores. She washes clothing and works in the kitchen as her husband is a farmer and the one that provides the money to purchase food for the household. She is mostly dedicated to the care of her children because they are small and require a lot of care. 

She is requesting this loan to buy 800 adobe bricks, 2 loads of wood, and a thousand tiles to construct her home because they do not have their own and they need privacy. They could not be able to meet this need without the help of credit.

Elva dreams of owning a home so that her family has more space to move. She hopes to work very hard to raise her children and give them a better life, better education, and to help her family in whatever they need.

loans.use: to purchase adobe bricks, wood, and tiles to build a house.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 32-year-old, married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. 

She has been knitting hand-made embroidery over a wooden frame at her home for six years. She has proven herself to be a responsible and brave mother. During in these years she has attained a regular list of customers and she makes enough money to contribute to the family income.

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, to purchase stocks of thread, fancy cloth, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

She does not want to lose her heart and she wants to afford all household expenses with courage. She hopes that this loan will prove beneficial for her and for her family. She is very thankful to Kiva and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw material for embroidery.

loans.name: Mané

texts.fr:
Madame Mané est une femme très active qui évolue dans le secteur du petit commerce depuis plus de cinq ans. Elle est mariée et mère de famille et habite dans un village situé dans la zone de la petite côte. Mané vend du poisson séchée et fumés. Elle commence sa journée à 5h du matin pour la finir à 14heures.Elle sollicite un crédit pour aller chercher de la marchandise dans un autre village environnant. Dès son retour, elle place la marchandise chez des commerçantes qui détaillent  et revient récupérer son argent dans les 3 jours suivants.
Mané appuie son époux dans la dépense quotidienne de la famille et l’entretien des enfants.
Le travail étant pénible pour quelqu’un qui prend de l’âge, Mané désire changer d’activité un jour et ouvrir un magasin de vente de tissus.
texts.en:
Ms. Mané has been a very active woman in the sector of small-scale commerce for over five years. She is a married mother with a family and lives in a village located in the Petite Côte area. Mané sells dried and smoked fish. Her day starts at 5 AM and ends at 2 PM. She is requesting a loan to pick up merchandise in a nearby village. As soon as she is back, she delivers the merchandise to retail merchants and recuperates her money within three days. 

Mané supports her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses and the children's care.

Since the work is hard for someone older, Mané would one day like to switch to other work and open a store selling fabrics.

loans.use: to purchase smoked and dried fish to resell

loans.name: Flavio

texts.es:
Flavio tiene 63 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Querocotillo una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de maíz, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo de 4 000 nuevos soles para la compra de semillas y abonos orgánicos y de esta manera tener una mayor producción para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Flavio is 63 years old, and lives with his wife and children in Querocotillo, a community that is dedicated to agriculture, business and cattle.  It is located in the province of Cutervo, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in Peru's northern sierra.  Flavio works in agriculture, specifically growing corn.  His wife supports him with his work.

He has requested a loan of 4,000 nuevos soles to purchase seeds and organic compost to have a better harvest to offer his customers, generating greater earnings for his family.

loans.use: purchase seeds and compost to grow corn.

loans.name: Carlos Antonio

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 52 años de edad, estudió hasta tercer grado en la escuela, está acompañado y su pareja tiene una pequeña tienda y se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales solo dos estudian, solo sus hijos y su pareja dependen de él.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 10 años, su padre no quiso que siguiera yendo a la escuela y lo ponía a trabajar, con esfuerzos ha podido comprar un molino de nixtamal y es otra fuente de ingresos para él además de la pequeña tienda que administra su pareja, la mercadería para la tienda la compran en otra ciudad cada ocho días, por lo que tienen que viajar 15 kilómetros con bastantes problemas para transitar. 

El préstamo que Carlos ha solicitado a CrediCampo, lo invertirá para comprar un terreno, con lo que tendrá una opción más para cultivar. 

Sus objetivos son seguir trabajando para tener recursos y seguir enviando a sus hijos a la escuela, pues él desea que sus hijos sean profesionales y que sus negocios progresen.
texts.en:
Carlos, age 52, went to school through the third grade.  He is in a relationship, and his life partner has a small store.  She also devotes herself to the household chores.  He has three children, and two of them go to school.  Only his children and his life partner are dependent upon him.

Carlos has been farming since he was ten years old.  His father did not want him to continue going to school, and he put him to work.  With effort, he has been able to buy a corn grinder.  This is another source of income in addition to the small store that his life partner runs.  They buy the merchandise for the store in another city every eight days.  In order to do so they have to travel 15 kilometers with plenty of transportation problems getting there and back.

Carlos will use the loan he has requested from CrediCampo to buy a piece of land.  By doing so, he will have one more opportunity to cultivate.

His objectives are to continue working in order to have resources and to continue sending his children to school.  He hopes that his children become professionals and that their businesses progress.

loans.use: to buy a piece of land to cultivate.

loans.name: Mery Raquel

texts.es:
Mery tiene 43 años de edad, no pudo completar sus estudios de educación básica debido a que era la mayor de los hermanos y tuvo que ayudar a su familia con el trabajo y los quehaceres del hogar, actualmente está casada y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y excavación de pozos, tiene 3 hijos de los cuales dos de ellos se encuentran estudiando y el tercero aun no cumple con la edad adecuada para asistir a la escuela.

Mery es una mujer dedicada a los oficios domésticos, con una experiencia de 31 años, actividad que aprendió de sus padres, además los fines de semana se dedica a la venta de pan y tamales y los demás días hace venta de tortillas, ella continuará realizando estas actividades ya que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos, pues le proporciona ganancias para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de sus hijos, su hija  mayor es quien le ayuda por las tardes en el trabajo ya que por las mañanas va a estudiar.


Este crédito que ella está solicitando, lo necesita para terminar de cancelar una estufa que adquirió en una comercial, también para pagar algunos insumos agrícolas tales como, fertilizantes, herbicidas, y plaguicidas que fueron adquiridos a principio de la época de siembra. 

Los sueños y metas de Mery son, terminar de pagar el crédito, desea montar una venta de comida que funcione de lunes a viernes, en cuanto a sus hijos, apoyarlos hasta que finalicen sus estudios universitarios ya que manifiesta que dos de ellos sueñan con ser agrónomos, todo esto lo va lograr con ayuda del préstamo y la inversión de sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Mery is 43 years old.  She was not able to complete her education because she was the eldest of her siblings and had to help the family with work and household chores.  She is now married, and her husband works in agriculture and digging wells.  They have three children, of whom two are in school and the third is still too young to attend school.  

Mery is a homemaker, a trade that she learned form her parents.  Also, on weekends, she sells bread and tamales, and during the rest of the week, she sells tortillas.  She will continue to partake in these activities as they have become her main source of income.  She generates enough to meet the basic needs of her children.  Her eldest daughter helps her with her work in the afternoons, since she attends school in the morning.  

The loan that she is requesting is needed to finish paying for a stove that she bought from a store, as well as to pay for agricultural supplies such as: fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides that she acquired at the beginning of the growing season.  

Mery's goals and dreams are to finish paying off this loan, to start up a restaurant that is open from Monday to Friday, and to support her children in finishing their college educations, as two of them want to be agricultural engineers.  She will accomplish all of this through the help of this loan and investing her earnings.

loans.use: finish paying for a stove that she bought from a store, and to pay for agricultural supplies such as: fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides.

loans.name: Hajran

texts.en:
Hajran is a 41-year-old, married woman and she has been running a small general store in her community for many years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and she has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough money to provide for her family. 

To fully stock her store, Hajran requested a loan for PKR 40,000, which she will use to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she would be able to consistently meet the increasing demand. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.

loans.use: to buy stocks of rice, sugar, and flour.

loans.name: Monavan

texts.en:
Monavan is 44 years old and lives together with her husband and three children (two sons and one daughter).  She is illiterate and can only sign her name.  Her husband Echhahak, aged 53 years, is a mason.  He studied up to grade 6.  They live in the small village of East Altagram in Dhupguri in the district Jalpaiguri.  Due to poverty their children could not continue their studies. They help their father in his work to generate income for their family.

Though Monavan is a housewife, she also helps her husband in his work, after finishing her household jobs.  The family is very friendly and supports each other with everything.  Yet, they are unable to earn enough money to meet the family expenses smoothly, as the prices of everything are increasing by leaps and bounds.  Now, they have decided to start a new business of selling milk and milk products to earn more profit to maintain the five-member family.

In order to execute their plan, Monavan has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS, who give loans to rural women for starting up a new business. She has decided to purchase a dairy cow with the loan.  She will sell the milk and milk products (cheese, butter, milk, and curd), which have a great demand in their locality, from door to door. She hopes it will help her to earn additional income to overcome the financial hurdles  they are presently facing.

This profit from the business will lead to an increased income, which will translate into having more money to build a concrete house for them to live in.

Monavan and her family are very grateful to the lenders and her full thanks go to them. (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow to start a milk supply and dairy product business.

loans.name: Sadith Emilce

texts.es: Sadith Emilse es de Bogotá, madre de un niño de 3 años, en estos momentos se encuentra sin trabajo, ella está estudiando para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de la familia, por este motivo acude a kiva para que la ayude, ya que no cuenta con los recursos necesarios para poder seguir estudiando, ella quiere seguir estudiando  porque   le gusta mucho la carrera que está haciendo que es Administración en Salud.  CAMPO ALTO es una institución que cuenta con muy buenos beneficios para el estudiante y la educación es muy completa, cuenta con un grupo de docentes capacitados para compartir los conocimientos con todos los estudiantes. Además CAMPO ALTO ayuda a los estudiantes  a vincularse laboral mente demostrando las capacidades y los conocimientos en cada una de las clínicas u hospitales con los cuales tiene convenio.
texts.en:
Sadith Emilce is from Bogotá, and she has a three year old child.  At this time she is without work.  She is studying in order to be able to improve her family’s quality of life.

It is for this reason that she comes to Kiva for help.  She does not have the resources needed to be able to continue studying.  She wants to continue going to school because she really likes the career of Health Administration that she is studying.

CampoAlto is an institution that has very good benefits for students, and the education is very complete.  They have a group of teachers that are trained to share their knowledge with all of the students.  Also, CampoAlto helps students with links to work.  They demonstrate their training and their knowledge in each of the clinics or hospitals in which they have an arrangement.

loans.use: to pay tuition for a semester.

loans.name: Malati

texts.en:
Malati is a 25-year-old woman.  She lives in the small village of Barmanpara in Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri with her husband and their only daughter.  Though Malati and her husband both are illiterate, they are providing education to their daughter, who is in kindergarten now. They live in their own small house.

Malati's husband is engaged in a business. He is the only breadwinner for the family.  Malati is a housewife. Due to lack of capital, her husband cannot invest much money into his business and as a result, the income is too low to meet all the household expenses for the family. In order to generate more income, they have decided to start a milk supply business.

Malati heard about Kiva’s partner, BJS, and learned that they give loans to rural women for starting up a business, and she has taken a loan from them.  She plans to utilize the loan to purchase a dairy cow. It will provide milk for her family and also for sale which will bring more income for growth to her business.  She plans to sell the milk to her neighbors, relatives and friends.  Milk is always in great demand, so they hope to earn a profit from their new business. They are also hopeful to lead a comfortable life with the additional profit they will earn and fulfill their dream to purchase a tractor to rent out  to the farmers of their locality in the near future.

Malati is thankful to the lenders (Kiva and BJS) for funding the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cow to start milk supply business.

loans.name: José Arturo

texts.es:
José tiene 49 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta tercer grado en la escuela, actualmente está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene 6 hijos, ninguno de ellos se encuentra estudiando y todos dependen de él.

La construcción de casa es el trabajo al cual se dedica José, él construye casas de adobe, ya tiene muchos años de dedicarse a este trabajo, y también realiza actividades agrícolas, ya que la construcción de casas la realiza durante el verano, sus hijas se involucran de vez en cuando en el trabajo.

El préstamo que él está solicitando a CrediCampo, lo necesita para comprar lámina para un techo de una casa que están utilizando como casa de oración en la comunidad, es así que se sentirán satisfechos porque tendrán la casa como la han soñado por que la misión es integrar más personas al camino de Dios  

José sueña con que en un futuro la comunidad se integre a un proceso de buenos ciudadanos y en cuanto a su familia él espera que tengan lo necesario para poder vivir y se propone que por lo menos tres de sus hijas puedan ir a la escuela.
texts.en:
José is 49 years old and he managed to study up to Grade 3. He is married and his wife is a housewife. He has 6 children, none of them study and all of them are dependent on him. José works building houses. He builds adobe houses. He has been doing this for many years. He is also a farmer as house building takes place in the summer. His children help him with his work occasionally. 

The loan José is requesting from CrediCampo is needed to buy metal sheeting for the roof of a house that will be used as a prayer house for the community They will be happy as they will have the house they have dreamed of, to be used to integrate more people into God's ways.  José dreams of a future for the community which includes a process of creating good citizens. As for his family he hopes that they have enough to live on and hopes that at least 3 of his children can go to school.

loans.use: to buy sheeting for the roof of a prayer house.

loans.name: Jayanti

texts.en:
Jayanti is married and has three children (two sons and one daughter). She is 45 years old and is a housewife.  She studied up to grade 6.  Her husband Shibendra, aged 58 years, is associated with a small business. All of the three children are students, go to school.  One is in college and the other two are in grades 10 and 9. They live in Magurmari in the district of Jalpaiguri. They have their own house.

Jayanti's husband is engaged the business of selling wood. He has been engaged in this business for the last five years.  His potential customers are his neighbors. He purchases wood from his village and his neighboring villages and resells it to carpenters and to his neighbors.  There is a great demand for his wood in his locality. But due to lack of capital he can not expand his business.

Jayanti decided to help her husband to grow his business.  She asked for a loan from Kiva’s partner, BJS to purchase more stock of wood to expand her husband's business so that they will be able to earn a greater profit.

Jayanti hopes the business will enable her to give financial sustenance to her family and to give better education to her children.

She gives her thanks to her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase more wood to expand her husband's business.

loans.name: Agape Group

texts.en:
Edina, who is in her mid thirties, is married and has three children who are in school. For one year six months, Edina has been managing a business selling lake water fish. She works at her business from 06am to 06pm per working day and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

This is Edina's first loan request from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. Edina will use this loan to buy fish to sell so as meet her customers' demands. In the coming days, Edina would like to open a general store. She will share this loan with her loan group, "AGAPE GROUP", which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell so as to meet her customers' demands.

loans.name: Safia

texts.en:
Safia is a 49-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She has been running a business of selling clothes for many years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community. 

She requested a loan of PKR 40,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season, by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she would be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different clothes for the summer season.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is a 30-year-old female and married with one child, aged 3 1/2 years old, whom she supports. This is her first loan of Ksh.20,000. She was introduced to Visionfund Kenya by the Visionfund officer. She has a cafe business that is located at Majengo mapya. She has been in this business for four years and she earns a monthly income of about Ksh.15,000. She’s planning to use the loan to purchase potatoes, cooking oil and flour in bulk to make food to sell to her customers. She will use the profit to expand her cafe. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to open a hotel and educate her child.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, cooking oil and flour in bulk to make food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La  señora Teresa es  una persona emprendedora,  honesta  y seria, vive con su esposo y sus 4 hijos  en el  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la  compra  de  tamales  y granos.
Doña Teresa el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  maíz, leña, condimentos, carne etc. para la elaboración de nacatamales  y así tener el producto suficiente para satisfacer a sus clientes y lograr así con que las ventas en su negocio aumenten.
Doña Teresa espera que esta inversión le ayude a mejorar un poco su  situación  económica y la de su  familia.  Desea que  en unos 3 años  su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta en la más grande y  reconocido de la zona y seguir  apoyando a su familia.


Choluteca, Honduras –  Febrero   del   2014
texts.en:
Señora Teresa is an enterprising, honest, and serious person. She lives with her husband and their four children in southern Honduras. Her business is the sale of tamales and grains.

Teresa needs the loan to purchase corn, firewood, seasonings, meat, etc., to make "nacatamales" [filled tamales wrapped in plantain leaves] in order to have enough product to meet customer demand; in that way she will manage to increase her sales.

Teresa hopes that this investment will help her to improve her family's economic situation. In the next three years, she would like for her business to continue growing and becoming established until it is the largest and best-known business in the area. She also would like to continue to support her family.

Choluteca, Honduras –  February, 2014

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, seasonings, meat, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Zareena is a 45-year-old married woman and the mother of 5 children. The man shown in the photo is Zareena’s husband, who is a salesman and supplies candies, biscuits and other sweet items to different retail shops. He makes a good amount of income to contribute to the family income. 

For the improvement of her husband’s business, Zareena applied for a loan of 45,000 PKR. He wants to purchase more packs of biscuits, chocolates and candies to meet market demand consistently. She expects a boost in her husband’s income and wishes to improve their standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of biscuits, chocolates and candies.

loans.name: Nurbanu

texts.en:
Nurbanu is a 40-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and her only child in a small town of Maynaguri.  Both Nurbanu and her husband are illiterate and just know how to sign their names. Due to poverty, they were not able to receive an education.

Nurbanu is a housewife and her husband is a cycle van puller, using a rented cycle van. Thus their income is very scanty. From the beginning they have faced many problems to run the family. Then Nurbanu came to know about BJS (Kiva’s partner) and has taken a loan to purchase a cycle van. Now her husband pulls his own cycle van and now his income has also increased. Like a rickshaw and an auto, a cycle van is also one kind of transport which carries people from one place to another, especially in remote areas. Now their family is earning money. Hopefully their condition will improve from the earlier situation.

 Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for giving the loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van so as to earn more money.

loans.name: Sima

texts.en:
Sima is a 25-year-old, married woman. She and her husband both have completed grade 10. Now Sima is a mother of one child who goes to school. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for purchasing a cow so that she can sell milk and milk products in the market. Her husband is running a small business. 

Both Sima and her husband work together and divide their work. They work long hours so that they can give a bright future to their child, and so their future is not affected by poverty and ignorance. This loan will give them an opportunity to make their dream come true. 

Now, Sima lives in a kaccha house (made of straw and mud), but with this loan she will try to build a pakka house (made of bricks and cement). Sima and her husband are successfully running their business and have taken hold in the market for selling milk products and also vegetables.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a 27-year-old female, married with three children, ages 8, 4 and 2 years old, who she supports. 

This is Bahati's first loan of 30,000 KES. She was introduced to Visionfund Kenya by the Visionfund officer. Bahati has a grocery business located in Ganda. She has been in this business for three years and she earns a monthly income of 10,000 KES. Bahati is planning to use the loan to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers. She will use the profit to expand the business. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell to her customers

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: A portion of Mustafa's Group $3,000 loan is to buy a feather-removal machine.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 41-year-old married woman. For the past 12 years, she has been successfully running a business of selling milk to the people of her community. Over time, Naseem has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She has a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income.  

Currently, Naseem has requested a 50,000 PKR loan through Kashf Foundation to purchase a cow.  It will allow her to cater to more customers. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business. She is in her 5th loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Kaneezan

texts.en:
Kaneezan is a 36-year-old married woman and the mother of six children. She has run a business of selling milk with her husband for the past many years. She has buffalo, which she uses for selling milk to the people of her locality. She also sells butter and cheese to generate an extra amount of profit. She has become famous for providing good quality milk and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. 

She has gradually improved her business with the support of the Kashf Foundation. Currently she is in her 7th loan cycle and has applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase one more buffalo. Kaneezan is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her and will bring positive changes to her business.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma is 38-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of selling vegetables for many years. She is very passionate in her business of selling vegetables and manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a loving mother of six children. She is responsible for their food, health and education, and is trying hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. 

For the improvement of her business she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 50,000 to purchase sacks of onions, potatoes and ginger. This will help her to meet market demands consistently. It’s her 6th loan cycle and she is very thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of onions, potatoes and ginger.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is 29 years old; he lives in Gaza with his family. He sells various kinds of foodstuffs in his grocery store, such as cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, and many other items. He opened it one year ago.

Mohammad is requesting this youth loan to purchase an electricity generator, a glass door, and shelves. This will enable him to increase his stock. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while, to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. His dream is to expand his business. Mohammad is very grateful to everyone who helps him to achieve success in his business, with this loan.

loans.use: to purchase an electricity generator, a glass door, and shelves, so that he can increase his stock

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit is 46 years old and she lives in Vanadzor city in the Lori region. Lilit has two higher education degrees and also the title of associate professor. She  graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute in the department of Armenian Language and Literature. Then she graduated from the National Academy of Sciences in the department of Armenian Classical Literature. 

Lilit now lives with her brother’s family. Her husband died several years ago. She has a daughter who now lives and studies in Yerevan. For ten years Lilit worked at the school as a teacher in Yerevan. Since 1999 till now she works at the Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute as a lecturer, and she is also an Associate Professor in the Literature department. 

As her students say, she is a very clever and wise person. She manages to organize her lectures in a way that students take part in every lesson with great interest and desire to learn more and more about the masterpieces of Armenian Literature. She also gives private courses for the children who are going to take entrance examinations. 

Lilit is asking for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams because she wants to buy some professional literature and a computer, which will help her to get informed about the works of our contemporary writers.

loans.use: to buy some professional literature and a computer which will help her to get informed about the works of contemporary writers.

loans.name: Nazgul

texts.ru: Назгуль 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 5 детей. Трое детей - студенты, двое - школьники. У Назгуль - среднее образование, по характеру - трудолюбивая, целеустремленная, предприимчивая и перспективная. Главной ценностью своей жизни считает своих детей. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Назгуль занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 5 лет назад, с покупки скота на 2,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Назгуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 2 дойные коровы, 3 лошади, а также имеет земельный надел размером 7,77 ГА, на котором выращивает картофель и сеет пшеницу. Урожай всегда выдается богатый. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Назгуль обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку бычков для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Назгуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать денежные средства на покупку участка для строительства дома для старшего сына.
texts.en: Nazgul is 39, married, and has five children. Three of the children are in college and two are in secondary school. Nazgul has a high school education and is hardworking, driven, enterprising, and forward-looking by nature. Her main care in life is for her children. She earns her family's main income through animal husbandry, which she first got involved in five years ago when she purchased  cattle for 2,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, she now has two dairy cows, three horses, and a 7.77 hectare plot of land where she plants potatoes and wheat. Her harvests are always rich and she earns 10,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue developing her farm, Nazgul asked the bank Bai-Tushum for a loan to purchase steers for fattening and resale. She plans to use the profits to invest in additional livestock and to save money for land in order to build a house for her eldest son.

loans.use: to buy steers for fattening and resale

loans.name: Bishakha

texts.en:
Bishakha is 49 years old and a married woman and her husband is 59 years old. Both Bishakha and her husband are illiterate; they just know how to sign their names. Bishakha is a housewife and her husband is running his own small sweet shop.  Bishakha has two daughters and they both are working in their father’s shop. They are deprived of receiving nominal education due to their poverty. 

Bishakha lives in a small town of Maynaguri. She has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) of INR 12,000 so that she can purchase paddy seeds and fertilizers to grow more paddy rice in her own field. For better quality rice, better fertilizer, pesticide, etc. are required. So with this money they will grow better quality paddy and will sell it in the market to earn more. Bishakha hopes that she will run her family smoothly with the profit from her business. She dreams that she will be a good entrepreneur in future by cultivating rice in her own field.

Bishakha is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Jyotsna

texts.en:
Jyotsna is 48 years old and her husband is 52 years old. Jyotsna is the mother of two children. Jyotsna makes incense and sells it in the market while her husband is a van puller and rents the cycle van from a local owner. Jyotsna has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) so that she can enhance her business of incense-making and can earn more from the business. This business is a profitable one and it also does not involve much labour cost. 

Jyotsna has applied for a loan in the amount of INR 15,000 so that she can purchase more raw materials and can prepare more incense sticks to sell at the market for more profit. She hopes she will be able to improve her family’s financial condition.

She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for incense-making.

loans.name: Artur

texts.en:
Artur lives in Ijevan city, in Tavush region. He is married, and he has two sons. Artur already had one rather successful and useful deal with Kiva, and he decided to cooperate for second time.

Artur was engaged in farming, and the first loan helped him to buy pigs and animal feed. He says that now his farm is bigger, and the income from it allowed him to start a new business -- he makes the sale of fruits and vegetables. In his business, his wife helps him very much. They sell potatoes, greens, tomatoes, carrots, radishes, and cabbage, and fruits including apples, grapes, lemons, mandarins, oranges, and bananas. He says, the most part of the fruits he brings from Georgia, on his own truck. Artur says his new business turned out to be very profitable. The income from it helped him to buy a truck, and to solve some financial problems of his family. (He paid tuition for his son and bought some furniture for their house.)

Now Artur asks a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams, in order to buy and bring from Georgia a great assortment of fruits.

loans.use: to buy and bring from Georgia a great assortment of fruits to sell

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a 33-year-old male, married, and expecting his first child. 

This is Emmanuel's first loan, in the amount of KES 20,000. He was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by the VisionFund Kenya officer. 

Emmanuel has a retail shop. His business is located at Mborachembe. He has been in this business for three years and he earns a monthly income of KES 6,050. 

Emmanuel is planning to use the loan to purchase more stock to sell to his customers. He will use the profit to expand the business. His hopes and dreams for the future are to expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell to his customers

loans.name: Flavio

texts.es:
Flavio tiene 61 años de edad, está casado y su esposa se dedica a la agricultura, tiene 3 hijos y nadie mas vive con ellos. 
Flavio es agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como maíz, también es jornalero y a su vez ganadero, actualmente cuenta con 6 semovientes de crianza (vacas) y un potrero donde se alimentan, esta actividad la realiza en  conjunto con su esposa quines tienen  mas de 20 años de dedicarse ha esta actividad. La familia de Flavio se dedicaba a la crianza de ganado, pues él manifiesta que la actividad es patrimonio familiar. El ganado lo compra en los tiangues aledaños a la zona y le queda a una distancia de 2 kilómetros de su casa.
El crédito solicitado será invertido, para comprar alimentos para el ganado y asi mantener gordas las vacas. 
Flavio sueña con tener una buena cantidad de ganado que le genere ingresos económicos para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Flavio is 61 years old. He is married, and his wife works in agriculture. He has three children; none of them live with them anymore.

Flavio is a farmer, growing staple grains like corn. He is also a day-laborer and a livestock producer. He currently has six head of cattle that he is raising and one pasture where they graze. He carries out this work together with his wife; they have more than 20 years experience in this line of work. Flavio's family worked in livestock production, so he states that this business is his family heritage. He buys the cattle in the local livestock markets located two kilometers from his house.

He will invest the requested loan in the purchase of feed for the cattle so that he can keep them fat.

Flavio dreams of having a good number of cattle that will generate economic income for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy feed for his cattle.

loans.name: Kalpana

texts.en:
Kalpana is a 22-year-old married woman and her husband is 27 years old. Kalpana has secondary level education but her husband completed up to grade 8. They live in a small town of Maynaguri region. Kalpana has one daughter who is too small for going to school. 

Kalpana faced many difficulties to manage the family expenses. Her husband runs a grocery shop but sales were not good due to the lack of variety in his merchandise.  Kalpana came to know about BJS (Kiva’s Partner) and learned that BJS gives financial support to poor women. Then she applied for a loan from BJS. With this loan amount she purchased a variety of grocery items and now their business is running very smoothly. She hopes she will enhance her grocery business with the business profit and also, she hopes she will be able to build a new shop with sufficient necessary grocery items that have great demand in her locality.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva as this money has helped them a lot.

loans.use: To buy a variety of grocery items to expand their existing grocery business.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 42-year-old man with five children aged 18, 17, 14, 11 and 7 years old, and whom he supports. 

This is his fourth loan of KES 35,000. He was introduced to Vision Fund Kenya by the Vision Fund officer. He has cereals and a grocery shop, and his business is located in Hindi. He has been in this business for eight years and he earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. He is planning to use the loan to purchase more cereals to sell to his customers. He will use the profit to buy livestock. 

His hopes and dreams for the future are to buy a plot and build rental houses, and educate his children.

loans.use: To purchase more cereals to sell to his customers

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is 39 years old and lives with her husband and their one child, in the city of Accra-Teshie, Ghana. For more than five years, Rita has dedicated herself to her business selling groceries. After going to school, she learned how to make these products, which she now makes and sells out of her home. She is requesting a loan to purchase detergent, dippers, sardines, tinned tomatoes, milk, eggs, etcetera, to sell to customers. With this investment, she plans to grow her business and earn more profits. Her goal is to have a central location in the city, so she can sell more food.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell, including detergent, tinned tomatoes, and eggs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to register land her mother left her as inheritance.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou works hard to support her family. She is married, and she has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 16 years.

Marilou requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF. She will use this amount to buy additional fish to sell. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and she is requesting a new loan now, to further build her business.

Marilou would like to build and expand her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Borik

texts.en:
Borik is 49 years old and lives in the village of Tandzaver in Syunik region. He is really an owner of a big and rich farm. In his farm, he breeds 60 sheep and 40 lambs. The care of all his farm cattle is equally divided between all his family members.
